title: Commercial Business Development Manager
description:
We are the Canadian Division of Stewart Title Guaranty Company, a leading provider of residential and commercial title insurance. As one of the largest title insurers in the world, Stewart Title specializes in providing our clients with exceptional service, deep expertise and innovative solutions to help close their real estate transactions with peace of mind.
Job Description
Job Summary
Based in Vancouver Canada, Stewart’s Commercial Business Development (“BD”) Manager is responsible for growing and supporting Stewart’s commercial client base in Western Canada with a primary focus on British Columbia. This opportunity is ideally suited for individuals practicing real estate law or with business development experience in mortgage lending, commercial insurance or with legal products.* Identifying commercial title insurance opportunities that increase Stewart’s market share & revenue
* Expanding Stewart’s relationships with lawyers, lenders & real estate industry through client & prospect visits
* Managing day-to-day needs of existing client base, including responding to client inquiries & providing quotes
* Identifying regionally specific opportunities for new coverage & services– including business case writing & analysis
* Responding to requests from underwriting on matters pertaining to local real estate law, risks and procedures
* Assisting in setting commercial strategy and working to achieve established goals
* Becoming a subject matter expert and champion for Stewart products
* Conducting presentations outlining the value of commercial title insurance
* Soliciting opportunities to participate on industry related organizations
* Providing market review, analysis & feedback
* Keeping informed of industry news & issues that affect the real estate market
* Assisting with internal & external training initiatives
* Supporting other BD managers with introductions, joint meetings & collaborations
* Developing written content and presenting on the topic of title insurance at industry events
* Organizing and attending Stewart events
* Attending industry trade shows, conferences & client events
* Other duties as required or assigned


Qualifications* Law Degree, MBA or equivalent education
* At least 5 years’ experience in real estate law or business development experience in mortgage lending, commercial insurance or with legal products
* Maintaining membership in good standing with a law society (if applicable)
* Ability to be licensed with the Insurance Counsel of BC (criminal record search required)
* Valid and in good standing driver’s license (driver’s abstract required)
* Willing to travel (up to 5%)
* Ability to work from home & in the field
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent organizational and scheduling skills
* Excellent problem-solving capabilities and the ability to troubleshoot
* Excellent interpersonal skills & the ability to build strong relationships
* Background knowledge of title insurance is an asset


Salary Range - 100k to 130k Annual
Please note that salaries are dependent on various matrix including experience, education, skills etc.
Stewart Title is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation during any aspect of the application process, please let us know. We can be reached by:* Email (INTLresumes@stewart.com)
* Telephone: 416.307.3300 (please ask to speak to a Human Resources representative)
* Mail: 200 Bay Street, North Tower, Suite 2600, Toronto, ON M5J 2J2
* Fax: 416.981.7214


Privacy
Your privacy is important to us. We consider and define Personal Information as any data relating to an individual, whether it relates to his or her private, professional or public life. It can be anything from a name, a photo, an email address, bank details or posts on social media. We only collect, store, use and disclose Personal Information from prospective and current employees for legitimate employment, legal, and business purposes. You can learn more about how we handle and process your personal information in relation to our recruitment process by making a request to our Human Resources department.

title: Account Manager – IT
description:
Account Manager – IT

Hedges Information Technology established in 2014 is an award-winning ISO 9001:2015 certified System Integrator based in UAE with offices in Dubai & RAK.

Hedges IT delivers digital transformation and technology services in Data canter’s, Infrastructure, Storage, AI/IOT, ELV & Automation domains. Hedges IT is positioned as one of most reliable service providers in UAE market with technology industry’s top Tier 1 vendors with inhouse expertise & partnerships.

Hedges IT has strategic alliances with world class hardware and software vendors to design, integrate, and implement comprehensive state-of-the art solutions, technologies, and IT services thereby adding value to our customers.**\\*Urgent hiring :**

**Candidate who can join immediately, reseller / SI background with strong customer base in Dubai & Northern Emirates mandatory,** ***candidates with other industry experience please do not apply*** **& will not be considered\\***

Location: - Dubai

Experience :- 4 - 5 years (only from System Integrator, Solution selling background, based in UAE & possess strong Enterprise/ SB client database will only be considered), Candidates with other industry background please do not apply.

Salary: AED 7,500.00 – 8,000.00 plus variables

**IT Business Unit :** Infrastructure, Data Centre, Enterprise storage, Enterprise Data Management, Business continuity solutions, Cloud Solutions, Cyber Security, Networking, IT Managed & AMC Services, IT Asset Management, Unified communication etc.

Solid sales background with experience in IT System Integration & Solution provider background with strong customer database managing Small business, Mid Market & Enterprise accounts.

* 4 - 5 years of experience in Sales/Account Management role with Enterprise SI/ solution provider managing UAE based clients.
* Identify and cultivate new business opportunities in ICT sector.
* Understand client requirements and offer customized solutions to address IT transformation challenges, core Infrastructure needs, Hardware refresh, IT Enterprise requirements.
* Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations to potential clients.
* Negotiate and close sales agreements while ensuring client satisfaction by creating a solution proposal.
* Regularly submit sales reports and forecasts.
* Responsible for the UAE sales and business development.
* Identifying highly potential business opportunities and pitch IT Services business accordingly.
* Develop detailed account level plans so as to provide accurate forecasts on a monthly, quarterly & annual basis
* Monthly, weekly and quarterly reporting on all sales activities like leads, sales, collection
* . Generating business in new accounts and expand business in existing accounts.
* . Working proactively on all leads and opportunities and drive them towards closure.
* . Achieve or exceed assigned quarterly sales targets
* . Work internally to solve any issues on your accounts including any technical escalations, finance or operational issues
* . Be able to engage with vendors, distribution team, internal support teams to win projects & deal closures.
* . Build and maintain key relationships within each customers procurement, IT, Finance and senior management teams
* Collaborate with the technical, pre sales & project management team to ensure successful closure of sales cycle.

**Requirements:**

* Proven IT sales experience in solution selling, system integrator.
* Have strong active customer database & generate regular business.
* Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level
* Goal oriented, dynamic to achieve the sales target and closing business deals.
* Bachelor’s degree in business, IT, or a related field (preferred).
* Profound knowledge of products, technologies, and trends.
* Strong verbal and written communication skill

**UAE driving license & car mandatory**

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $7,500.00 - $8,000.00 per month

Experience level:

* 4 years
* 5 years

Work Location: Remote

title: Business Development Manager
description:
We are currently seeking an experienced and results-driven Business Development Manager to join our team. As a Business Development Manager, you will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, building relationships with potential clients, and driving the growth of our company. The ideal candidate has a strong sales background, excellent communication skills, and a proven track record in generating business leads and closing deals.


**Responsibilities****:**


* Identify and target new business opportunities through market research and prospecting.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with potential clients, including conducting sales presentations and negotiations.
* Develop and implement effective sales strategies to achieve business growth targets.
* Collaborate with internal teams to develop customized solutions and proposals for clients.
* Monitor market trends and competitor activities to identify potential risks and opportunities.
* Prepare and present regular sales reports and forecasts to the management team.
* Attend industry events and conferences to expand networks and promote company offerings.
* Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies relevant to our business.
* Conduct market analysis to identify potential areas for expansion and growth.
* Provide feedback and input to product development and marketing teams based on client needs and market insights.


**Requirements:**


* Proven experience as a Business Development Manager or in a similar role.
* Strong sales and negotiation skills, with a track record of achieving or exceeding sales targets.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with clients.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Proactive and self-motivated with a results-oriented mindset.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Familiarity with market research and analysis techniques.
* Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field is preferred.


Job Type: Full-time


**Benefits:**


* Competitive salary and commission structure
* Health insurance
* Retirement savings plan
* Paid time off

title: Tax Associate
description:
```Job Summary```  
We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Tax Associate to join our team. As a Tax Associate, you will be responsible for assisting with tax preparation and compliance tasks. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is looking to develop their skills in tax accounting and gain valuable experience in a professional setting.

```Duties```  
- Prepare and review individual, corporate, and partnership tax returns  
- Assist with tax planning and research  
- Conduct financial analysis and prepare reports  
- Assist with budgeting and forecasting  
- Ensure compliance with regulatory reporting requirements  
- Perform account analysis and reconciliation  
- Assist with accounts payable and payroll processing  
- Contribute to the preparation of financial statements  
- Maintain knowledge of current tax laws and regulations  
- Collaborate with team members to ensure accurate and timely completion of tasks

```Requirements```  
- Bachelor's degree in accounting or related field  
- Strong knowledge of double-entry bookkeeping principles  
- Familiarity with corporate accounting practices  
- Proficiency in financial statement preparation  
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills  
- Attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and calculations  
- Knowledge of securities law is a plus  
- Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines  
- Strong written and verbal communication skills

Join our team as a Tax Associate and gain valuable experience in tax accounting while working in a supportive and collaborative environment. We offer competitive compensation, professional development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Note: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the position. It is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, or qualifications required.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Seasonal

Pay: $45,000.00 - $57,433.09 per year

* Professional development assistance
* Profit sharing
* Work from home

Experience level:

* 3 years
* 5 years

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Year round work

Education:

Work Location: Remote

title: ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT- CHARTWELLS HIGHER EDUCATION- NATIONAL
description:
Compass Corporate
**Position Title:** **ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT- CHARTWELLS HIGHER EDUCATION- NATIONAL**


**A family of companies and experiences**


As the leading foodservice and support services company, Compass Group USA is known for our great people, great service and our great results. If you’ve been hungry and away from home, chances are you’ve tasted Compass Group’s delicious food and experienced our outstanding service. Our 225,000 associates work in award-winning restaurants, corporate cafes, hospitals, schools, arenas, museums, and more in all 50 states. Our reach is constantly expanding to shape the industry and create new opportunities for innovation. Join the Compass family today!

**great people. great services. great results.**


Each and every individual plays a key role in the growth and legacy of our company. We know the next big idea can come from anyone. We encourage developing and attracting expertise that differentiates us as a company as we continue to raise the bar.

  



  

**Job Summary**
---------------



Chartwells Higher Education is seeking an Associate Director of Business Development who shares our values, wants to work with a team of great individuals, who must win and wants to join winners, and is committed to contributing to and being part of our success. Reporting to the National Vice President of Strategic Partnerships, the Associate Director of Business Development will support the sales directors to aggressively sell business to the higher education sector, generating leads and developing prospects, and projects nationally throughout the US.  



  

The successful candidate will share our values of excellence and integrity. The candidate will work with a sense of urgency with our sales directors and prospective clients to understand their current and future foodservice needs. The Associate Director of Business Development will support the sales directors and educate prospects on the benefits of working with Chartwells by clearly establishing the value of our services and how we are distinguished from our competitors - with our service, our culture, and our commitment to the very best student and client experience.
  

  

Essential Functions and Key Tasks:  

* Associate Director of Business Development
* Reports to Senior Vice President of Sales
* National territory
* 60% Travel


  

Responsibilities include:
  

* High degree of Cold Call Prospecting
* Time and Territory Management
* Trade Show Support
* Building strong internal and external relationships
* Proposal Development/RFP Responses
* Database Management / Maintenance
* Presentations
* Survey Support / Execution
* Initial Prospect Qualification
* Developing financial proformas
* Contract Support
* Client meetings
  

  

Education and Experience:  

* Ability to listen to prospects, understand their needs and communicate effectively (oral and written communication) both externally with prospects and clients and internally within our organization
* Ability to build and foster relationships with individuals at all levels, being a true representative of the Chartwells Higher Education culture and brand, and ability to close the deal.
* Ability to understand financials and meet financial quotas
* In-depth knowledge of food service operations within higher education
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in a Business Development role in the food service management industry
* Proficient computer skills (MS Office, CRM) and financial acumen
* Proven track record of exceeding sales targets in the assigned sales territory
* Bachelor’s Degree is required
* Must live near a major airport
**Apply to Compass Group today!**

**Click here to Learn More about the Compass Story**

 **Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.**

We encourage applicants with a criminal history (and driving history) to apply.**

title: Sr. Director of Business Development (Remote- US Based)
description:
**Job Summary**



Togetherwork provides Software-as-a-Service solutions to several communities and businesses, dedicated to delivering innovative solutions that enable our clients to better serve their communities. With a commitment to excellence, we are at the forefront of the industry, driving growth and building lasting customer relationships. As we expand our operations, we are seeking a dynamic and strategic Senior Sales Director to lead and inspire our three distinct sales teams.



As the Senior Sales Director, you will be a key leader within the Togetherwork organization, responsible for overseeing and driving the performance of three distinct sales teams within the Recreation and Leisure business unit. This role demands a strategic mindset, exceptional leadership skills, an analytical approach, and a proven history in sales management in perpetual growth environments. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the sales strategy, fostering collaboration, and ensuring the achievement of revenue targets.


**Responsibilities**


***Leadership and Team Management:***


* Provide visionary leadership to multiple sales teams, each focused on specific markets and product lines.
* Foster a high-performance culture, setting clear expectations and accountability, motivating teams to achieve and exceed sales targets.
* Conduct regular collaborative, weekly sales, and marketing KPI reviews, and mentorship sessions for team members.


***Sales Strategy and Planning:***


* Develop and execute comprehensive sales strategies aligned with overall product goals.
* Collaborate with executive leadership to define sales objectives, quotas, and budgetary requirements.
* Analyze market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedback to inform strategic decision-making.


***Cross-Functional Collaboration:***


* Work closely with marketing, product development, and customer support teams to ensure alignment across departments and provide critical customer feedback.
* Collaborate with other senior leaders to drive integrated business strategies and foster a cohesive organizational culture.


***Sales Performance and Reporting:***


* Monitor and analyze sales performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
* Generate regular reports for executive leadership, providing insights into sales trends, forecasts, and key performance indicators.


**Requirements**


* Proven experience in senior sales leadership roles with a focus on managing multiple sales teams in transactional sales environment with short sales cycles.
* Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills.
* Exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and people skills.
* Results-oriented mindset with a history of meeting and exceeding sales targets.


**Excited about this role but don't meet every single requirement?** Studies have shown that women and other marginalized groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Togetherwork we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.


**The Company offers a comprehensive employee benefits program, including:**


* Medical, dental, and vision insurance options
* 100% Employer paid short/long term disability
* Basic Life
* 401(k) option with 100% company match
* Flexible paid personal/vacation time built on mutual trust and accountability
* 10 sick days annually
* 10 company paid holidays
* 6 weeks paid parental leave


**Inclusion and Diversity:** Togetherwork is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We are a company where diverse backgrounds, experiences and viewpoints are valued. Togetherwork does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, age, ethnic or national origin, or any other basis protected by all local, state or federal laws.


***Salary Range Disclosure***


*The base range represents the low and high end of the Togetherwork salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including, but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Togetherwork's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include discretionary bonuses, long term incentives, a flexible paid vacation/personal time policy, 6 weeks paid parental leave and more.*


***Salary Range***


*US Remote: $100,000 - $135,000 USD per year; OTE $200,000*



Togetherwork provides integrated software and financial solutions to a wide range of communities and organizations including associations, camps, unions, fraternities & sororities, gyms, dance studios, religious congregations, pet services, and more.



Our mission-critical tools help our customers manage and grow their communities, and enhance the depth and breadth of their member engagement. Our team is united in its desire to help our clients better serve and empower their communities.

  

CCPA Disclosure Notice: Click Here

title: Accountant
description:
Points of Light mobilizes millions of people to take action that is changing the world. Through 145 affiliates across 39 countries, and in partnership with thousands of nonprofits and businesses, Points of Light engages 3.7 million volunteers in 16.7 million hours of service each year. We bring the power of people to bear where it’s needed most. For more information, visit pointsoflight.org.

**Reports to:** Controller

**Department:** Finance

**Location:** Atlanta, GA – While Points of Light has embraced remote working, this position requires the applicant to work in the Atlanta office as needed; typically, 1 to 2 days a week.

**Position Summary**: Points of Light is seeking an accountant, who will plan, organize and execute the accounts payable/receivable and other related functions of the organization. This position ensures the accuracy of the accounts payable/receivable process and compliance with Points of Light’s policies and procedures. The accountant serves as the primary point of contact with our affiliates and vendors and will develop a comprehensive understanding of the organization’s financial responsibilities.

**Position Functions and Responsibilities include:**

* Maintain invoice processing system and prioritize vendor and affiliate payments.
* Develop and document accounting policies and procedures for accounts payable/receivable and internal controls affecting the accounting team.
* Perform all month-end close responsibilities, including balance sheet and income statement journal entries for POL departments.
* Communicate and interact collegiately with internal constituents, vendors and affiliates.
* Process payments – check, ACH, international wires.
* Assist with various projects such as process improvement activities and training of finance policies and systems.
* Oversee credit card issuance, training, processing, reconciliation, and receipting.
* Manage travel expenses and related systems.
* Handle 1099 processing and issuance.
* Help with cash management and analysis.
* Assist with annual audit by creating compliant documentation and support for financial statements and internal controls.
* Partner with other members of the finance team and assist with monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue forecasts and analysis.
* Support other departments to explain/resolve revenue- related questions/issues, proposals and projects.

**Core Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Speed, with attention to detail and accuracy.
* Excellent memory for programs, transactions, vendors, and constituents.
* Ability to interact professionally with a wide range of people.
* Responsive, positive, “can do” attitude.
* Quick learner, self-starter and adaptable.
* Strong research and analytic skills; propose solutions to problems and answers to questions.
* Ability to find opportunities to improve systems, processes, and documentation.
* Heightened awareness of cybersecurity risks to proprietary data and daily commitment to zero loss prevention.
* The highest ethical personal standards as befits someone with access to confidential employee and private donor data.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum 3-4 years of experience in accounting, undergraduate accounting degree preferred; nonprofit experience a plus.
* Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (advanced Excel), Sharepoint, and Concur or similar A/P and expense reporting applications.
* Excellent written and oral communication, organizational and analytical skills.
* Ability to work independently to identify and resolve problems, while producing timely results.
* Blackbaud (ERP) experience a plus, also Sage Intaact, Microsoft Dynamics, or similar cloud-based ERP systems.

**Culture and Values:** Points of Light has a 30-year history that it seeks to honor, while looking toward the future as an innovative thought leader in the social sector. We have a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Our organization values innovation, dedication, teamwork and respectfulness. We enjoy thinking big, but also working hard to deliver our best work. Our team is solution-oriented, looking for someone who is always ready to deliver on ways to solve challenges, both internally and with external partners.

**What We Offer:** Competitive compensation and excellent benefits including a robust PTO program: 18 days of PTO, 13 holidays, and 1 floating holiday; plus, we are closed December 25 to January 1 for winter break. Medical, dental and vision benefits offered, free life insurance, along with long-term and short-term disability, a 403b program with employer match, and 1 day of volunteer time off per month.

***Points of Light is an Equal Opportunity Employer Committed to an Inclusive Workplace.***

title: Billing Support Specialist - Remote US
description:

--------------------



We are looking for a Billing Support Specialist to join Seamless.AI on its mission to positively impact 1 Billion people. ### **Check out what our employees think about working at Seamless:** **CLICK HERE**

  

Seamless.AI has been delivering the world's best sales leads since 2015. We have been recognized as one of Ohio's fastest growing companies and won 2020 Best Places to Work, LinkedIn's Top 50 Tech Startups in 2020,2022, and 2023, Purpose Jobs 2023 Best Workplace Culture and Best Work-life balance, and Purpose Jobs best place to work in 2024. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Visa Sponsorship is not included in our hiring package. Applicants will need to be authorized to work in the U.S.

title: Underwriter
description:
**Join our team and accelerate your career.**  

Modern Life combines advanced technology with the advice of the country’s top life insurance experts. We help advisors streamline their practice, so they can focus on building better connections, delivering better solutions, and helping their clients lead better lives.  

We have raised $15M in seed funding, led by Thrive Capital, with participation from 12 unicorn founders from Hippo, Plaid, Reddit, Flatiron Health, Newfront, At Bay, Vouch, Cedar, Lattice, and more.  

As our Underwriter, you will be responsible for underwriting all of Modern Life’s cases, including complex medical and financial underwriting scenarios, using extensive subject matter knowledge and sound underwriting principles. The right candidate will have an advanced understanding of the US life insurance market, carrier underwriting manuals, the reinsurance market, underwriting sweet spots, a strong network within the industry, and the ability to credibly influence carrier underwriting decisions to gain confidence from our advisors and team members.
### **What You'll Do:**

* Review medical records to underwrite preliminary and formal applications, providing guidance to advisors and internal team members.
* Write underwriting cover letters to position cases and negotiate underwriting offers with insurance carrier underwriters to advocate for the best rate class
* Serve as underwriting expert and liaison to work cross-functionally with colleagues and partners in product, engineering, operations, marketing, etc
* Creation of specific recommendations and action plans to drive automated underwriting decisions and process improvement across underwriting and case management
* Maintain appropriate documentation for underwriting criteria, guidelines and workflows
* Work with engineers to serve as a business liaison in order to efficiently integrate new data, models, partners programs, and applications as the need arises

### **Who You Are:**

* 5+ years of life underwriting experience with strong underwriting and medical acumen
* Extensive experience negotiating underwriting offers with insurance carriers
* Demonstrate empathy for Financial Advisors’ challenges
* Intellectually curious
* Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment
* Highly organized and able to adapt to changing priorities
* FALU or FLMI designations are a plus!

title: Law Office Bookkeeper
description:
**Job Summary**

The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of financial concepts, is proficient in Quickbooks, Micrsoft Excel, MS Outlook, Adobe, Sharepoint, and has excellent attention to detail.

title: Assistant Controller
description:
**At Athelas and Commure, we're bringing simple, life-changing health care products and medical billing services to people around the globe.**


In addition to our established Remote Patient Monitoring business, we introduced a rapidly expanding SaaS Revenue Cycle Management solution in 2022 that provides revenue intelligence for hundreds of healthcare businesses from small clinics to large health systems. Our state-of-the-art dashboard, Athelas Insights, provides practices with an unparalleled understanding into their financial health to help them with all aspects of RCM, including eligibility, rejections, denials, as well as coding optimization and more.


To keep pace with our remarkable momentum - having seen a 5x increase in revenue over the past 6 months with more exponential growth on the horizon - we're actively seeking new, high-impact team members looking for a challenge!


Commure and Athelas have recently joined forces to form healthcare’s next-generation operating system. Through its pioneering AI-powered platform, the newly combined Commure gives time back to clinicians and staff at hospitals and health systems across the U.S. with easy-to-use clinical, financial, and operational solutions.


Together, we’re on a mission to connect, protect, and empower healthcare by developing groundbreaking and hyper-connected technologies. We believe deeply that by joining our many datasets and digital solutions together in harmony, we can solve our industry’s biggest challenges: improving the experiences of our care providers, bringing down the cost of care, and ensuring the health and wellbeing of our communities.


Combined, Commure and Athelas is backed by General Catalyst, Sequoia, Y Combinator, Lux, Human Capital, 8VC, Greenoaks Capital and Elad Gil.


If you want to improve healthcare innovation through close partnerships between developers and doctors, come work with us!


Commure + Athelas is looking for an Assistant Controller to play a critical role in supporting the accounting operations and financial reporting of the company.


Reporting into the Chief Financial Officer,you will be a crucial member of the Finance team at Commure. You will ensure the accuracy of the financial records, providing timely and insightful analysis, and assisting in the overall application of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) along with Domestic/International Audit and Tax compliance. With your strong leadership, high EQ, and proactive problem-solving approach- you'll be viewed as a leader and key liaison with the functional teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Manage all monthly, quarterly and year-end closings including year-end audit and the preparation of internal and external consolidated financial statements.
* Manage annual audit process and oversee preparation of audited financial statements.
* Partner with FP&A to ensure accurate reported results and forecasts, and provide management with timely financial information for effective strategic decision making.
* Oversee all general ledger, accounts payable, payroll and fixed asset activities, ensuring accurate and timely processing of transactions and compliance with internal policies.
* Responsible for all technical accounting including revenue recognition, implementation of new standards and compliance with all relevant existing standards.
* Supports the Company’s tax consultants to oversee the preparation and filing of the various tax returns, quarterly and annual tax provisions, and other tax projects.
* Ensure compliance with local, state, federal and international tax rules and regulations.
* Establish / refine, monitor and enforce appropriate internal controls, policies and procedures.
* Assess financial systems and process enhancements and drive improvements throughout the accounting organization.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of current accounting pronouncements, GAAP and other compliance issues.
* Support international expansion, partnering with Legal to support the establishment of legal entity and oversee accounting and payroll for international subsidiaries.
* Coach, mentor and develop staff, including overseeing new employee on-boarding and providing career development planning and opportunities.
* Empower employees to take responsibility for their jobs and goals. Delegate responsibility and expect accountability and regular feedback.
* Lead and support other duties and responsibilities as required.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business Administration or Finance with an Accounting emphasis preferred
* CPA Strongly preferred
* 8-10 years mix of public and private accounting experience, software/SaaS experience preferred.
* Thoroughly versed in GAAP, and have strong background in non-routine and complex transactions.
* Experience leading employees to meet the organization's expectations for productivity, quality, and goal accomplishment, while encouraging employee contribution and includes goal setting, feedback, and performance.

**Why You’ll Like Working with Athelas**

* Execution focused, driven team: Join a team with an incredible record - we are the smallest, fastest company in history to receive FDA hematology clearance. We are also the largest Remote Patient Monitoring company in the US, with a fast-growing SaaS Revenue Cycle Management business as well
* Technology Focus: Revolutionizing how technology can be used in the healthcare industry
* Strong Backing: $132M Series B raised from the likes of Sequoia, General Catalyst, Tribe, Y Combinator
* Mission Driven: We are changing the way healthcare is provided, bringing it directly to the people who need it with technology-enabled solutions
* Incredible Growth: Revenue growth of 5x over the past 6 months and we're just getting started!


Athelas is committed to creating and fostering a diverse team. We are open to all backgrounds and levels of experience, and believe that great people can always find a place. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to all applicants throughout the application process.  

  

Employees will act in accordance with the organization’s information security policies, to include but not limited to protecting assets from unauthorized access, disclosure, modification, destruction or interference nor execute particular security processes or activities. Employees will report to the information security office any confirmed or potential events or other risks to the organization.


Employees will be required to attest to these requirements upon hire and on an annual basis.


Compensation Range: $150K - $175K

title: Certified Public Accountant (CPA) - Tax Filing Specialist Maryland
description:
**Location:** Maryland, USA (Remote)

**Company:** Intellectmap

**About Us:**  
Intellectmap is a leading provider of secure, AI-based solutions for businesses of all sizes, revolutionizing the transition from physical properties to digital offices within the AI Metaverse. Our mission is to enable remote work while facilitating seamless collaboration among coworkers and AI avatars. Join us in pioneering the future of real estate.

**Job Description:**  
We are currently seeking a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) with expertise in federal and state tax filing procedures, specifically in the state of Maryland. The ideal candidate will possess in-depth knowledge of tax laws and regulations and be proficient in utilizing the Desktop version of QuickBooks for efficient tax preparation and filing.

**Responsibilities:**

* Prepare and file federal and state tax returns accurately and timely for individuals and businesses in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
* Utilize the Desktop version of QuickBooks for tax preparation and filing.
* Conduct thorough reviews of financial records, ensuring accuracy and completeness of information for tax purposes.
* Provide expert advice and guidance to clients on tax planning strategies and compliance matters.
* Communicate effectively with clients to address inquiries, provide updates on tax filings, and offer valuable insights on tax-related matters.
* Stay abreast of changes in tax laws and regulations and implement necessary adjustments in tax filing processes accordingly.
* Collaborate with other team members to streamline tax preparation processes and enhance overall efficiency.

**Requirements:**

* Certified Public Accountant (CPA) license in good standing.
* Proven experience in preparing and filing federal and state tax returns, with a focus on Maryland tax laws and regulations.
* Proficiency in using the Desktop version of QuickBooks for tax preparation and filing.
* Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.
* Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in handling financial data.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Previous experience working in an accounting firm or similar environment.

title: Senior Bookkeeper & Project Manager
description:
**Job Overview**

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced client-facing Senior Bookkeeper & Bookkeeping Project Manager to join our team. In this role you will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records and performing various accounting tasks, as well as managing a small team and a variety of accounting projects. This is a key role within our organization, and we are looking for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and has a strong understanding of financial concepts.

**Responsibilities**

- Prepare and maintain financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements

- Perform account reconciliations to ensure accuracy and completeness of financial data

- Prepare journal entries and post them to the general ledger

- Process payroll and ensure compliance with relevant regulations

- Assist with tax preparation and filing

- Conduct account analysis to identify discrepancies or issues

- Collaborate with other departments to gather financial information and provide support as needed

- Stay updated on changes in accounting regulations and ensure compliance with GAAP

- Hire and manage a small bookkeeping team and the projects within

- Work closely with clients to manage their accounts via email, phone and Zoom meetings

**Experience**

- Proven experience as a Senior Bookkeeper or similar role

- Proven experience managing a small team and accounting projects

- Proven experience working with clients, holding client meetings and exceeding client needs and expectations

- Strong knowledge of accounting principles and practices

- Proficient in using QBO, Xero and Google Workspace

- Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

- Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines

- Strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities

- Experience with bank reconciliation processes

- Familiarity with account analysis techniques

If you are a dedicated professional with a passion for numbers and a desire to contribute to the financial success of our organization, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join our team as a Senior Bookkeeper.

title: Non-Profit Corporate Accountant
description:
**STEAMpark Corporate Accountant**

**Job Description**

We are a non-profit organization looking for an exceptionally organized and detail-oriented Accountant to join our team. In this part-time role, you will help our entire team more effectively manage our programs through accurate and timely maintenance of the company’s financial systems, reports, and data.

The ideal candidate must have at least 5 years’ experience in the non-profit accounting field (specifically using QuickBooks Non-Profit Software), significant computer experience with Google suite of products, payroll bookkeeping and tax reporting experience. Excellent communication skills a plus, particularly if the candidate has experience working with donors, sponsors, vendors and customers. Tax and Payroll Accounting experience is a plus. Must have the ability to devote 15 hours a week but can be on a flexible schedule.

Job Type: Part-time, flexible schedule

Work Location: Remote

Pay: $30 per hour at an estimate of 15 hrs per week

**Responsibilities include:**

* Record transactions via bank feeds or manual entry
* Perform general ledger, bank account and credit card reconciliations
* Handle Accounts Receivable (A/R –from Individual Clients & Companies), invoice clients and collections
* Handle Accounts Payable (A/P – Vendors & Bills)
* Process employee reimbursements, receipts, and expense reports
* Assist with financial needs for Fundraising events
* Prepare weekly cash forecast
* Generate monthly financial reports
* Update donation information for Development staff/Executive Director
* Calculate pay and issue payments to employees - Contractor and W-2 payments
* Work with Gusto to prepare end of year W-2s and 1099s
* Maintain state corporate filings (Charity Registration, bi-annual Charities Gaming License, Annual Report)
* Coordinate communication/requests with Insurance Companies
* Assist in the preparation of the Annual Budget
* Coordinate with auditors for annual audit and Federal and State tax filings
* Assist in preparation of financial reports for quarterly Board meetings

**Desired Skills and Experience:**

* 5 years or more experience as a professional non-profit Accountant
* Bachelor’s degree in an accounting field or related discipline required
* Strong writing skills- able to communicate effectively with all members of STEAMpark as needed via email.
* Able to translate complicated concepts into clear and compelling visual narratives (infographics, icons, charts, data visualization).
* Highly proficient in Quickbooks Online.
* Extremely organized, self-starter, able to work independently as a virtual employee.
* Ability to devote approximately 15 hours a week to this position

Interested candidates, please send your resume to elaine.melia@steampark.orgfor consideration.

title: Business Development Manager, Supply - EMEA
description:
**Remote****,** **Ankara****,** **Türkiye****PubNative, Business**
------------------------------------------------------------------


  
### **Job description**

**Who We Are**



Verve Group has created a more efficient and privacy-focused way to buy and monetize advertising. Verve Group is an ecosystem of demand and supply technologies fusing data, media, and technology together to deliver results and growth to both advertisers and publishers–no matter the screen or location, no matter who, what, or where a customer is. With 30 offices across the globe and with an eye on servicing forward-thinking advertising customers, Verve Group’s solutions are trusted by more than 90 of the United States’ top 100 advertisers, 4,000 publishers globally, and the world’s top demand-side platforms. Verve Group is a subsidiary of Media and Games Invest (MGI).

  

PubNative, part of Verve Group, is a rapidly growing, global, in-app marketplace for app developers and performance marketers. As a trusted performance-centric ad marketplace, we enable publishers to maximize ad earnings with premium ad experiences and help marketers acquire high-quality users at scale, driving innovation and results in both the ID and ID-less privacy-first environments. We consistently top the charts for global publisher scale, unique user reach, and traffic quality, as determined by leading industry measurement companies.

  

**Who You Are**



You will be responsible for establishing and building relationships with free-to-play mobile in-app publishers that utilize ad monetization to generate revenue. You will identify new business opportunities with EMEA-based mobile publishers, with a main focus on France and Turkey.

  

***This position can be filled remotely in Turkey.***

 **What Will You Do**


* Manage an entire sales cycle from inception to deal closure, including: prospecting new partnerships, leading discovery calls, deal evaluation, creating proposals, contract negotiation, and successful onboarding with Sales Engineering & Account Management
* Work closely with internal teams such as Account Management, Ad Operations, and Yield Management to build a successful long-term partnership plan
* Identifying the needs of mobile in-app publishers from discovery meetings and using these insights to influence the product roadmap
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify trends and new opportunities for business growth
* Represent Verve Group at industry events throughout Europe
### **Job requirements**

**What Will You Bring**

* 3-5 years of experience in selling and servicing clients with digital media solutions
* Minimum of 2 years experience working with large publisher partners in the mobile (advertising) industry
* Experience in the programmatic advertising landscape as well as mobile in-app ad mediation / ad networks
* Strong understanding of current trends, patterns, and events in the mobile marketing industry
* **Exceptional communication and presentation skills in English are a must**
* Working proficiency in French or Turkish is a great plus
* Proactive problem-solving skills and excellent interpersonal skills
* User Acquisition experience is a plus but not required

 **What We Offer**


* Join one of the top privacy-first omnichannel ad platforms and gaming companies
* Be part of a multicultural team (55+ nationalities) that is bringing advertising to the next level
* Benefit from working with some of the most experienced professionals in our industry and constantly grow with us
* You will learn and evolve in an empowering environment characterized by entrepreneurial actions
* Responsibility, independence, and an opportunity to participate in projects that have a significant impact on Verve Group’s success
* 3 Wellness days per year to help you maintain your well-being (in Q1, Q2 and Q3 after min. 90 days of employment)
* Enhance your professional skills with a yearly training budget and improve your language skills through German and/or English classes.
* Work and Travel Program (monthly raffle after 2 years of employment)
* We are happy to build a great team together and we appreciate your help through our Employee Referral Bonus
* Align your interests with the company's success and take part in our Employee Shares Purchase Plan
* Additional benefits based on your location
* Fully remote work


Verve Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Manager, Policy Forms Quality & Compliance
description:
**Overview:**


If you're looking for the stability of a profitable, growing company with the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup, we're hiring. SageSure, a leader in catastrophe-exposed property insurance, is seeking a Manager, Policy Forms Quality & Compliance. In this pivotal role, you will play a key part in designing and executing tests to ensure that our policies in production align seamlessly with filed, approved, and intended rate, rule, and form manuals. Working in close collaboration with the Compliance Officer, you will oversee testing and audit routines, ensuring they effectively meet these objectives.



Your responsibilities will extend to conducting audits on our existing book of business, analyzing result trends, and implementing corrective processes to enhance quality outcomes. As a crucial member of the Program Operations team, the Manager of Policy Forms Quality & Compliance will contribute to establishing standardized business and technical requirements. This includes supporting documentation of requirements on individual projects, validating insurance product-related business and technical requirements, and obtaining necessary approvals.



To excel in this role, we seek a candidate with a robust background in insurance, encompassing a deep understanding of the market entry process. The ideal candidate will be adept at translating business requirements into precise technical specifications and securing agreement on the accuracy of the translation. A continuous improvement mindset, a sense of urgency, and motivation linked directly to enhanced quality results and process improvements are key attributes for success.

  


**What you'd be doing:**

  

* Collaborate with Compliance to design audit criteria and methodology, with a primary focus on identifying regulatory gaps in State requirements and product defects contrary to business design.
* Deliver audit results as primary objective.
* Engage with key stakeholders across Program Ops, Compliance, Product, Coverage and QA to design and implement routines and processes ensuring compliance requirements are met.
* Develop and refine processes for auditing and quality checking of personal and commercial production business.
* Establish reporting routines for trend analysis and communicating results.
* Identify and implement process improvement opportunities in audit/quality routines.
* Work closely with Director of Product and Coverage to ensure to ensure accurate interpretation of coverage forms and implications to the overall product relative to other forms and/or rating.
* Coordinate with the insurance product quality assurance function to improve understanding of product analysis requirements.
* Collaborate with the Director of Product Analysis to identify and implement opportunities to improve the overall quality and efficiency of requirements across the team.
* Work with key stakeholders on guidelines and product maintenance to ensure we comply with regulatory and state laws including Compliance, Director of Product and Coverage, and Product Development Program Director.
* Ensure correct and consistent changes are installed in the organization through change management and the establishment of proper controls.
* Actively participate in the delivery of changes to our current product analysis processes and procedures.
* Provide subject matter expertise in Personal Lines Insurance Coverage to support the organization.
* Work with Program Operations leadership and key stakeholders to improve processes and procedures.
* Ad-hoc initiatives and duties as they arise.

  


**We're looking for someone who has:**

  

* Bachelor's degree in Business/Insurance, Computer Science, or related discipline or equivalent relevant on-the-job training.
* 10+ years of Property & Casualty property insurance – Personal Insurance & Designations preferred.
* Significant experience with Personal Lines Forms, Rates, and UW Rules.
* Understanding of industry standards and regulatory requirements.
* Project Management experience.
* Experience with insurance policy administration and sales and service systems.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to convey complex issues and solutions appropriately, tailored to different audiences. Strong attention to detail with demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with a demonstrated sense of urgency.
* Ability to meet deadlines and manage large volumes of work throughout an organization.

  


**Highly preferred candidates also have:**


* Strong sense of ownership.
* Curiosity and passion to learn, understand, and solve.
* Ambition for growth.
* Demonstrate commitment to the team and willingness to help others get the job done.
* Experience working with SmartSheet, Confluence, and Jira
* Prior Commercial Lines Experience.


**About SageSure**:



As a Best Places to Work in Insurance Recipient for four years in a row (2020-2023), SageSure, one of the largest residential property insurance managing general underwriter (MGU) in the United States, is pioneering ways people protect their American Dream.



A leader in catastrophe-exposed property insurance, SageSure was founded in 2009 to deliver reliable products, exceptional customer experiences, and strong underwriting results in challenging insurance markets. SageSure currently operates in 14 states and provides home, flood, and commercial coverage on behalf of its highly rated carrier partners.



We have more than 600 employees working remotely or hybrid in one of our eight offices—Jersey City, NJ; Mountain View, CA; Chicago, IL; Tallahassee, FL; Cincinnati, OH; Houston, TX; Mt. Laurel, NJ; and Cheshire, CT—who are tackling the industry's toughest challenges.



We provide generous health benefits and perks, including tuition reimbursement, wellness allowance, paid volunteer time off, a matching 401K plan, and more.



SageSure is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer committed to building a workforce that reflects the spectrum of perspectives, experiences, and abilities of the world we live in. We recognize that our differences make us strong, and we actively seek out diverse candidates through partnerships with organizations, institutions and communities that represent various backgrounds. We champion belonging and inclusion for all identities, including, but not limited to, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, ability status, gender, and country of origin, striving to create a culture where all individuals feel valued, respected, and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.



Our nimble, highly responsive culture nurtures critical thinkers who run toward problems and engineer solutions. We relentlessly pursue better outcomes by investing in the technology, talent, and tools that position us to succeed in demanding markets. Come join our team! Visit sagesure.com/careers to find a position for you.

title: ACL/ CECL/ Credit Review Auditor
description:
**AAbout us**

AuditOne LLC is a leading independent provider of internal audit, loan review, IT audit, operations audit, and bank compliance audit services to financial institutions. We work with banks, credit unions and fintech clients in the Western states and throughout the USA.

This position is for an Audit Associate to work on Allowances for Credit Losses (ACL) and on credit modeling. The ability to do credit review or other credit/lending engagements would be very beneficial. The work will mostly be conducted remotely.

**Audit Associate – ACL/ CECL/ Credit Review**

Responsible for assessing a) financial institutions’ ACL loan loss reserving processes and practices per the new CECL standard, b) credit model governance in accordance with regulatory guidance requirements, c) Credit Review, d) Loan Services, e) SBA loans, and f) Loan Compliance audits, depending on the candidate’s experience and expertise. Major tasks include:

· Preparing and following up on an audit entry letter that includes documentation requests

· Completing audit programs by exercising independent judgment to document the testing performed, including clear statement of findings, recommendations and observations related to the provided evidence, per AuditOne LLC’s established audit procedures

· Preparing formal audit reports summarizing the audit program steps, and preparing supporting workpapers in accordance with AuditOne LLC Policy Manual requirements

· Communicating with the client during the engagement, including validating and confirming the facts that form preliminary findings and recommendations as reflected in the draft audit report

· Prompt follow-up on client questions/requests

Opportunity also exists to expand the position into other areas based on interest and capabilities, including SOX/FDICIA testing, and any specialty lending areas. While our client base is typically more focused on commercial lending, we do also have needs related to residential and consumer lending.

Job Type: Full-time

* Monday to Friday

title: Business Development Manager, Metering Services
description:
Posting Job Description

**About The Team** 

ACRT Services offers expert independent consulting solutions to utilities and associated organizations throughout the United States, including vegetation management consulting, arborist training, customized safety courses, technology solutions, utility metering services, and more. At ACRT Services, our organizational culture is built on four strategic pillars including the people and the amazing things they can accomplish, dedication and the success it brings over the long term, process and the benefits of a job done right and education and the difference it can mean in the lives of those we touch.

**About the Role**

The Business Development Manager, Metering Services reports to the Director of Business Development at ACRT Services. This position will play a key role in developing prospects within assigned markets and account territories while maintaining relationships with existing clients to increase sales of Bermex. This position requires a high degree of organization, excellent attention to detail, and exceptional communication skills.

**What You’ll Do**

Business Development

* Responsible for implementing sales objectives and strategies
* Initiate contact with prospective customers, identify and assess needs, propose, and obtain signed agreements for ACRT services; some cold calling is required
* Generate new business and ensure growth of existing accounts through relationship building, networking, and communication of service offerings
* Aid in the preparation of contractual provisions and proposals
* Coordinate proposals, contracts, and subcontracts, including the development of budget, and proposal preparation
* Assist the M&A Team with industry intelligence, target review and due diligence

Business Information Gathering & Maintenance

* Maintain current information as to trends and developments in business, present recommendations to sales team
* Maintain Sales pipeline
* Understanding of financial impacts and margins for products sold
* Research, develop, and present reports and proposals showing potential customers the cost benefit of purchasing company services
* Use technical knowledge of service offerings to support and build sales and communicate client feedback to sales and operations teams for future service developments
* Design proposals in response to RFPs
* Generate publication literature and webinars

Business Support

* Serve as the liaison between clients and ACRT Operations Representatives
* Serve as the lead in operational activities to achieve company goals
* Assist and support sales, marketing, operations, and support teams
* Attending industry tradeshows
* Presenting at events and tradeshows
* Take part in internal bid meetings and planning
* Assist and support sales, marketing, operations, and support teams as needed
* Ability to work through AMI/AMR Water Meter conversions
* Propose and monitor budgeting and spending
* Travel by plane or vehicle to current or prospective work sites (up to 60% travel)

Other duties as assigned

**About You**

Must haves:

* Education: High School diploma or GED
* Experience: At least 3 years of experience in utility infrastructure sales or utility infrastructure operations management

Nice to haves:

* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, or Economics
* Experience: At least 3 years of Senior Manager experience in the metering industry.
* At least 3 years of experience in operations management with relevant experience in metering, AMI/AMR project deployment.
* Experience with AMI/AMR communications hardware deployment.

Your Skills

* Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel (V-Look-ups, Pivot Tables, etc.)
* Strong collaborator: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional stakeholders.
* The ability to effectively communicate in visual, verbal, and written form with customer and employees.
* Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills.
* Ability to interact effectively with all levels in the organization.
* Excellent time management, organizational and problem-solving skills.
* Strong attention to detail.
* Self-starter, creative and innovative.
* Experience working through AMI/AMR Water Meter conversions.

**Benefits**

Health and Safety

* Group health plans including medical/prescription, dental, vision and a variety of other coverage options
* Company paid group life insurance, accidental death & dismemberment insurance, short and long term disability
* Flexible Spending Accounts or an option for a Health Saving Account with company match
* Company paid Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for all employees and eligible family members

Retirement

* Automatic enrollment in the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) at no cost
* Roth or Traditional 401(k) Retirement plan with company match

Time Off

* Paid Vacation and Sick Time
* Paid Holidays including the day after Thanksgiving and Christmas Eve
* Veterans Day paid time off for our veterans

Perks

* Company paid cellphone or mobile allowance
* Tuition reimbursement program
* We believe in being comfortable at work. ACRT Services has a business casual dress environment that allows you to wear jeans!

**Where We Work** 

At ACRT Services we prefer in-person employee interaction and we rely on collaboration among groups to be successful and agile, which means we expect work in the office to continue as an important part of our company culture and a key to employee success. **This position is a remote.**

Standard office equipment will be provided to work in the office and at home – a dedicated space at home to work is also required. Uninterrupted home-based internet is a must in your home to attend and host video calls, along with a minimum bandwidth speed of 20 mbps. If you do not have an in home office space or cannot meet the internet needs, an office space will be provided for you in the company’s Stow, Ohio office.

This position is not open to candidates located in Colorado/ California / Connecticut / Maryland / New Jersey / New York / Nevada / Rhode Island / Washington (state) / Toledo, Ohio and Cincinnati, Ohio.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Travel requirement:

* Travel

Work Location: Remote

Reporting to the Regional Vice President of Sales, this position is responsible for managing all sales activities within a defined geographical territory. title: Trade Operations Specialist
description:
**Trade Operations Specialist- $50k** *Starting as 1099 with a huge opportunity to grow with the organization and act as a partner in the business.* 

About Us: VIVAZEN isn't your average CPG company. We're a community on a mission to redefine "feel good" with plant-based solutions. We believe in natural ingredients, ancient wisdom, and modern results, crafting products that empower you to experience life to the fullest.

Our Story: Founded by dreamers and doers, VIVAZEN was born from a desire to find a better way to feel great. We craved a natural, effective, and convenient solution that aligned with our active and mindful lifestyles. After years of research and exploration, we discovered the power of ancient botanicals and their potential to promote wellbeing without compromise.

This Role: Starting as 1099 with a huge opportunity to grow with the organization and act as a partner in the business.

Job Overview:

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Trade Operations Specialist to join our team. This individual will be responsible for overseeing various aspects of trade marketing operations, including shipping orders for 1099 team members, fulfilling colleague requests, tracking inventory depletion, creating and tracking warehouse receiving orders, managing inventory distribution across multiple warehouses, and performing other duties as required. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is a requirement for this role.

Responsibilities:

* Shipping Trade Materials:
* Coordinate and facilitate the timely and accurate shipment of requests from 1099 team members.
* Fulfilling Colleague Requests:
* Respond promptly to requests from colleagues, fulfilling internal orders for Trade materials.
* Maintain a high level of customer service in all interactions.
* Inventory Tracking:
* Monitor and track inventory depletion levels to prevent stockouts.
* Warehouse Receiving Orders:
* Create and manage warehouse receiving orders, ensuring accurate documentation of incoming inventory.
* Collaborate with vendors and warehouses to streamline the shipping process.
* Inventory Distribution:
* Manage the distribution of inventory among various warehouses.
* Transfer inventory amongst warehouses as needed.
* Other Duties:
* Undertake additional responsibilities as required to support and enhance overall trade marketing operations.

Qualifications:

* Experience in operations or a related field.
* ERP Systems experience is a plus.
* Shipping experience is a plus.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is essential for data analysis and reporting.
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills with a keen eye for detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Ability to adapt to a dynamic work environment and prioritize tasks effectively.

title: Sr. Equity Research Analyst - Sell Side
description:
**About Us:**


We are seeking an accomplished Senior Equity Research Analyst to join our sell side team. We are dedicated to providing exceptional value to our clients' investment strategies through insightful and distinctive research. Our commitment to integrity, innovation, and excellence sets us apart in the industry.

 **Role Overview:**


As a Senior Equity Research Analyst, you will be at the forefront of our research efforts, delivering in-depth analysis that goes beyond the conventional. Your expertise will be crucial in deciphering market dynamics, understanding company performance, and identifying unique investment opportunities. You will collaborate closely with both clients and internal teams to share your insights and contribute to informed decision-making.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct comprehensive fundamental analysis, closely tracking industry trends, market developments, and company news.
* Utilize our proprietary research methodology to uncover distinct and valuable insights.
* Generate well-crafted written reports and comments that provide actionable investment recommendations.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date ratings for the stocks under your coverage.
* Develop and refine financial models to forecast company performance and valuation.
* Engage with clients, senior management of covered companies, and Sales and Trading Teams.
* Foster and leverage significant institutional relationships to enhance research depth and accuracy.

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field is required.
* Series 7 and Series 86/87 licenses are mandatory. Series 66 registration is essential to interact with clients.
* Exceptional integrity, a collaborative mindset, and a strong work ethic are paramount.
* Proficiency in financial modeling, valuation methodologies, and analytical techniques.
* Ideally possess CFA, MBA, or CPA credentials.
* A minimum of two years of sell-side experience with credible buy-side references.

 **Desired Skills and Experience:**

* In-depth understanding of proprietary research processes and methodologies.
* Track record of sourcing unique and valuable information that drives investment decisions.
* Participation in industry-specific events and trade shows is advantageous.
* Experience in client-facing roles, demonstrating effective communication and rapport-building skills.
* Samples of previous research work showcasing your analytical prowess.

  

$230,000 - $250,000

title: Blockchain Business Development Lead - Cosmos Hub
description:
Full Time



Canada, USA, UK, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Remote

 **About Informal**



Informal Systems is a remote-first company with offices in Toronto, Lausanne, Vienna and Berlin. We are structured like a worker’s cooperative, where important corporate actions are subject to one-person-one-vote democratic control by the member-employees.



We envision a sustainable future of cooperatively owned and governed, open-source, distributed organizations running on reliable distributed systems and are excited to grow the team with amazing individuals who believe in making this future a reality.



Informal is a core contributor to Cosmos, where we develop interoperable blockchain systems by heavily relying on formal verification tools and techniques (formal specification in TLA+, symbolic model checker Apalache, Model-Based Testing Framework, etc.).



The Cosmos technology stack, including Tendermint Core, the Cosmos-SDK, IBC, and the Cosmos Proof of Stake modules, is an industry leading toolkit, written in Go, for building, deploying, and running community owned decentralized networks. This technology is used today to secure many billions of dollars in cryptocurrency market capitalization.

 **About the Role**



As a Business Development Lead - Cosmos Hub at Informal Systems, you will play a pivotal role in expanding our reach within the Cosmos ecosystem and beyond. This position requires a dynamic individual with a deep understanding of the crypto, tokenomics, and protocol landscape, capable of bridging technical concepts with strategic business development (BD) initiatives. You will be instrumental in profiling and onboarding key partners, crafting compelling narratives alongside our product and marketing teams, and fostering community engagement through insightful research and content creation.

 **What your primary responsibilities will be:**


* Collaborate with product and marketing leads to develop winning narratives around our product roadmap and offerings.
* Research and write engaging content that simplifies complex topics for prospective audiences.
* Engage with ecosystem projects to establish partnerships with users of the Cosmos Hub’s products.
* Share ecosystem insights gained from your business development work, contributing to the team’s understanding of the industry landscape.
* Lead initiatives to bring in projects to use the Cosmos Hub’s security and other offerings and grow the ecosystem around the Cosmos Hub.
* Facilitate community feedback to improve and innovate product features and concepts championed by the Cosmos community and Informal Systems.
* Add to and manage a comprehensive database of leads for Informal Systems.

  


**What we look for in a successful Business Development Lead:**


* Experience in establishing partnerships in blockchain, understanding how to structure win - win deals
* Strong knowledge of the current crypto/tokenomics/protocol landscape.
* Ability to understand technical concepts and assess their potential outcomes.
* Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to identify, pursue and close complex partnerships
* Background in finance, economics, or computer science, with a preference for experience in VC, risk management, game theory, DEXes, security/protocol design, or smart contracts.
* Excellent content writing skills with the ability to engage a diverse audience.
* Independent worker with strong team collaboration skills.

 **Some of our benefits include:**


* A unique, caring and friendly culture (learn more about how we work here)
* 25 days (5 weeks) of paid vacation annually, plus 3 Spiritual Days
* Company closure from December 25th to January 1
* Annual Lifestyle benefits (reimbursements for gym memberships, fitness equipment, etc)
* A remote-first, flexible work environment
* A home-office stipend to set you up for success
* Annual company retreats
* Paid parental leave
* ….. and many more!

  



We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our organization. We are committed to equal employment opportunities and encourage applications from people of all race, religion, colour, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
