title: Reimbursement, Revenue Cycle Financial Analyst
description:
**Castle Biosciences Named a Winner of the 2023 Top Workplaces USA Award for the Second Year!**

**Castle Biosciences Inc.** is growing, and we are looking to hire a **Reimbursement, Revenue Cycle Financial Analyst working remotely,** with a preferred start date of April 1, 2024.


You won't find a work culture and benefits package like ours every day. We are filled with a team of colleagues who love working at Castle! If this sounds like the right opportunity for you in the essential biotech field, consider applying today! www.CastleBiosciences.com

**EXCEPTIONAL BENEFIT PACKAGE**

**Excellent Annual Salary + Achievable Annual Bonus Potential 20% or Salary + 20 accrued PTO Days annually**

**401K with 100% Company match of up to 6% of your Contribution, and No Waiting Period**

**4 health care plan options, with very low premium cost + Company HSA Contribution with HDHP option + Company Stock Grant Upon Hire**

**A DAY IN THE LIFE OF Reimbursement, Revenue Cycle Financial Analyst**

**The Revenue Cycle Financial Analyst will collaborate independently and with reimbursement leadership to review and audit laboratory billing and collections. This involves ensuring timely billing, adherence to insurance contracts and policies, monitoring payer trends, and proactively identifying potential risks and issues affecting revenue. This role will primarily focus on assisting with recovery efforts for both over-payments and under-payments against contracts and policies. Additionally, the individual will work closely with revenue cycle leadership to devise metrics aimed at minimizing payer denials and write-offs.**

**QUALIFICATIONS**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. \\***Please see the attached job description for additional roles, responsibilities, and technical requirements.**

**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE**

* **Minimum Requirements**
	+ Bachelor's degree in accounting, healthcare administration, business administration, finance, accounting, or related field required and/or equivalent combination of experience and education.
	+ Advanced experience working with large data sets and interpreting complex data to create meaningful reports and presentations.
	+ In-depth understanding of healthcare revenue cycle processes, including laboratory billing, reimbursement, and financial analysis.
	+ Actively displays behaviors that support the mission, vision, and values of Castle Biosciences.
	+ Ability to generate ad-hoc reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate analytical findings and insights to stakeholders effectively.
	+ Able to analyze financial data and recommend solutions to problems.
	+ Proficiency in using healthcare information systems and revenue cycle management software.
* **Preferred Requirements**
	+ At least four years of experience in revenue cycle analysis, healthcare finance, or related roles preferred.

**TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS**

* 10% as needed for training and meetings.

**READY TO JOIN OUR BIOTECH TEAM?**


We understand your time is valuable, and that is why we have a very quick and easy application process. If you feel that this would be the right position for you, please fill out our initial **3-minute, mobile-friendly application**. We look forward to meeting you!

**ABOUT CASTLE BIOSCIENCES INC.**


Castle Biosciences is improving health through our innovative tests that guide patient care. For the diseases that our portfolio of tests covers, we believe the traditional approach to developing a treatment plan for cancers and other diseases using clinical and pathology factors alone is inadequate and can be improved by incorporating the personalized information our tests provide. At Castle, we aim to transform disease management by keeping people first: patients, clinicians, employees, and investors. Since our inception in 2008, we have remained focused on this vision. This foundational strategy remains the guidepost for the direction of our company and the basis of our long-term value creation. Castle Biosciences Inc, ranked #188 by the Financial Times, Americas' Fastest-Growing Companies 2023.


The work of our employees directly influences our reputation. We are glad that our employees chose to join us, and work to ensure that they find their work to be both **challenging and rewarding**. We behave with **integrity** and treat our colleagues with **respect and kindness**. Our culture fosters an **environment of transparency and teamwork**. We prioritize and encourage **internal growth** and **professional development**.


Castle Biosciences is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.


An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veterans' status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Messages left for other purposes, such as following up on an application or technical issues not related to a disability, will not receive a response.

title: Income Tax Accountant | Bookkeeper
description:
**OVERVIEW**

Looking to hire an individual with **income tax and bookkeeping experience** to assist in the completion of business and partnership tax returns during tax season from 15 Feb to 15 Apr and 15 Aug to 15 Oct each year.

**CORE POSITION:**

**Accounting Firm**  
- data entry into tax prep software  
- clearing flags and completing tax return in **Drake**  
- organizing paperwork (electronically), ensuring complete files  
- draft correspondence, communicate with clients  
- bookkeeping regularly for current clients, and as needed for tax return preparation  
- handing client estimated tax payments

**REQUIREMENTS**

1. At least one year of experience using **Drake** for income tax preparation.

2. Incredible attention to detail, and the ability to focus on one thing at a time without surrounding external distractions.

3. Brings best self to this job; has an excellent attitude and leads with yes!

4. Prioritizes client confidentiality and has an inherent understanding of how electronic systems (file sharing platforms, iMessage, etc) work.

5. Takes the initiative to exceed expectations of management and clients.

**SCHEDULE / STRUCTURE**

Pretty flexible as long as the job gets done.

**IN-PERSON STATUS**

We're based in San Diego!  
However, candidate does not need to be in any particular part of the United States.  
Would work from home.

**COMPENSATION**

You'd be working on a very small team where communication, new ideas, and improvement are always encouraged!

(either will work, we have a slight preference for the team to be on a Mac)

We're ideally hiring for full-time, but we'd be open to 30hrs/wk or starting with less time and increasing over time. What would you prefer for number of hours each week during initial employment?

title: Strategic Account Manager (Remote GTA)
description:
**About Us**

Blume is on a mission to create a kinder wellness world. To us, it looks like simple, daily habits that fill your cup (both literally and figuratively). We are growing fast and are looking for a Business Development Manager to help us continue our retail push to get more cups to more people.

**About the job**

Based in Toronto, the Strategic Account Manager will work closely with our Head of Sales to deliver our annual revenue plan for Lifestyle, Natural, & Grocery across North America. This role is integral to the development and growth of Blume; you will use your passion for building relationships to build sales volume and brand presence effectively and efficiently. This is a fantastic role for someone who wants to work with a passionate team that wants you to grow and be successful in your career. If you’re results driven, personable, hands on and ready to join a rocket ship we want to hear from you!

**Responsibilities**:

* Grow Blume’s retail presence throughout North America with off shelf activations, increased velocity trade programs, and expansion into new customers
* Be an expert in trade management and ROI
* Develop new customers for Blume with focus on natural, grocery, and food service, including distributor onboarding, identifying key customers and markets, and building relationships
* Build sales strategy for new channels to help achieve Blume’s growth objectives
* Go deep with our current customers - foster current B2B relationships with regular communication, event planning and management.
* Partner with store owners and associates to achieve prominent merchandising placement as well as secondary display
* Lead product education trainings for new store openings + new product launches
* Occasional evening + weekend events to help support your key accounts, brand activation as well as trade shows
* Work collaboratively with our marketing and brand team to bring in-store events to life
* Exceed sales objectives, targets and defined KPI’s
* Other administrative duties as required

**What’s in it for you:**

* The opportunity to build something special and create a kinder wellness world
* Be a part of a creative and passionate team that never takes themselves too seriously
* We’re a fully remote team and we believe you work best where you’re most comfortable
* Extended health and dental benefits
* Free Blume lattes… need we say more?

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 5 years experience in sales
* 2+ years experience in sales strategy / trade marketing
* Degree in business, marketing, communications, or related work experience
* Ability to roll up your sleeves and get in the weeds as needed, but also able to think strategically at a high level
* Excellent understanding of numbers and the economics behind managing retail customers with the ability to organize data, interpret metrics, and identify trends. Experience in a P&L would be an asset
* Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
* Results-driven, self-starting team player
* Passion for wellness, personal development, and all things Blume
* Location: Remote in the GTA
* Have a car + driver’s license (mandatory)
* Travel as required up to 25% of the time

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $80,000.00-$90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental care
* Paid time off
* Store discount
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision care
* Wellness program
* Work from home

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus pay

Education:

* Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

* Sales: 2 years (required)

Work Location: Remote

Expected start date: 2024-04-08

title: Business Development Manager (CAN) - [SAL176B]
description:
Aperçu:

Who we are—  

Transcat is a dynamic, innovative, growing company that has been recognized as the leading calibration and compliance services provider in North America and beyond. With over 1,000 employees—in technical, consulting, operational, sales, finance, and corporate roles—we have stood the test of time by delivering on our Trust in Every Measure promise to our customers in vital industries, including life sciences, aerospace, defense, energy, and utilities. We fulfill this promise through our employees, who live Our Values every day, the Transcat Way. Our employees are at the center of the rewarding, challenging, and life-changing work we do for our customers and those they serve. Are you ready to join a company where the work you do makes a difference, and where you can grow in your career?  

Here’s what Transcat has to offer—* Work that matters
* A values-based culture where people care about each other and the work they do together
* Flexibility
* Training and development to accelerate learning and career advancement
* Competitive compensation and benefits, including paid time off, health insurance, tuition reimbursement, retirement, stock purchase plan, and MORE!

  

The BDM is expected to provide new sales revenue across all services offered by Transcat. Hired candidates are expected to work within their geographical territory and alongside assigned labs to perform outbound selling activities resulting in new sales generation.


Qualifications:
**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities*** Highly developed sales skills with particular emphasis on the generation of thorough and accurate customer needs assessments, solution development, and gaining/maintaining customer commitment.
* Strong negotiating skills.
* Ability to sell to multiple levels and constituencies in a client organization.
* Ability to develop and implement comprehensive territory sales plans with clearly defined objectives, strategies, and tactics.

**Education and Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
* Minimum of 2 years of business-to-business service sales experience, preferably in an industrial environment requiring some technical aptitude.
* Experience in working with compliance requirements of quality systems.
* Calibration service sales preferred but not mandatory.

**Physical Demands**The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit or stand, talk, hear, use hands to keyboard and use a computer. The employee is occasionally required to use hands to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

 **Work Environment**The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. **Equal Opportunity and Non-Discriminatio**n
Transcat is an equal-opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination on the basis of any protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, domestic violence victim status, gender identity, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national origin, pregnancy, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran or as a member of any other protected group or activity.  

We will make reasonable accommodations for personnel with disabilities to enable them to perform the essential functions of this position unless to do so poses an undue hardship on the company or a direct threat to health and safety.
Responsabilités:
* Drive the achievement of company monthly, quarterly, annual sales objectives in:
	+ Designated geographic area(s) surrounding assigned service centers
	+ ADM accounts with significant growth potential, at risk accounts, others as agreed upon in local markets surrounding Centers of Excellence
	+ BDM prospects/accounts in local markets and as assigned outside local markets
* Matrix Management of Calibration Sales Activities in Assigned Geographic Market(s):
	+ Achievement of new business calibration sales objectives or quota.
	+ Understanding of competition in the marketing place and adapt to changing market conditions to generate new sales.
	+ Ability to establish relationship equity for upsell opportunities within key accounts.
	+ Increase our organization’s market share and grow our geographical footprint within your territory.
	+ Leverage our organization’s service capabilities to drive calibration sales growth objectives and meet customer needs.
	+ Work cross-functionally with your operations partners to understand lab capabilities, issues, and lab-identified opportunities.
	+ Utilize CRM (Salesforce) for sales opportunity management and pipeline.
	+ Heavy outbound prospecting via email and phone to set new business meetings.
	+ Develop Territory Business Plan to Address:
		- Establishment and achievement of calibration sales objectives
		- Competitive situation and general market conditions
		- Key account business plans
		- Measurement & growth of Transcat calibration market share
		- Coordination of local market sales activities w/ADMs, CSMs & SAMs
		- Leveraging all Transcat service capabilities to drive Transcat’s calibration sales growth objectives and customer needs.
	+ Schedule meetings with customers
	+ Develop meeting agendas
	+ Publish notes/action items
		- Follow up on all assigned action items
			* Involve management/lab personnel as per Approval Matrix
		- Schedule meetings with customers
	+ Create and execute Signed Agreements/MSAs with all new customers following the Approval Matrix
	+ Lab relationships
		- Maintain regular communication with lab managers in order to understand capabilities, issues, and lab-identified opportunities
		- Bring in and work alongside lab management for all new opportunities. Follow the Approval Matrix with appropriate Operation Partners.
	+ Reporting/Communication
		- Daily:
			* Email/phone as needed to appropriate Transcat personnel or customers to address short term events/activities as needed. This includes up, down, and across Transcat & customer reporting matrix.
			* Record and update activities and perform hygiene on SFDC database as appropriate
		- Weekly:
			* Weekly conference calls with supervisor to review key open opportunities, current market environments, new programs, procedural changes, policy updates, etc.
* Model the companies values to influence others to perform in an aligned manner
* Other duties as assigned

 **Travel Requirements*** Daily or weekly travel within the regional territory is expected to handle meetings with prospective customer offices/facilities for the purpose of generating new business.
* Periodic site visits with technical staff may be required to visit customer facilities to develop plans to execute contracts, review capabilities, and determine appropriate pricing and asset needs to perform services.
* Visits to customer sites will be required to review scope of work
* Infrequent national travel outside the region may be needed for company-wide initiatives and meetings

title: Business Development Manager
description:
***About the Company***

Real Property Management Results is a leading residential property management company dedicated to providing exceptional services to property owners and residents alike. With a strong focus on client satisfaction and efficient property management solutions, we strive to exceed expectations in every aspect of our operations. We are currently recruiting a Business Development Manager to join our team!

***The Role***

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Business Development Manager to join our team and drive the growth of our residential property management business. The ideal candidate will be a motivated self-starter with a proven track record in sales and business development within the real estate industry.

The team member will have the opportunity to strategize and execute sales and marketing initiatives, follow up on leads and bring on new clients.

***Responsibilities:***

* Develop and implement strategic plans to expand the company's residential property management portfolio.
* Identify and pursue new business opportunities through networking, prospecting, and relationship building.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with property owners, real estate agents, and other industry professionals.
* Conduct market research and analysis to identify trends, competitive landscape, and potential areas for growth.
* Collaborate with internal teams to develop tailored solutions and proposals for prospective clients.
* Lead presentations and negotiations with potential clients to secure new business contracts.
* Monitor and evaluate the performance of business development activities, adjusting strategies as needed to achieve targets.
* Stay up-to-date on industry trends, regulations, and best practices to maintain a competitive edge.

***Qualifications***

* RECA Licensing in Property Management is mandatory for this role. You must either be licensed or able to complete the Property Management module with RECA within 2 months of employment.
* Ideally, a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Real Estate, or related field
* Proven track record of success in sales and business development, preferably within the residential property management or real estate industry.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport and negotiate effectively.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen eye for identifying business opportunities.
* Self-motivated and results-driven, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and CRM software.
* Valid driver's license and willingness to travel as needed.

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary and commission structure.
* Health and dental insurance options.
* Professional development and training opportunities.
* Collaborative and supportive work environment.

Join our team and play a key role in shaping the growth and success of our residential property management business. If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for sales and business development, we want to hear from you!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental care
* Extended health care
* Flexible schedule
* Work from home

Flexible Language Requirement:

* French not required

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus pay
* Commission pay

Experience:

* Property management: 1 year (preferred)
* Sales: 2 years (required)

Licence/Certification:

* Driver's License (required)
* RECA License in Property Management / Ability to Achieve (required)

Willingness to travel:

* 50% (preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Edmonton, AB T6N 1B7

Application deadline: 2024-03-20

title: Manager, Audit & Opex (Operational Expenditures) Accounting
description:
**#KeepGrowing with Nutrafol**
------------------------------



Come grow with us. We're a growing company. Everything we do, we do to help people grow into the best version of themselves.



As the pioneers of hair wellness, we create natural, clinically effective solutions for hair growth and provide support for people at every step of their hair journey. Our multi-factorial approach targets the root causes of hair thinning using a patented blend of medical-grade botanicals - and is recommended by over 3,000 physicians and hair professionals for trusted, reliable results.



We never settle, and are continuously challenging existing treatments and methodologies to advance the frontier of hair science. As we help our customers grow, we grow too - by embracing individuality and differences, leading by example, and empowering ourselves and others with our passion for wellness and innovation.



Keep growing. It's our mantra. Our commitment to helping anybody and everybody committed to realizing their own potential to grow.

**About You**



Nutrafol is seeking an experienced Manager, Audit & Operational Expenditures Accounting that will be responsible for overseeing the internal and external audit process, as well as overseeing Opex Accounting. You must be a highly driven, high-energy, focused individual that can work well with internal and external partners at all levels. You will be expected to problem solve, drive process improvements and exercise good business judgment. You will be working closely with the Accounting team and maintain cross-functional relationships. If you're interested in joining a business that is at a high growth stage and continuously making an impact in the industry, this could be an exciting opportunity.


**Responsibilities**



Audit


* Supervise and oversee internal audit activities to evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls, risk management, and governance processes.
* Partner with external audit firms, coordinating the annual audit process, and ensuring timely completion of the audit.
* Stay current with changes in accounting standards, regulations, and industry best practices to ensure ongoing compliance.
* Identify key business risks and the adequacy of processes and controls to address those risks.
* Makes recommendations for improvement and drives changes to both controls and processes.
* Ensure SOX compliance throughout the organization.


Opex


* Lead and manage the month-end close process for operating expenses, ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting.
* Oversee the reconciliation of accrual and prepaid expense accounts, ensuring accurate recording and amortization of prepaid items.
* Perform monthly bank reconciliations to ensure accurate recording of financial transactions.
* Collaborate with various teams to review and maintain comprehensive cost trackers.
* Manage schedules related to accruals, prepaid expenses, fixed assets, and other pertinent financial components and ensure these schedules are up-to-date and reconciled regularly.
* Offer detailed insights into significant month-over-month cost variations.
* Manage the end-to-end Accounts Payable process, including invoice verification, approval workflows, and payment processing.


**Requirements**


* Experience with Quickbooks & Microsoft Dynamics 365 preferred
* 6+ years of accounting experience preferably with Consumer Products Experience
* CPA or working toward CPA designation preferred.
* Experience in start-up/high-growth eCommerce or CPG business.
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks, adhere to tight deadlines, and be unafraid to ask questions.
* Advanced skills in Excel, with the ability to manipulate, digest, and summarize large amounts of data.
* Proven ability to identify and drive process and system improvements.
* Passionate about accounting operations and willing to roll up your sleeves.
* Experience gathering, evaluating, presenting, and reporting financial information to various audiences.

Nutrafol takes into consideration a wide range of factors in final compensation decisions, including but not limited to: skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, qualifications and education, and other business and organizational needs. The listed range is applicable only to the annual base salary and does not include additional perks, benefits, or applicable bonus eligibility comprising the total compensation package.**Salary Range:**


$115,000—$125,000 USD#### **Perks & Benefits**


* Fully remote work experience
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision package, including FSA program
* 401K with 50% match
* Flexible PTO
* Two company-wide wellness breaks every day
* Free lunch on us every Tuesday and Thursday via Seamless/Grubhub
* Monthly wellness stipend
* Monthly internet stipend
* Monthly cell phone stipend
* Annual learning & development stipend
* Wellness Program, including virtual Wellness Sessions & No-Meeting Wednesdays
* Free meditation app membership (Headspace)
* Free Nutrafol subscription
* Pet insurance and benefit programs

  


*California residents may review our CCPA notice* *here**.*

title: Business Development Manager / USA
description:
**About 3YOURMIND**  

3YOURMIND is an on-demand manufacturing software platform that empowers companies to identify and produce parts as needed. OEMs, operating companies, and contract manufacturers can create digital inventories of qualified parts that reduce costs, shorten production lead times, and secure more efficient and agile operations. 3YOURMIND addresses companies current needs to produce spare parts quickly while enabling advanced manufacturing technologies and data-driven decision-making to create new parts faster, lighter, and with cost-saving potential.

  

**Your Profile:**  

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Business Development Manager to join our US team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in sales within the additive manufacturing (AM) industry, with an understanding of the market landscape, customer needs, and industry trends. This role offers an exciting opportunity to drive revenue growth, expand market share, and build strong relationships with clients in the AM sector. We encourage AM professionals without sales experience to apply.

 **Responsibilities:**


* Develop and implement strategic sales plans to achieve company objectives and revenue targets
* Identify and target key accounts, industries, and market segments for business development and growth opportunities
* Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients while actively prospecting and acquiring new clients and opportunities
* Conduct thorough market research and analysis to identify emerging trends, customer needs, and competitive insights
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product development, and customer success, to ensure alignment and support of sales initiatives
* Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations, proposals, and product demonstrations to prospective clients
* Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms of agreements in collaboration with senior management and legal teams
* Monitor and track sales performance metrics, pipeline activity, and customer feedback to drive continuous improvement and achieve sales targets
* Represent the company at industry events, trade shows, and conferences to promote brand awareness and generate new business opportunities

  


**What you should bring to the table:**


* Minimum of 5 years of experience in the Additive Manufacturing (AM) industry
* Knowledge of additive manufacturing technologies, processes, materials, and applications
* Be a US Citizen residing in Texas, Florida, Michigan or California (preferred)  

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Engineering, or related field
* Demonstrated ability to cultivate and maintain relationships with key decision-makers and stakeholders at all levels
* Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences
* Proactive, result-driven, and self-motivated individual with a passion for driving business growth and delivering exceptional customer service
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with a high degree of flexibility and adaptability
* Proficiency in CRM software, Microsoft Office Suite, and other sales and marketing tools
  


**Why you'll love working at 3YOURMIND:**


* You’ll be working in a unique industrial field at the front line of innovation and progress in manufacturing
* You’ll have autonomy to make decisions as well as maintain overall responsibility and decision power from day one
* We work in a remote model with flexible hours, embracing the freedom it brings
* We prioritize personal growth and are committed to investing in our employees' development. As part of this commitment, you'll receive a dedicated budget for your own professional advancement
* Competitive salary and performance-based commission structure
* Comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement plans, and vacation time
* Collaborative and inclusive work environment with a focus on teamwork, creativity, and continuous improvement
  


*3YOURMIND is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, national origin, genetics, disability, military and veteran status, and other protected characteristics.*

title: Business Development Manager
description:

title: Director Business Development/Technical Sales – Specialty Ingredients
description:
At Batory Foods, we encourage our team to Bring YOU, Every Day because true success starts with the ability to be yourself and letting your unique talents shine. Since 1979, the heart of our success has been our people. The Friedman family established a legacy of generosity, warmth, and respect. And with core values like Invest in Relationships and Be Relentless About Improvement, each member of our team consistently strives for excellence to uphold that legacy—whether it’s related to the employee experience, our processes, or the customer journey. Join our team today and help us build a better tomorrow, together.

 **Benefits:**



14 paid holidays with a end of year holiday refresh break



Health, Vision and Dental Insurance



Profit-Sharing program



Tuition reimbursement program


*Be Positively Excellent* well-being program



Term Life Insurance Plan



Standard Disability Plan

  


**Director Business Development/Technical Sales – Specialty Ingredients**

 **Job Description:**



As the Director of Technical Business Development/ for the Specialties Portfolio, you will be accountable for developing and driving new business at targeted accounts, existing accounts, and potential customers at emerging disrupter food brands.

  




**Key Responsibilities:**


* long-term growth and customer satisfaction.
* Ensure customer engagement strategies are aligned with Batory’s mission, values, and culture, and that they result in team development and revenue growth.
* Identify, refine, and leverage accounts best practices to create “The Batory Way” of account management.
* Define, lead, optimize and manage the pipeline in conjunction with the sales force.
* Recruit, manage, and coach technical business development professionals to deliver profitable growth.
* Create a culture of winning, collaboration and ongoing business goal achievement.
* Effectively and collaboratively work across Batory’s functions to optimize accounts revenue growth and customer satisfaction.
* Develop and deliver accurate and timely quarterly and annual sales forecasts on the pipeline.
* Possess deep insight, knowledge, and background in positioning Texturants and Nutritional ingredients with our customer base.
* Be the Specialty Portfolio subject matter expert and point of contact for key decision makers at targeted accounts.
* Remain ahead of the curve with knowledge of companies both using and developing cutting edge ingredients in new product development.
* Build and create market position by locating, developing, defining, and closing business.
* Support national sales team in tandem to develop and close new business of Specialty Portfolio within existing customer base.
* Develop new and emerging Specialty Portfolio targeted account plans by defining the current situation analysis, unique value offering, challenges/pain points, and sales growth strategy.
* Responsible for working with the Sales Team and relevant Product Managers to align with company objectives.
* Understand competitive landscape across all product categories with focus on starches, hydrocolloids, proteins, emulsifiers, and fiber, to provide ,market insights, and effectively communicate across key internal and external stakeholders.
* Closes new business deals by coordinating requirements and negotiating contract requirements.
* Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders.
* Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks.
* Enhance department and organization's reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests.
* Monitor and analyze customer's usage of Specialty ingredients.

  


**Personal Qualifications:**


* Strong change agent sales leadership experience at the first or second-line level.
* 5+ years National, Key, or Strategic Accounts sales experience with Food Industry
* Specialty in technical support or strategic sales of Alternative Sweeteners.
* Consultative selling with hunter Negotiation and presentation skills are critical.
* Demonstrated ability to communicate, present, and influence credibly and
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail.
* Excellent listening and negotiation skills; Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Confident self-starter, highly motivated, and able to thrive in a results-driven environment.
* Natural relationship builder with strong integrity, reliability, and maturity.
* Ability to prioritize among competing task.
* Domestic travel required (International travel possible) as permitted within safety guidelines.

  


**Education and Formal Training:**


* Bachelor's Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience.
* 1+ years CRM experience.
* Strong proficiency in Excel.
* Microsoft D365 experience a plus.

  



Batory Foods in an equal opportunity employer which considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law. In addition, Batory Foods also provides “reasonable accommodations” to qualified individuals with disabilities, in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local laws. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, please notify us immediately.

title: Accountant (Remote)
description:
**Who we are:**

We are a tech-savvy, remote-work-friendly, modern firm looking for power performers to enhance our healthy culture. At LedgerWay (formerly Accounting Management Services & Small Business Services), we strive every day to be better by providing clients with proactive support that makes the most significant impact possible on their professional and personal lives. We have business offices in Atlanta, Houston and Tampa. Our dynamic team is made up of value driven professionals that assist business leaders with transforming the way they manage their organization by providing accurate, reliable and timely accounting, forecasting, tax, and business intelligence services.

Are you highly organized? Do you like being a team player while also working independently? Can you communicate on multiple platforms–in-person, via email, video conferencing­–simultaneously with clients and coworkers? Then you may just be our new employee. Read on to see if we’re a good fit for each other.

**What we’ll like about you:**

* Experience with Microsoft Office (specifically Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
* Experience with QuickBooks/QuickBooks Online (Accounting CS and QuickBooks Desktop a plus)
* Dedicated to excellent client service and providing a rich, frictionless client experience
* Ability to learn and implement new technology

* Expectation of effective communication skills and professionalism
* Possess the ability to communicate with clients and build sustainable client relationships.
* Possess developed problem-solving and analytical skills.
* The ability to interact within a team setting and to interact professionally with a client.
* Proficient in time management with an emphasis on the importance of meeting deadlines and accomplishing tasks.
* Experience in an environment with client contact is preferred
* Experience providing accounting services is preferred
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in accounting, CPA candidate, or EA candidate is preferred.

**What you’ll be doing:**

* Oversee staff accountants
* Review client financial statements
* Resolve routine to complex accounting
* Develop, manage and train staff accountants
* Interact with clients via meetings, telephone, letters and email
* Monitor budgets by maintaining control on time and charges
* Recommend billing to manager or partner on engagement

**What success looks like in this role:**

* Completing client deliverables on time
* Develop direct reports
* Continuing professional growth training

**What’s in it for you:**

* Supportive Management Team
* Clearly defined bonus schedule based on billing
* Defined promotion path with annual reviews

**What’s next?**

Are you intrigued by this opportunity? Apply here with your resume. We’ll send you an email to set up our first interview if selected for the interview process. If not, we wish you luck in finding your new adventure.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance

title: Business Development Manager - Travel Industry
description:
**ABOUT CIE TOURS INTERNATIONAL:** 

CIE Tours has been providing travelers with the highest quality guided vacations for more than 90 years. We pride ourselves on being a collegial, friendly, and collaborative company with deep expertise in our destinations which ensures the company’s reputation as the recognized leader in Ireland and Britain travel. For additional information, please visit www.cietours.com.

**SUMMARY:**

As the destination leader to Ireland, Britain and beyond with more than 90 years of delivering unparalleled traveler experiences, we’re looking for an experienced Business Development Manager to maximize the sales potential within the Northwest territory (Northern CA, AK, HI, ID, MT, OR and WA) by cultivating strong relationships with existing customers, driving brand awareness, and identifying new customer prospects. By effectively representing CIE Tours to the travel industry and the public, Business Development Managers strive for successful execution of their sales plan and achievement of their revenue and passenger objective/goals.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Ability to target and achieve results, set challenging goals, show energy and react to opportunity, instill urgency in others, and meet deadlines
* Develop and implement sales and marketing plans with key accounts to address their specific needs
* Strengthen relationships and achieve growth with key accounts through regular contact and informative updates with respect to their productivity and progress; offer assistance when appropriate to assist in achievement of goals.
* Provide robust CIE Tours training opportunities for agents through client presentations, product information sessions and ongoing website and e-commerce strategies
* Ensure that marketing collateral is utilized to its fullest potential; ensure CIE Tours has prominent placement in key account agencies.
* Identify and develop new business opportunities.
* Evaluate ROI of potential trade and consumer shows/events and participate where beneficial.
* Continually identify opportunities outside traditional B2B accounts.
* Stay abreast of competitor information in designated territory and stay updated on trends within the industry. Provide feedback to management team with respect to trends and opportunities.
* Maintain accurate records of sales activities in Sales Force; record training's, appointments, tasks, customer feedback and other sales activities in a timely manner.
* Actively seek out and foster group business; Maintain contact with originating agent from beginning of process through to departure of the group.
* Manage T&E budget and co-op marketing funds in the most cost effective way, being mindful of established policies.
* Other duties as required and assigned

**DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:**

* Previous experience in the travel industry is essential, providing a deep understanding of the unique dynamics and needs of our partners and clients
* Bachelor’s degree desired and/or equivalent work experience
* 3+ years travel industry and/or territory sales experience preferred
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to interact with all levels of staff required
* Must be able to deliver effective product/destination training's, engage as a credible trainer, and represent the company professionally at internal and external events.
* Able to use good listening skills, be sensitive to customers, adjust quickly to different personal styles, and stay open to other viewpoints
* Able to negotiate effectively in a positive manner, compromise and find alternate solutions
* Able to develop detailed sales/marketing plans aligned with company goals, manage time and work flow well, create effective sales call plans, monitor and respond to competition timely, work systematically/efficiently, manage distractions and interruptions
* Committed to increasing customer satisfaction and is responsive to internal customers
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (emphasis on Power Point applications, for effective formulation of presentations), LCD/Data projection, Internet and webinar tools.
* Ability to use Excel spreadsheets to store and manipulate account data
* Knowledge of Sales Force and Softrip database preferred
* Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends as required, and travel extensively throughout the territory.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Travel requirement:

* Up to 50% travel

title: Business Development Manager Role at Latinas in Tech
description:
**Reports to**:



The Senior Development Manager


**About Latinas in Tech:**



Latinas in Tech is a non-profit organization with the aim to create a tech industry where Latinas are well-represented throughout all levels of the ecosystem by empowering them to be innovators and leaders. Our mission is to provide the resources, opportunities and community Latinas need to thrive, innovate and lead in tech.


**Job Summary:**



The Business Development Manager is responsible for executing and generating annual revenue for the organization. These activities include but are not limited to acquiring and managing annual sponsorships, acquiring and managing Summit sponsorships, and managing additional annual donor and fundraising campaigns throughout the year.



The Manager provides support to the Senior Development Manager for planning, implementation, execution and tracking of sponsorships. This role focuses on strategic sponsorship and revenue initiatives aimed to support the mission of Latinas in Tech, strengthen the organization’s revenue stream, and secure resources needed to grow and implement program activities. Key responsibilities include creating corporate sponsorship proposals, selling sponsorship opportunities, meeting with prospective and current partners, planning and executing sponsorship activations, and facilitating effective data and budget tracking.



**Roles and Responsibilities:**



Responsible for the day-to-day management of new sponsorship opportunities, work closely with corporate partners and internal stakeholders to execute new and current partnerships effectively.



Meets regularly with new and current sponsors; conducting pitch meetings, renewal meetings, kick-off meetings and onboarding meetings as needed.



Negotiates and manages sponsorships agreements and serves as a liaison with corporate partners on sponsorship execution.



Ensures all sponsorship agreements and sponsor activations are on-boarded and executed in a timely manner.



Develops and manages the campaigns and strategy for partnership opportunities for both annual and Summit sponsors.



Leads in the creation of sponsorship materials, including decks and advertising collateral in partnership with the Marketing Team.



Evaluates the effectiveness of sponsor and fundraising campaigns and strategy and provides updates to the Senior Development Manager.



Oversees the management of the sponsorships database (Salesforce) and ensures all data is updated and available in real-time to senior leadership and staff.



Assists the Senior Development Manager with daily departmental budget and pipeline tracking.



Works in coordination with the Senior Development Manager to achieve the organization’s philanthropic and sponsorship goals.



Supports all organizational philanthropy-related initiatives and events.



Proactively identifies, evaluates and pursues new funding opportunities and partnerships.



Works cross-functionally with internal teams to communicate sponsorship and fundraising strategies and messaging.



Attends all external and internal meetings as directed by the Senior Development Manager.



Additional duties as directed by the Senior Development Manager or Chief of Staff.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s Degree
* At least three years of experience in philanthropy, development or sales
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Advanced presentation skills
* Experience with Salesforce data management a plus
* Strong budget management skills
* Excellent problem solving and organizational skills
* Experience with DEIB is a plus
* Experience working remotely is a plus

  



**Job Information:**


**Full-Time:** 100% FTE / 40 hours per week


**Salary Range:** $60,000- $70,000


**Reports to:** Director of Sponsorship and Programs Operations


**Location(s)**: San Francisco Bay Area or Remote (must sit in US time zones)

title: B2B Sales Manager
description:
**Job Description: B2B Sales Manager**

**Reporting to: Head of B2C eCommerce**

Overview:

We are looking for a sales rockstar- someone who brings the perfect mix of commercially minded entrepreneurial drive, creativity, and broad hands-on experience generating B2B sales, preferably to the medical industry customer.

JOB DETAILS

Job Title: Sales Manager for Medical Wholesale Business

We are looking for an experienced sales manager, ideally with B2B medical sales experience to join our global team. The sales manager will have hands-on experience working with a CRM or lead generation and engagement platform such as Apollo, Salesforce, Sales Navigator, or similar. This is an exceptional opportunity to join an established but fast-paced, high-growth business where your contribution to the success of the business will be valued. The role is 100% remote.

The ideal sales manager has deep experience with the entire sales process, excelling at lead generation, relationship building, and deal closing. We’re looking for a quick learner who has strong negotiating and communication skills — someone with a successful track record who can inspire the same performance in others. The role demands a leader who has a sharp mind and an ability to coach, advise, motivate, or replace sales representatives while building and maintaining a high-performance team.

Objectives of this role

* Represent the company effectively with comprehensive knowledge of our offerings
* Research client needs and identify how our solutions address them
* Hire, train, motivate, and advise a team of sales representatives
* Achieve company sales targets by planning thoroughly, setting sales goals, analyzing performance data, and making forecasts
* Develop skills continuously for hiring, training, and leading team members, and ensure that they're using effective sales tactics to meet revenue objectives
* Generate leads, and establish and nurture client relationships

Responsibilities

* Create and execute a strategic sales plan focused on demand generation and customer acquisition to extends the company's global reach
* Nurture relationships with existing clients and grow long-lasting relationships that address their needs
* Recruit sales representatives, set objectives, train and coach them, and monitor their performance
* Identify knowledge gaps within the team and develop plans for filling them
* Ensure that company quotas are met and/or exceeded by holding regular check-ins with the sales team to set objectives and monitor progress
* Manage the month-end and year-end close processes

Core skills required:

* Inside Sales
* Inbound/Outbound Sales
* Demand Planning
* New Client Acquisitions
* Business Planning and Sales Forecasting
* Lead Generation
* Account Management
* Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
* Communication
* Business Development
* Team Leadership
* Sales Processes

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $70,000.00-$85,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Commission pay

Experience:

* sales: 3 years (required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Manager, Business Development
description:
We all have important information we need to manage, and protecting it should be easy. Over 100,000 businesses and millions of people log in to 1Password to unlock smart, simple access to everything they care about. Our vision is to create a safer, simpler digital future for everyone, and our culture values simplicity, honesty and a human-centric approach to solving problems. Come help us unlock peace of mind so everyone can stay safer online.  

As a Manager of Business Development, you’ll lead a team of Business Development Representatives responsible for outbound pipeline generation for our Sales Executive team. This team will be identifying customers and strategically prospecting to qualify needs and drive interest in our solutions for their business.  

This is a remote opportunity within Canada and the US.
### **What we're looking for:**

* 2 or more years of experience leading Sales Development teams or 5 or more years of relevant professional experience with B2B prospecting, cold calling, emailing, social selling, and researching.
* You have experience recruiting, hiring, and developing talented and driven individuals.
* You have a passion for coaching, motivating, and mentoring others.
* You have a track record of success in generating quality sales pipeline within a SaaS or B2B organization.
* You have outstanding communications skills.
* You care deeply about the success of your reps and you’re great at celebrating wins and progress.
* You’re an analytical thinker and know how to turn metrics into decisions, and can present data in a compelling and impactful way.
* You can identify and make recommendations for improvement in the areas of process, efficiency and productivity.
* You have experience in a fast-growth environment with strong problem-solving skills.
* It’s a bonus if you have personal experience with 1Password or another password manager.

### **What you can expect:**

* Reporting to the Director, Business Development, you will be supporting and managing our BDRs in their efforts to generate sales interest and book meetings with our Sales Executive team.
* You will support the recruitment, onboarding, and building of a team of high performing individuals.
* You will coach, support, and motivate the team in their multi-channel prospecting including emails, cold calling, video, and social outreach.
* You will work within your team and with business partners to continually identify areas for training and development and to document processes.
* You will drive the productive and successful use of an industry-leading software stack including Salesforce, Outreach, and Linkedin Sales Navigator.
* You will try new things – if something isn’t working, you’ll be encouraged to be creative and to try new tactics and strategies.


USA-based roles only: The Annual base salary for this role is between $93,000 USD and $125,000 USD, plus immediate participation in 1Password's benefits program (health, dental, 401k and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.  

Canada-based roles only: The Annual base salary for this role is between $89,000 CAD and $121,000 CAD, plus immediate participation in 1Password’s generous benefits program (health, dental, RRSP and many others), utilization of our generous paid time off, an equity grant and, where applicable, participation in our incentive programs.  

At 1Password, we approach each individual's compensation with a promise of fair market value and internal equity commensurate with experience and specific skill set.  

We believe in the power of remote work, but we also recognize that some in-person connection with team members and customers is important to help us achieve our mission. While we are a remote-first company, occasional travel for in-person engagement will be a part of this role. This may include but is not limited to bi-annual department-wide offsites, quarterly department meetings and periodic customer events. These events will typically be held in varying locations across Canada and the USA. In leadership roles, you can expect to travel once per month on average. **What we offer:**  

We believe in working hard, and resting hard. We’re always looking for new ways to support our team members, but here’s a glance at what we currently offer:  

  

**Health and wellbeing**
> \\uD83D\\uDC76 Maternity and parental leave top up programs
> \\uD83D\\uDC5F Wellness spending account
> \\uD83C\\uDFDD Generous PTO policy
> \\uD83D\\uDC96 Company-wide wellness days off scheduled throughout the year
> \\uD83E\\uDDE0 Wellness Coach membership
> \\uD83E\\uDE7A Comprehensive health coverage **Growth and future**
> \\uD83D\\uDCC8 Employee stock option program for all full time employees
> \\uD83D\\uDCB8 Retirement matching program
> \\uD83D\\uDCA1 Training budget, 1Password University access, and learning sessions
> \\uD83D\\uDD11 Free 1Password account (and friends and family discount!) **Flexibility and community**
> \\uD83E\\uDD1D Paid volunteer days
> \\uD83C\\uDF0E Employee-led DEI&B programs and ERGs
> \\uD83C\\uDFE0 Fully remote environment
> \\uD83C\\uDFC6 Peer-to-peer recognition through Bonusly  

  

**You belong here.**  

*1Password is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that is built on trust, support and respect. We welcome all individuals and do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity and expression, race, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, colour, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, marital status, pregnancy, sex, citizenship, education, languages spoken or veteran status. Be yourself, find your people and share the things you love.*  

*Accommodation is available upon request at any point during our recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please speak to your talent acquisition partner or email us at nextbit@agilebits.com and we’ll work to meet your needs.*  

*Remote work is a part of our DNA. Given that our company was founded remotely in 2005, we can safely say we're experts at building remote culture. That said, remote work at 1Password does mean working from your home country. If you've got questions or concerns about this your Talent Partner would be happy to address them with you.* *Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check that may consist of prior employment verification, reference checks, education confirmation, criminal background, publicly available social media, credit history, or other information, as permitted by local law.* ***Candidate Privacy Notice*** *When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are being considered for a role at AgileBits, Inc. (dba 1Password, 1Password, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Lever, in accordance with* *Lever's Service Privacy Notice**. We use this information to evaluate your candidacy for the posted position. We also store this information, and may use it in relation to future positions to which you apply, or which we believe may be relevant to you given your background.* *Candidates may also optionally choose to self-identify their race/ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, and disability. These answers will help us evaluate our diversity and belonging efforts. You do not have to answer these questions—your answers will not be linked to your name or job application, will not be visible to the hiring manager reviewing your application, and will in no way affect your job application. If you have any questions about the collection or use of this information, please contact* ***[******dpo@1password.com******]****.* *When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. If you have any questions about how we use or process your information, or if you would like to ask to access, correct, or delete your information, please contact our privacy team at [**dpo@1password.com**] or through* *1Password Support**.*

description:

title: Manager, Business Development
description:
DeVry University strives to close our society’s opportunity gap by preparing learners to thrive in careers shaped by continuous technological change. Through innovative programs, relevant partnerships, and exceptional care, we empower students to meaningfully improve their lives, communities, and workplaces.

When you apply for a DeVry University career, you become part of an institution that dates back to 1931. Our colleagues are passionate about higher education and shaping the future of today’s learners.

Overview: In this role, you will be responsible for identifying and securing new logo accounts for DeVryWorks. Success will be measured based on the quantity of deals closed and timing of first enrollments from new deals, emphasizing your ability to expand our customer base.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities  
 Prospecting:  
 Identify and research potential clients with a focus on expanding our customer base through DeVryWorks Completion Grant partnerships.  
 Utilize various channels, including cold calling, email outreach, and social networking, to generate leads.  
 Qualification:  
 Engage with potential clients to understand their needs and assess the suitability of our products/services.  
 Qualify leads based on defined criteria to ensure efficient use of resources.  
 Presentation and Demonstration:  
 Effectively communicate the value proposition of our products/services to potential clients.  
 Conduct product demonstrations to showcase the benefits and features of our offerings.  
 Closing Deals:  
 Employ a proactive and persistent approach to close a high volume of deals within a defined timeframe.  
 Overcome objections and address concerns to facilitate successful closures.  
 Pipeline Management:  
 Maintain a robust sales pipeline and provide regular updates on progress to the sales management team.  
 Utilize CRM tools to track and prioritize leads through the sales process.  
 Collaboration:  
 Collaborate with internal teams to ensure a timely transition from sales to activation.  
 Seek feedback from clients to contribute to product/service improvements.  
 Technology:  
 Utilize sales enablement technology including Salesforce, Gong, MS Teams, ZoomInfo and LinkedIn Navigator to effectively deliver on outcomes.  
 Utilize trends and provided reporting for continuous improvement  
Qualifications  
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Below are the minimum requirements of the education, experience, knowledge, and skills required to competently perform in this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
 Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s preferred.  
 3 + years experience in facilitation including virtual delivery  
 Highly motivated, self-driven, result-oriented, strategic, logical and methodical thinker.  
 Proven excellent communication skills – both written and verbal  
 Displa-y a high level of attention to detail  
 Have an understanding of adult learning theory  
 Ability and willingness to work as part of an interdependent team willing to share and exchange ideas.  
 Ability to effectively multi-task and handle impromptu changes in direction  
 Illustrate a creative and innovative mindset to think outside the box and always look for ways to improve processes  
 Must be able to inspire loyalty and trust.  
 Innovative and adaptable.  
 Strong interest in the Education industry preferred.  
*Base pay $90-95k*

title: Business Development Manager - GVA
description:
**Who We Are:**



Canco, we’re Canadian born and raised. We are an independent chain of gas stations launched in 2016. A bold alternative to big-box retailers, Canco was born from a vision to become a leading gas retailer brand. We purchase directly from major fuel refineries and terminals in Canada to ensure premium products are offered at competitive prices. Proudly local, we put people first and run our business with honesty, integrity and excellence.

  


**The Role:**

Canco is seeking a driven and results-oriented Business Development Manager - GVA to support the company's expansion efforts within the Greater Vancouver Area. The ideal candidate will possess a proven track record in acquisitions, cold calling, and business development, with a focus on driving growth and identifying new opportunities. As a pivotal member of our team, you will be instrumental in establishing new networks and acquiring prime locations for our convenience and gas station operations.

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Use cold calling techniques to reach out to property owners, to explore potential opportunities for Canco.
* Introduce the company and its objectives to owners.
* Generate interest and initiate discussions about potential site acquisitions.
* Establish and maintain relationships with property owners and other stakeholders.
* Evaluate sites based on factors such as traffic volume, demographics, competition, and zoning regulations.
* Assess the feasibility and suitability of each location based on business objectives and requirements.
* Foster positive and mutually beneficial relationships with external parties.
* Prepare comprehensive proposals and presentations outlining the benefits and challenges of each proposed location.
* Provide insights and recommendations to the team regarding potential locations and market strategies.
* Coordinate site visits, inspections, and due diligence processes; as needed
* Stay informed about industry trends, market dynamics, and new opportunities.
* Ensure compliance with internal policies, legal requirements, and regulatory standards throughout the acquisition process.
* Other duties as assigned or required by the business.

  


**What You Bring:**

* Bachelor's degree in business, finance, management, economics, or a related field.
* Relevant experience real estate, site selection, business development, or related roles, preferably within the retail or petroleum industry
* Strong understanding of real estate principles and market analysis techniques.
* Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational and management skills.
* Willingness to travel frequently within the designated region.

  



This role is a Remote Permanent/Full-Time position in Vancouver BC.

  

Candidates for this position should note that while it is classified as remote, it entails 90 – 100% fieldwork responsibilities, rather than exclusively remote office work.

title: Business Development Manager (IB B2B)
New Business Development Manager – South West territory
description:
New Business Development Manager – South West territory

Generate new business by closing new strategic high value OEM accounts in the U.S. Sout West territory, as well as new business by expanding product categories with existing key accounts. Support account onboarding and hand-offs to Account Representative Team.

**Responsibilities and duties**

* Research, qualify and cultivate new leads and markets for Madison’s products and services
* Engage and convert to qualified prospects, and ultimately new clients
* Effectively utilize in person visits, phone, email, events, and outbound marketing campaigns for direct prospecting, awareness, education, and client communication
* Establish and maintain relationships and communication throughout the entire sales cycle
* Present Madison products’ technical features and benefits as they relate to solving prospective customers’ problems and/or fulfilling their application requirements
* Prepare and issue proposals and quotes
* Follow through and close proposals and quotes
* Consistently meet or exceed assigned product and new revenue goals
* Utilize and maintain sales tools, CRM, etc. with complete and up to date information on all stages of assigned prospects and clients
* Attend trade shows; help with booth setup and tear down, network and prospect for new opportunities, qualify and capture leads, demonstrate products, gather feedback and market intelligence
* Pre-plan travel and visits to maximize prospect-facing time and minimize travel time and cost between visits
* Practice integrity, reliability and honesty in all business transactions
* Work with co-workers to ensure success
* Other duties as needed or assigned

**Qualifications and skills, Certifications and Education Requirements** 

* Consistent, persistent sales prospecting to identify new revenue opportunities and progress them through the entire sales cycle.
* Possess or learn high level technical product knowledge and understanding of the industries, applications, companies and contacts
* Apply the technical and sales competencies necessary to recognize and deliver solutions for spoken needs as well as hidden or unspoken needs of suspects, referral partners, clients and prospects
* Display positive persistence, optimism, and empathy in all interactions
* Proven excellence in critical thinking, analytical skills, verbal, written, and interpersonal communications
* Accurate and complete information gathering and documentation skill
* Competent in MS Office products and efficient in email, internet, and sales automation/CRM applications.
* Demonstrated problem solving and people skills

title: Business Development Manager (Eastern PA / New Jersey / Delaware)
description:
**#KeepGrowing with Nutrafol**
------------------------------



Come grow with us. We're a growing company. Everything we do, we do to help people grow into the best version of themselves.



As the pioneers of hair wellness, we create natural, clinically effective solutions for hair growth and provide support for people at every step of their hair journey. Our multi-factorial approach targets the root causes of hair thinning using a patented blend of medical-grade botanicals - and is recommended by over 3,000 physicians and hair professionals for trusted, reliable results.



We never settle, and are continuously challenging existing treatments and methodologies to advance the frontier of hair science. As we help our customers grow, we grow too - by embracing individuality and differences, leading by example, and empowering ourselves and others with our passion for wellness and innovation.



Keep growing. It's our mantra. Our commitment to helping anybody and everybody committed to realizing their own potential to grow.

**About You**



The ideal Business Development Manager (BDM) for Nutrafol will be responsible for executing and exceeding Sales goals within the defined territory, in this case covering Eastern PA / New Jersey / Delaware. In this role, you will be responsible for the promotion, sale and training of our Nutrafol product portfolio within your accounts. You should be focused on a consistent, customer-centric approach bringing value to the practice and focus on growing share. BDM's are responsible for cultivating both new and existing accounts, providing superior customer service, continued education and training throughout the practice. You should place a heavy focus on educating them of promotions, campaigns and marketing resources to help grow the business. Your call point is to all Health Care Professionals who do Aesthetics and who see patients, regardless of gender, who are concerned with hair retention and overall health.



While Nutrafol is a remote-first company, Business Development Managers should be primarily based within their assigned territory.


**Responsibilities and Expectations**


* Promote and sell products to all potential prospects within your territory.
* Professionally implement strategic initiatives and sales activity to increase Nutrafol sales and market share.
* Drive product promotion through the implementation and delivery of approved marketing items and approved field-based promotions.
* Provide 'White Glove' service and support with a customer-centric, practice-building approach.
* In all you do, stay connected and build relationships to drive further commitment and account penetration/growth through in person, educational and informational meetings as well as, customer focused follow up.
* Coordinate physician training programs and practice enhancement in-services and open houses.
* Establish and maintain professional and consistent communications and sound working relationships with leadership, co-workers and assigned accounts.
* Actively participate in scheduled company sales meetings, district and regional conference calls and other business meetings.
* Show fiscal responsibility with managing expenses, turning in expenses in a timely manner and having a legitimate business reason tied to all expenses, generating ROI.
* Demonstrate honesty and integrity while modeling behaviors consistent with company standards and policies for business.
* Enhance sales numbers by up-selling portfolio, picking up new potential product champions across the practice, appropriately presenting any promotional marketing initiatives that may drive growth, while driving implementation and execution of key Marketing strategies.
* Partner effectively with Inside Sales Team to drive territory coverage and maintain positive customer relationships.
* Attend Trade Shows in local markets and/or Nationally, professionally representing Nutrafol and promoting new sales opportunities across the nation on behalf of the Nutrafol sales team.
* Effectively and routinely utilize Salesforce as trained by internal instruction, to track and manage leads, opportunities and sales activity.


**Requirements**


* Minimum of 3 years proven success in Field Sales experience in achieving and exceeding goals.
* Preferred experience in medical, surgical and/or pharmacologics, selling to Health Care Practitioners in the Aesthetic Space.
* Proven track record of sustained, high performance in current position and strong aptitude for learning and demonstrating Clinical and product expertise.
* Ability to be flexible and adaptable as we grow and expand as an organization.
* Promotes Nutrafol products with professional passion and a sense of urgency, while providing our customers Best in Class service and support.
* Strong business acumen and ability to understand, create and seize market opportunities.
* Ability to travel up to 50%.
* Must maintain the highest level of ethical character and integrity.
* A solution oriented, problem solver and contributor as a collaborative Nutrafol team member.

Nutrafol takes into consideration a wide range of factors in final compensation decisions, including but not limited to: skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, qualifications and education, and other business and organizational needs. The listed range is applicable only to the annual base salary and does not include additional perks, benefits, or applicable bonus eligibility comprising the total compensation package.**Salary Range:**


$75,000—$85,000 USD#### **Perks & Benefits**


* Fully remote work experience
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision package, including FSA program
* 401K with 50% match
* Flexible PTO
* Two company-wide wellness breaks every day
* Free lunch on us every Tuesday and Thursday via Seamless/Grubhub
* Monthly wellness stipend
* Monthly internet stipend
* Monthly cell phone stipend
* Annual learning & development stipend
* Wellness Program, including virtual Wellness Sessions & No-Meeting Wednesdays
* Free meditation app membership (Headspace)
* Free Nutrafol subscription
* Pet insurance and benefit programs

  


*California residents may review our CCPA notice* *here**.*
