title: Business Development Sales Manager
description:
Use this link to apply directly: https://nanoleaf.bamboohr.com/careers/50

Job Summary:

Who We Are

Nanoleaf creates smart home products that take ordinary experiences and make them extraordinary. We do this by inventing one-of-a-kind products that can help to improve the way we experience our everyday lives, building a strong team of passionate and motivated individuals who want to make an impact in the world, and through always designing with the customers’ needs in mind.

Founded in 2012 by three engineers on a journey to make green technology desirable, the company now has offices in Shenzhen, Paris, and Toronto, Hong Kong, Philippines, and selling in major retailers like Apple, Best Buy, and Home Depot. We are on a mission to build an amazing global brand and team and make a positive impact on the lives of our customers and employees. We love to promote from within and work towards growing all of our employees toward their potential and career goals. We strive to promote a positive, collaborative and pleasant work culture where everyone can feel welcomed and supported within our Nanoleaf team.

Learn more about us here:

nanoleaf.me

Linkedin.com/company/nanoleaf

Instagram | Twitter @nanoleaf

Youtube | Facebook: @thenanoleaf

Tiktok | Twitch @nanoleafofficial

Who We’re Looking For

As the BD Sales Manager (National Accounts and New Ventures), you will play a pivotal role in driving Nanoleaf’s growth by expanding our current business with major retail and working with leadership to build out new business verticals. You will be responsible for managing and growing relationships with our largest and most strategic clients, to achieve revenue targets and ensuring we are a top-of-mind brand in these channels. You will also work with BD leaders to cultivate new business verticals that are budding and expanding the business.

What You’ll Do

At Nanoleaf we empower each person in the organization to be an innovative leader that can drive impact both internally and externally. As we grow our reach nationally, we are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Business Dev Sales Manager to join our passionate team.

For this role you will help develop and implement a comprehensive national accounts strategy that drives sales growth, primarily in our retail accounts while also Identifying target accounts based on strategic importance and revenue potential.

You will meet regularly with key partners externally to ensure there is always alignment on business performance and mutually beneficial initiatives such as cross category, off shelf and partnership opportunities. Perform regular business reviews which includes new item placement, optimizing assortment, shelf merchandising, promotion planning, retail pricing, and supply chain process improvements.

Most importantly, your modus operandi is “get it done”! You’ll need to be an agile leader who can bring solutions and creative thinking to the table to close deals and run the business efficiently.

Responsibilities:

* Build and maintain strong relationships with key partners (Home Depot, Best Buy, Costco, Amazon, Walmart). Understand each partners unique needs and challenges and provide top level service and partnership
* Negotiate strong vendor agreements that give Nanoleaf relevance, mindshare and omnichannel placements with each vendor.
* Meet on a regular cadence with buyers and their support teams to ensure the business is running smoothly and proposing growth initiatives that create unique value to our partners and growth in topline metrics

:

* Develop and execute sales plans to achieve revenue targets for each account.
* Monitor sales performance, analyze results, and adjust strategies as needed to ensure success.
* Identify new opportunities/ partners that align with our overall company OKRs for growing topline rev. and bottom-line profitability
* Optimize channels to reduce overall costs, returns and trade spend
* Identify gaps in the business (Revenue gaps, product gaps, placement gaps, partnerships, etc..) and propose well thought strategies to close these gaps with supporting business plans
* Ensure proposed initiatives and programs have a net positive ROI, providing value to the brand overall
* Collaborate with internal cross functional teams including marketing, finance, supply chain, product development, etc. to ensure accounts exceed KPIs and maintain positive returns. Work internally to build out unique value propositions for the Nanoleaf brand and stay relevant to the competition.
* On an ongoing basis you will collect and share market information and important data points to internal teams, ensuring that we keep ahead of the curve in product development, placement and changes in market trends.

Requirements:

* Consistent track record for setting sales targets, executing across multiple teams, and finding solutions to roadblocks
* Understanding of sales performance metrics, creating actionable strategies and pivoting to ensure targets are hit
* You have extensive experience building strong relationships in tech, retail, or commerce
* Expert in channel management and proven track record of hitting topline targets
* Previous work experience working with major retail, understanding onboarding, daily management and running individual P/L for accounts
* Superior negotiation skills
* Experience working collaboratively with Marketing, PR, Supply Chain and Operations teams.
* Experience with CRM software (e.g. Microsoft BI )
* Team player who has mastered fostering a collaborative culture and motivating their peers
* Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field

Preferred:

* Post Graduate degree preferred; MBA, Masters in management, etc..
* Previous work in CPG or tech hardware company an asset
* Understanding of financial statements plus

What We Offer

* Competitive compensation
* Health and dental benefits
* Centrally located downtown office that’s steps away from the TTC and Union/King Station
* Opportunity to work in a startup-style environment with funding backed by a cash-positive business
* A leadership team that cares about what success looks like for you and works with you to map out your career development and growth
* Enjoy the freedom to express your creativity
* Work in a team of positive, passionate and capable peers who love to work hard and play hard together
* Quarterly team-building outings
* Hybrid work from home + work in the office model

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $65,902.05-$95,837.26 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

* Please use this link to apply directly to our website: https://nanoleaf.bamboohr.com/careers/50

Work Location: Hybrid remote in York, ON M5A 1E1

description:
**Position Title:** 

Business Development & Sales Manager

**About Us:**

Jingsource.com was founded in 2015, with the headquarter located in Yiwu International Trade City, the world’s largest small commodities wholesale market. At Jingsourcing, we are on a mission to offer our global clients smart solutions to source suitable factories in China, and complete associated supply chain management service, such as production, quality inspection, logistics and transportation.

Official Website: https://jingsourcing.com/

We focus on serving importers mainly in Europe and the United States, and currently is the only company on the market that brands product procurement (sourcing) services. As the leading sourcing agent in China, Jingsourcing has successfully helped thousands of sellers worldwide import from China, with more than 200,000 B-end organic followers on our social media channels such as Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, and Tiktok.

**Position Overview:**

We are on the lookout for an ambitious and energetic Business Development Executive / Manager to further strengthen the North American and Europe cliente. This will offer an exciting opportunity for someone ready to further their career. You will be the front of the Company and will have the dedication to create and apply an effective sales strategy.

**Responsibilities:**

l Identify and target importers or sellers or companies in North America and Europe with imports needs to expand our distribution network and increase market presence.

l Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve sales targets and drive revenue growth.

l Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers within associated industries.

l Understand customer needs and provide tailored solutions to meet their requirements.

l Results-driven with a strategic mindset and passion for business growth.

**Compensation/Benefits**

title: Business Development Manager- Aesthetics (Miami)
description:
For an innovative subscription model business venture and part of Lumenis' Data and Digital BU, Lumenis is looking for a Business Development Representative (BDR) who will drive growth among a selected group of valuable customers by understanding their business needs, customizing their solution, and helping them succeed. The ideal candidate is a relationship builder with a genuine passion for understanding key drivers of the business success of their customers. The candidate should be a deal closer, proactive problem solver with impressive communication and presentation skills.


As a BDR your daily tasks will involve:

* Implementing Business and sales development best practices through cold calling, email outreach, voicemails, and leveraging social media, using enablement technology to connect with potential clients.
* Employing prospecting and research tools to assess accounts and generate opportunities for meetings with target personas.
* Managing and progressing a prospect funnel.
* Collaborate with potential customers to understand their business goals, challenges and growth aspirations. Tailor our services and solutions to meet their specific needs.
* Closing of the deals in line with or exceeding quarterly targets.
* Collaborating with team members to innovate and enhance the overall sales development process.
* Educate owners on the benefits of partnering with Lumenis Be. Provide consultative guidance on how our program, products and services can help them achieve their business objectives.
* Staying informed about industry trends and market conditions to become an expert in the industries you are supporting.
* Participating in weekly team training sessions to continuously enhance your skills and development as a Business Development Representative (BDR).


This role is ideal for someone who:

* Is a dynamic thinker, consistently investing in adopting or adapting to approach challenges with critical and creative thinking.
* Possesses creativity, finding innovative solutions to address complex issues.
* Excels in communication, both verbally and in writing.
* Isn't afraid of failures.
* Is goal-driven, motivated to achieve and exceed expectations.
* Is looking for high rewards linked to performance.
* Demonstrates tenacity, using passion and grit as currency and maintaining focus.
* Is resilient and capable of handling objections without taking them personally.
* Is open to learning and evolving
* Is adaptable and able to adjust to changes quickly.
* Is collaborative, a team player who knows how to work with others to achieve shared goals.
* Is coachable, actively listening to feedback and applying it accordingly.


Requirements:

* Independent, self-motivated, results-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving startup environment.
* Adaptability and willingness to take on multiple responsibilities, making decisions in an agile and resourceful manner.
* Demonstrated ability to roll up sleeves and work with team members in a hands-on management capacity.
* Previous experience in sales - a must
* Experience in medical device sales or customer success - an advantage.
* Experience and familiarity with how med spas and aesthetic businesses operate - an advantage.
* Experience working with multinational international business organizations and matrix organizations /experience in the US market is a must
* Strong business acumen
* Proven experience of technology B2B international markets experience
* Willingness to travel as needed (mainly in the US)

**About Lumenis:**

Lumenis is a global leader in the field of minimally invasive clinical solutions for the Ophthalmology and Aesthetic markets, and is a world-renowned expert in developing and commercializing innovative energy-based technologies, including Laser, Intense Pulsed Light (IPL) and Radio-Frequency (RF).


Read more at http://www.lumenis.com


Follow us: https://www.linkedin.com/company/lumenis/about/


The job description outlined above reflects general details as necessary to describe the primary functions of this job, the level of knowledge and skill typically required, but should not be construed as an all-inclusive listing of work requirements. Individuals may be asked to perform duties other.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability, gender identity, and sexual orientation.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Atlanta Candidates - Hybrid**

**Outside of Atlanta - Remote**

**Apply Directly:** https://www.paycomonline.net/v4/ats/web.php/jobs/ViewJobDetails?job=82492&clientkey=F764CB156314BB772F6C9C92DBD91ABA

**Meridian Cooperative** is hiring a **Business Development Manager** to join a team of passionate innovators and problem-solvers, empowered to rise above challenges and swarm around solutions. Here, at our Dunwoody office, we are energized by the fact that our work is important. We are driven to make work as easy as possible for our Members, Customers, Partners, and Employees. Help us lead the way in Utility Software, join a winning company and thrive.

**Summary:**

The Business Development Manager’s (BDM) primary role is to partner with members/customers to help them succeed at solving business problems or business opportunities and to be seen by members/customers as a trusted advisor. BDMs hunt for opportunities to serve customers, helping them select and leverage Meridian Co-op’s enterprise solutions, resulting in expanded relationships and the generation of sales/revenue from new and existing member/customers. Business Development Managers work as members of a Business Development and Relationship Management team. They work and collaborate with Key Account Managers, Territory Managers, Product Managers, Marketing, and Sales Operations to bring compelling value propositions to customers and contribute to the development and growth of long-term member/customer relationships. BDMs represent and are knowledgeable about all our family of companies’ business solutions while specializing with deep expertise in one or two business solutions. The BDM embodies an “I succeed by helping you succeed” orientation with customers and teammates. Integrate concept of industry expertise and knowledge of m/c business. BDM’s generate leads, pursue opportunities, manage the sales process, close deals and generate revenue.

* Focused on the new accounts and new cross-sell opportunities within existing accounts.
* Understand the utility industry, regional business influences, individual utility goals and KPIs uncovered through research to be highly effective in outreach campaigns.
* Expected to develop and implement territory and account plans and a strategy to grow relationships and revenue.
* Business Developers (hunters) report directly (solid line) to the Chief Business Development Officer.
* Sells all enterprise solutions (Meridian Cooperative, Arista, and Futura)
* Business Developers have clear sales targets/goals and are expected to meet or exceed these goals.
* Business Developers are enterprise solution salespeople and are expected to develop overall business use cases and high-level technical knowledge of all solutions, leveraging product owners who “major” in the solution to provide in-depth knowledge in one or more product lines.
* Effectively grow, manage, and forecast the pipeline accurately and report to senior management the expectation of revenue growth as a commitment that can be relied upon.
* Reports issues and/or new functionality acting as liaison to executives at the utility to executive sponsors.
* Expected to work with Revenue team and establish the ROI around the proposed solutions and determine/uncover additional business issues that can be resolved by expanding the use of the Meridian Co-op platform.
* Leverages and collaborates with the Business Development Operations and Relationship Management staff.
* Communicate commitments from support or product owners.
* Expected to share innovative ideas based upon the business needs uncovered during discovery.
* Understands and communicates the value proposition of the proposed solution mapping the use of the solution to an ROI.
* Represents the company at conferences, meetings, and networking events.
* Travel to customer sites when necessary for onsite audits, special projects, or account reviews.
* Responsible for integrating and/or maintaining customer information and contacts across several platforms, including third party software and internal systems.
* Travel: 50-70%

Bachelor's Degree with 5-6 years of Business Development/Sales experience.

**We Offer:**

* Outstanding Medical/Dental/Vision that starts on the first day of employment.
* Education/Training Reimbursement
* On-Site Education Courses
* Flexible Spending Account
* Health/Wellness Reimbursement (fitness tracking device one-time up to $300)
* Excellent Life Insurance & Disability
* Vacation: 22 days of accrued time off (no waiting period). 9 holidays which include the day after Thanksgiving & Christmas Eve. Up to 240 hours of vacation time can rollover to the following year.
* Volunteer Time: 8 hours per year
* Retirement: very robust 401K employees are 100% vested in the Company-funded employer basic contributions from the date they enter the plan. The Company will match 100% of each dollar you contribute on the first five percent (5%) of eligible compensation that you contribute to your account. Employer basic contribution eligibility occurs on the first day of the month following the employee’s completion of one year of continuous service (contribution of 4-11% of base salary based on years of service).

In addition to a competitive salary, medical/dental/vision plan, and matching 401(k), also offer:

* Relaxed Dress Code
* Flexible Hybrid Work Schedules
* In Office Gym

**About Us:**

We were formed in 1976 by a group of Electric Membership Cooperatives with a vision for a single enterprise solution provider to serve data processing, IT, and operational needs to cooperatives, public utility districts, and municipal utilities. Through carefully curated acquisitions and partnerships, Meridian Co-op has unified multiple leading-edge companies under its umbrella to truly execute that vision. Today, the Meridian Suite serves over 500 utilities across the country with industry leading enterprise software solutions.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $95,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Home Alliance is a growing nationwide network of home service experts on a mission to bring world-class service to every American household with the utmost convenience. We are committed to providing convenient, comprehensive, and ‌professional home services to families nationwide. We are guided by values of customer obsession, an execution-first approach, and an "invent and simplify" mentality.**

**As the Business Development Manager for our Lead Bank project, you will oversee lead generation and distribution for home service businesses across the United States. The Lead Bank project focuses on providing high-quality leads to our clients through various sources. Your primary responsibility will be to manage partner onboarding, lead distribution, project finances, team leadership, and stakeholder communication. Requirements** :

* Proven project management experience, preferably in lead generation or digital marketing.
* Understanding of the home service industry and lead generation dynamics.
* Excellent negotiation and communication skills.
* Solid financial acumen.
* Demonstrated leadership skills.
* Proficiency in project management tools.
* Strong problem-solving skills.

**Working conditions** : **Remote full-time, Monday-Friday 08:00AM — 5:00PM PST Los Angeles Time**

**Duties** : **Partner Onboarding:**

* Identify potential partner companies within the home service industry.
* Develop and maintain relationships with potential partners.
* Lead negotiations and contractual agreements.
* Coordinate the onboarding process and provide necessary training.

**Lead Management:**

* Design and implement efficient lead distribution processes.
* Ensure timely and accurate delivery of leads to partner companies.
* Monitor lead quality and optimize lead generation strategies.

**Financial Oversight:**

* Develop and manage project budgets.
* Monitor revenue streams and expenses for profitability.
* Implement cost-effective strategies to maximize ROI.
* Prepare financial reports and forecasts.

**Team Leadership:**

* Lead and motivate cross-functional teams.
* Provide guidance and support for professional development.
* Conduct performance evaluations.

**Stakeholder Communication:**

* Serve as the primary point of contact for partner companies.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders.
* Communicate project progress to senior management and stakeholders.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $1,000.00 - $3,000.00 per month

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Finance Transformation Manager
description:
**Get to know Okta**

  

Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.


Okta is seeking a top tier candidate for the Manager, Finance Transformation position. In this role, you will report to the Director, Finance Transformation, supporting Record to Report, Procure to Pay, Tax and Treasury teams to drive long-lasting and scalable change. This role will require both the ability to think strategically about long-term roadmaps and execute tactically. You will partner with Business Technology (BT) and your key stakeholders to identify changes to business processes and opportunities for automation and transformation. You will structure and define project goals, articulate business value, and call out risks to execution. You will also partner with your stakeholders to design new business processes, and support effective change management to deliver on planned benefits and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. You should be able to articulate the value of your work to executives, use your influence and innovation to support Finance and push its initiatives forward, and communicate status, risks, and remediation plans to stakeholders. Key to this role will be your ability to learn quickly, think strategically, build cross-functional relationships, communicate effectively with executives and stakeholders, work independently and proactively, and apply critical thinking skills while planning and executing projects.



**Responsibilities**:


* Influence and advocate for process improvement changes cross-functionally between Finance, Accounting, and BT
* Collaborate with stakeholders to design tailored processes based on best practices focused on scaling and efficiency while creating detailed project plans to accomplish a transformation roadmap
* Develop concise, and compelling business value cases with measurable outcomes for proposed projects and programs for changes/ enhancements to process and/or technology capabilities
* Use analytical and problem-solving skills to make complex business concepts easily digestible to BT and impacted stakeholders
* Develop a strong understanding of Okta end-to-end processes that will allow you to bridge gaps and create synergies between departments and execute cross-functional projects effectively
* Serve as business lead, driver and orchestrator on projects in close partnership and collaboration with SMEs by understanding current state, capturing pain points, defining future state, and defining business/product requirements (BRD)/user stories for new capabilities as well as enhancements
* Apply project and program management skills to serve as the primary point of contact and liaison between functional business teams and the BT organization to drive accountability and ownership
* Design and conduct organizational and functional assessments of the RTR areas and processes by leveraging feedback and data to deliver insights to decision-makers, measure operational improvements, and influence prioritization of the transformation roadmap
* Produce content and materials such as executive status updates, steering committee decks, etc. with an emphasis on transparency, exposure, and knowledge sharing
* Must be a "self-starter", highly proactive, and resourceful with a track record of taking ownership and delivering results with a serious desire to have a positive impact on our company


**Experience**:


* Minimum of 6+ years of business, consulting, and/or auditing experience specifically in the Record to Report (GL Operations, Financial Statement Close, SEC reporting and International statutory reporting), Accounts Payable, and/or Tax & Treasury space.
* Knowledge and experience with financial system applications such as NetSuite/Oracle/SAP, Workday, Coupa, OneSource, Workiva, Avalara, Salesforce / CPQ, FinancialForce, and/or automation tools such as Robotics Process Automation (RPA) is a plus
* Vendor evaluation and/or technology implementation is a plus
* Experienced in Process Improvement methodologies (Lean and/or Six Sigma Black Belt, or similar), Project Management methodologies, and leading organizational transformation practices
* Demonstrated track record of successfully managing and owning cross functional initiatives
* Experience in high-growth technology (or similar) companies is a plus
* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, or equivalent from an accredited college/university; CPA or another advanced professional credential is preferred


#LI-MK1

**The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in the San Francisco Bay area is between:**

$128,000—$192,000 USD
Below is the annual base salary range for candidates located in California, Colorado, New York and Washington. Your actual base salary will depend on factors such as your skills, qualifications, experience, and work location. In addition, Okta offers equity (where applicable), bonus, and benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), flexible spending account, and paid leave (including PTO and parental leave) in accordance with our applicable plans and policies. To learn more about our Total Rewards program please visit: https://rewards.okta.com/us.

 **The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in California (excluding San Francisco Bay Area), Colorado, New York, and Washington is between:**


$103,000—$172,000 USD**What you can look forward to as an Okta employee!**


* Amazing Benefits
* Making Social Impact
* Fostering Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging at Okta


Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.



Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and convictions records, consistent with applicable laws. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please use this Form to request an accommodation.



Okta is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy at https://www.okta.com/privacy-policy/.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**About The Sales Factory**  

The Sales Factory is a fast growth B2B prospecting company. We are on a mission to be the gold standard for outbound sales prospecting by helping organizations close more deals through pipeline contribution. We are looking to hire the right people today that will drive growth and excellence within the organization.  

 Our prospecting teams use cutting-edge technology to find the right target audiences, then feed our trained Business Development Representatives to move opportunities down the pipeline for our clients with proprietary strategies.  

This job is remote anywhere in Canada. We are looking for aspiring sales leaders who want to join a remote-first company with the option to work from anywhere in the country. **The Opportunity**  

We are actively seeking an individual for this role to contribute to our team's success by delivering exceptional service through expert knowledge, industry best practices, and outstanding sales performance. The ideal team member will play a key role in fostering long-term client partnerships, ensuring the delivery of exceptional value and return on investment.  

This role will involve leading and inspiring a high-performing business development team, overseeing on-boarding, training, and motivation. You will drive achievement of sales quotas by setting objectives, monitoring performance, and fostering continuous skill development. In addition to the above, you will elevate the team's success through comprehensive forecasting, ensuring consistently exceptional results!  

The goal is to establish TSF as a valuable asset for our clients in realizing their customer and revenue growth objectives.  

If you are interested in making an impact - this opportunity is for you!
### **Cool Things You'll Do**

* Onboarding, training, and motivating a team of business development professionals
* Ensuring that quotas are met by establishing regular check-ins with sales teams to set objectives and monitor overall performance/progress
* Consistently fostering the team's skill development to ensure the application of successful sales strategies and processes, contributing to the achievement of sales goals
* Successfully achieving client objectives as a result of thorough planning, establishing sales goals and meticulously analyzing performance data
* Lead revenue expansion initiatives by cultivating and nurturing key client relationships, analyzing market trends, and identifying new business opportunities, resulting in an upswing in overall account revenue
* Taking on a comprehensive approach to forecasting, ensuring that strategies are well-informed and adaptive to dynamic market conditions
* Meet and exceed client expectations, fostering sustainable success in sales initiatives

### **What You Bring To The Table**

* 3-5+ years experience as an Business Development/Account Manager, Account Executive, mix of both or other relevant experience
* Demonstrated experience of leadership capabilities and interpersonal skills to inspire and motivate teams, encouraging them to consistently deliver their optimal performance
* You enjoy using insights and data-driven decisions in the sales process
* The ability to recognize the benefits of technology and to learn new systems quickly
* Proactive drive to innovate and create effective solutions
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* A desire to be successful, you’ll be a goal-oriented team player

### **What We Offer**

* Competitive salary
* We are a fully remote team with people across North America and parts of Europe. People who succeed here are those that embrace the remote lifestyle of working wherever makes you happy!
* Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision)
* Flexible working hours
* Events and activities both team-based and company-wide that inspire, educate, and cultivate well-being

The Sales Factory is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Summary**  
This is a fully remote position. The corporate office is located in Nashville, TN.  
Bachelor's Degree and five plus (5+) years of outside Business to Business (B to B) sales and/or operational experience within the industry are absolute requirements for this position. Experience in contracted hospital support services is desired. Frequent travel required, at least 25%, as needed to perform essential job duties and responsibilities.  
The Business Development Manager will actively develop leads, as well as follow up on those generated through Marketing, telemarketing, participation in tradeshows, and other interactions with customers and prospects in providing EVS, housekeeping, and/or maintenance services to high-traffic public facilities. These facilities include, but are not limited to, airports, hospitals/healthcare facilities, arenas/stadiums/sports venues, concert/event venues, indoor/outdoor retail and lifestyle centers, educational facilities, hospitality venues, etc. The Business Development Manager must be self-motivating, and able to execute sales plans to meet and grow sales volumes nationwide. This position is responsible for developing and maintaining effective relationships with customers, key stakeholders, and business partners to create, maximize, and leverage opportunities to generate sales. This position may also participate in, and/or manage teams regarding mergers, acquisitions, and affiliations. This position reports to the President.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**  
Includes the following, but other duties may be assigned-

* Frequent travel required, at least 25%, as needed to perform essential job duties and responsibilities.
* Conduct aggressive number of sales calls, event appearances, proposals, presentations, etc.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with existing customers and targeted accounts nationwide to meet sales goals and to grow sales volume.
* Identify and establish relationships that create sales opportunities through increased program awareness.
* Partner and coordinate with key stakeholders such as marketing, manufacturing partners, customer service and others to facilitate acquisition of new accounts.
* Continuously refine criteria and processes for identifying and successfully executing new business opportunities.
* Collaborate with Marketing to develop effective targeted communications campaigns.
* Attend bid walks and meetings to gain new partnerships and retain current partnerships.
* Coordinate with Marketing to develop proposals, presentations, etc.
* Attend events, tradeshows, and gather information to research sales opportunities nationwide. This includes evaluating and determining service needs by industry type.
* Utilize SalesForce to track and report sales activity, intelligence, and opportunities, for effective follow through and timely communication with management.
* Responsible for gaining knowledge of situation and status within each key prospect account and reporting on landscape through SalesForce.
* Execute sales plan focusing on both annual goals and long-term growth. This includes identification of new customer targets, conducting needs analysis, presentation of appropriate value proposition, and effective qualification of the prospect's potential.
* Works with billing department to finalize contract summary forms for new business and any changes with existing business.
* Works with the customer and SMS's Legal Department to finalize service agreements/contracts for new business, as well as working with Executive Leadership Team to negotiate and finalize the renewal of service agreements for existing accounts upon termination date or new agreements including any changes to existing or current contracts needed.
* Participates in the startup activities of new accounts to ensure contract build is followed.
* Monitors own business expenses and submits expense reports to CSC weekly.
* Must follow most recent travel expense policy and seek approval per the President's requirements in the policy.
* Attends required meetings or conference calls called by the President. Weekly reporting sales, travel, and other recaps to the President.
* Monthly required to attend corporate calls, provide recaps, Gain-Loss updates, and sales funnel updates.
* Quarterly required to provide Board Book recaps and reporting.
* Coordinates with key staff at our corporate headquarters regarding financial, safety, supply, equipment and human relations matters.
* May occasionally be required to travel to and assist with sister company support towards SMS Holdings' growth and total sales goals.
* Responds to and handles confidential and sensitive information with poise, tact, and diplomacy.
* Participates and contributes to brainstorming and Strategic Planning meetings and calls that directly correlate with the company's continued growth and success.
* Participates in required meetings or conference calls coordinated by Executive Leadership Team.
* Assist with identifying, researching and communicating cost-saving and innovative options for company.
* Assist in yearly budget preparation.
* Attends mandatory live training sessions and completes online training, as assigned.

Requirements:**Qualifications**  
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* **EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:** Bachelor's Degree and five plus (5+) years of outside sales and/or operations experience within the industry are absolute requirements for this position. Experience in contracted hospital support services is desired.
* **COMPETENCIES:** Professional communication skills (oral, written, presentation). Proven executive level interpersonal skills. Strong sales prospecting, qualifying, negotiating, and closing skills. Excellent organizational skills, detail oriented, and able to multitask in a fast-paced environment. Demonstrate industry-leading understanding of healthcare, housekeeping, and maintenance trends, drivers, and evolving alignment options utilizing market information to guide business development efforts and to inform strategy. Demonstrate strong understanding of company products or services as well as business position and competition to keep business competitive.
* **COMPUTER SKILLS:** Must be able to perform basic computer activities, including using Word and Excel, processing e-mails with attachments and receiving training via the computer. Knowledge of SalesForce is a plus, although not a requirement. Good PC skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, CRM/SalesForce.com).
* **LANGUAGE ABILITY:** Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers, the public, or employees of organization.
* **MATH ABILITY:** Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs, pie charts, and other reporting materials.
* **CERTIFICATES AND LICENSES:** No certifications needed.
* **REASONING ABILITY:** Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

**Supervisory Responsibilities**  
This role does not have any supervisory responsibilities.

**Work Environment**  
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to toxic or caustic chemicals and vibration. The employee is occasionally exposed to work in high, precarious places. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.

**Physical Demands**  
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit and climb or balance. The employee may frequently lift and/or move more than 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception, and Ability to adjust focus.

**Travel Requirements**  
Frequent travel required, at least 25%, as needed to perform essential job duties and responsibilities. Position also occasionally requires travel to the corporate office in Nashville, TN. Travel is normally either via privately owned vehicle, rental vehicle, or air. Operational responsibility may require travel for up to several weeks at a time.

* This job description is not a contract for any specific period of time and may be adjusted at the employer's discretion based on changing or newly identified needs of the position.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities
* Commission pay

Work Location: Remote

title: Business Development Manager - JSS

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Our mission**


At Local Logic we are building the most comprehensive intelligence platform to optimize every Real Estate decision in the world.

  

Local Logic is digitizing the built world to make it universally understandable and actionable for consumers, investors, developers, and governments with the ambition of helping build cities that are more sustainable and equitable for the people that live in them. To achieve that dream, we quantify the built world using data and AI to interpret the US and Canadian real estate market.

  

Local Logic delivers market leading, sophisticated location insights through webtools, APIs, one-click reports and a data analytics platform. Our insights are powered by billions of data points we’ve generated that describe all aspects of cities - from the distance to the nearest bus stop, the quietness on a street, to the most recent trends in the housing market and more!

 **Your mission**


As Local Logic’s Business Development Manager**,** you’ll be responsible for and integral to the growth and advancement of Local Logic as a Global leader in providing real estate data and analytics to the world. In this position, you will be part of the revenue-driving Sales team, reporting to the Senior Vice President of Strategic Partnerships and Sales within the Growth org. You will be responsible for bringing in new data partnerships/accounts across the US with specific revenue goals. You will also contribute cross-functionally within the Growth Org (Sales, Marketing, BusDev, Customer Success), Product and Executive Leadership.

 **About You**

  

You are a go getter! You believe in our mission and want to help us achieve it. You understand how valuable your role is to the team and the company as a whole.. You’re able to speak up when you disagree, ask questions when you don’t understand, and take ownership of your work.

  

We’d love for you to work from the office but also recognize that sometimes working from home is more practical, so if you want to work remotely, you’ll have all the necessary tools and support you need to do so.

 **Why should you work here?**


At Local Logic, you have an amazing opportunity to be an early team member of an expanding Series B backed startup. We are focused on understanding the world and its cities to predict the future, and make the real estate market more transparent.


We are a people first company that strives to create the best experience for our employees by creating an inclusive, collaborative, challenging environment to learn and problem solve on a daily basis.


You will have access to benefits such as: stock options; comprehensive health, dental and vision plans for you and your family; a culture that emphasizes learning and work-life harmony; competitive vacation policy; health and benefits credits

**Our commitment to diversity & inclusion**


We’re aiming to build a diverse team and inclusive company culture. We are an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

 **As Business Development Manager your responsibilities will include:**

* Achieve monthly targets to grow new business, renewals and upsells of Local Logic products
* Translate client needs into product feedback to achieve revenue goals
* Create new relationships/accounts for Local Logic within target verticals across Canada and the US
* Track all outreach and partner activities in our CRM - Salesforce
* Work closely with key internal stakeholders and the Growth Org to increase revenue
* As needed, represent the company at conferences and events
* Be willing to do the “small” tasks, as well as the large strategic ones
* Travel as needed to exceed goals - travel is a requirement of the role

 **Key requirements**

* Must have 3+ years in Business Development or Sales with proven track record
* Energetic and ambitious, with a go-getter attitude
* Loves a challenge and is willing to move mountains to succeed.
* Located either in the US or Canada and significant experience and knowledge of the Canadian or US residential real estate industry
* Bilingual with excellent English and French written, verbal and presentation skills
* Ability to embrace change and adapt to shifting priorities (agile mindset)
* Practical understanding of the role data plays in the decision process
* Working knowledge of CRM systems, ideally Salesforce preferred
* Comfortable with Google Drive, Google for Work, and cloud-based technology such as Slack

title: Solar and ESS Business Development Manager
description:
**Company Overview**


Targray - Building sustainable solutions for a world in transition


Established in 1987 in Montreal, Canada, Targray is a global leader in the sourcing, transportation, storage, trading and distribution of commodities and advanced materials for a broad range of industry sectors. Our supply solutions help reduce the world's carbon footprint while enabling our customers to create safer, more reliable products for consumers.


Targray has operations in 11 countries and over $1B USD in annual sales. In 2019, the company made its debut appearance on the FP500, Financial Post’s ranking of the top 500 corporations in Canada by revenue.

* Great Place to Work® | Best Workplaces in Quebec (2020-2023)
* Deloitte | Best Managed Companies (2019 - 2022)

**Job Summary**


Targray is currently seeking an experienced business development manager to join its Solar and Energy Storage Division and support our business growth in North America. We are looking for a team player who:

* Is positive thinking
* Is self-disciplined
* Has a never give up mindset
* Has independent problem-solving skills


You will be a driver for new business development within the Renewable Energy Industry in Solar and Energy Storage in the Growing North America market. Our focus is the distribution of solar and energy storage materials and products with a focus on supply chain solutions to our customer/suppliers. You will reach out to all potential customers/suppliers within the country, identify the opportunities, and spearhead the development of solutions together with our internal teams (Risk, Legal, Finance and Operation).


If you are driven and you want to grow and you have high potential, you might be our person. In this role, you will report to Head – International Sales, Solar and Energy Storage Division. This is a great opportunity for a young professional to continue to grow their career, learn a new environment and create value.


This position is home-office based.

**Responsibilities**

* Through personal networking/web searches/traveling and participating in trade shows & calls, reach out to all potential customers/suppliers and explore any new business opportunities
* Develop and maintain relationships with potential customers/suppliers
* Develop the deal structures and work with all stakeholders based on internal guidelines and process requirements
* Report and update on market trends & product development to management on a regular basis
* Follow up and support order executions together with internal stakeholders

**Requirements**

* Minimum 5 to 7 years’ experience in Renewable Energy - especially in the Solar and Energy Storage Sector
* Strong existing network of relevant contacts including suppliers and customers within the solar and energy storage industry
* Ability to effectively collaborate with team members on a remote basis
* Ability to work independently and close deals with minimum guidance and support
* Prior Understanding of Trade Financing and the Supply Chain is an asset

**Benefits**

* Highly competitive remuneration.
* Flexible work arrangement policy.
* Medical and dental insurance.
* Retirement Savings Plan with employer matching.

**Diversity & Inclusion**


Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We are committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. We welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds, and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. When people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.


For more information about our company, please visit Targray at www.targray.com.#LI-Hybrid

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Who are you?**



You are a people person.



The heart and soul of this job is meeting people and finding ways to help them.



You are a problem solver who dots I’s and crosses T’s on their well organized to do list.



Your follow up and follow through turns promises into performance.



You are a team player who can lead as well as support - and know when to do both.

 **What's the Job?**



Reporting to the Director of Business Development, as a business development manager at RaceRocks you will play a crucial role collaborating with the sales and marketing team in identifying and cultivating new business opportunities within the defense, aerospace and marine sectors. You will be an important member of the Business Development team that will be attending industry conferences and business development events. Your responsibilities will include conducting market research to assess potential clients, analyzing industry trends, and staying abreast of geopolitical developments that may impact defense procurement. You will support and document the sales process using a CRM as well as collaborating with cross-functional teams on the development of proposals and competitive bids, and new contracts. Additionally, you will be tasked with building and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders, such as government agencies, military officials, and industry partners. Success in this role requires a combination of business acumen, understanding of defense technologies, and adept relationship skills to help the team secure and expand our work in the defence sector.

 **Qualifications**


* Five to seven years experience in business development is strongly preferred with a background in the technology, defense, marine or aerospace industries
* Experience as a part of a team developing and executing strategic business development.
* Knowledge of the Canadian defense industry and prime contractors is highly advantageous.
* Experience working with government and Indigenous relations is an asset
* A Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Public Relations or a related field is an asset

  


**Skills**


* Exceptional communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to engage and influence various stakeholders.
* Proficient in using CRM software (such as HubSpot) for sales pipeline management and reporting.
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to see the big picture while also focusing on detailed execution.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to operate effectively in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
* Culturally sensitive and adept at working with diverse groups, including Indigenous communities.

 **Working Conditions**: Remote work  

  

  



**Perks:**


* Flexible work hours including optional flex Fridays
* 3 weeks vacation to start and 5 paid sick days
* Work from home stipend
* Extended health benefits including dental, life insurance, vision care and mental wellness program
* Employee Stock Option Plan
* Social events hosted by the Culture Committee
* Professional development program

  


**Please note:**

  

* All candidates must be able to pass security assessments as required by Public Services and Procurement Canada.

  



RaceRocks is a remote-first company with team members across Canada, with an office for optional use in Victoria. Team members are required to be available for team building and collaboration during core operating hours of 9:00 am to 2:00 pm Pacific Time. Outside of core working hours, we offer flexibility to support work-life balance. Although our HQ is in Victoria, BC we are open to hiring candidates from nearly anywhere in Canada. At this time, we do not have the infrastructure to support hiring candidates from Quebec or to hire/support working internationally.

  

We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, Black peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, any qualified person of legal working age, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

  

Should you require any accommodation, please inform us and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any accessibility-related assistance, please contact us at peopleops@racerocks3d.com

  

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Business Development Manager (REMOTE)
description:
**Location Address:**


123 Main Street, Atlanta, Georgia 30346**Work Shift:**


Salary Exempt (United States of America)***Altium Packaging, Our Culture Differentiates Us!***  

  

We incorporate our Guiding Principles into all aspects and at all levels of the organization and use them as a framework for decision-making. We believe our Guiding Principles foster a culture of excellence that benefits both employees and customers.

***Our Guiding Principles***

* Act with Integrity & in Compliance
* Drive Value Creation
* Be Disciplined Entrepreneurs
* Focus on the Customer
* Act with Humility
* Treat others with Dignity and Respect
* Seeking Fulfillment in your Work


This position will lead sales and business development activities for Altium Healthcare. We are looking for a hunter who has experience in a complex sales environment, has strong customer relationships and the motivation to find new business.
Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Expand Altium’s presence with pharmacy retail chains, health system pharmacies, PBM and GPOs by developing value creating commercial strategies with our portfolio of pharmacy packaging solutions (pharmaceutical vials, bottles, liquid bottles, custom caps, etc.).
* Use competitive analysis and market research to drive business goals.
* Daily hands-on execution of sales objectives to achieve KPIs, including sales reporting, market mapping and analytics, pipeline management, bid preparation etc. in order to drive growth in identified markets.
* Build and/or maintain a strong, sustainable relationship with strategic customers and partners by reinforcing quality, continuous innovation, and solution selling.
* Explore assigned markets to secure targeted accounts; opportunities to evaluate include product line extensions and expansion to fit on existing capital equipment, as well as validation of needs for additional equipment investments.
* Interface with plant teams, customer service and group sales leaders and report findings.
* Work as a team with assigned national market packaging development engineers to facilitate bringing value added products to the region.
* Manage and communicate customer requirements, product marketing and act as a liaison to the manufacturing teams.
* Assist in the areas of strategy development, customer design management, account management, and account support.
* Attend sales and industry trade shows in order to network, learn substitute products and identify new opportunities and threats.
* Provide monthly sales forecasts as well as weekly detailed sales and activity reports to management.
* Consistently demonstrates Altium Packaging’s Guiding Principles.

**Required:*** Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing or related discipline or equivalent experience
* A minimum of 8 years of experience in technical sales role in a similar industry or calling on a similar customer base
* Proven track record of obtaining new customers and a competitive mentality; a “hunter” and a closer
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to negotiate with a demonstrated background of closing deals
* Experience with large, national accounts and/or partnering with distributors
* Greenfield sales, value selling, or solution selling experience
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint) to build budgets and forecasts and to create presentations.
* Knowledge of and experience with Customer Relationship Management (CRMs) and sales pipeline management tools for tracking and reporting of current and future opportunities.
* Travel required based on business needs, approximately 50%

**Preferred:**

* Packaging sales experience in the plastics industry (pill bottles, vials)
* Experience calling on customers in the pharmacy chains, healthcare, grocery chains, government, wholesale, and specialty pharmacy verticals or related industries


#L1-SM1

***We Believe in Rewarding our Most Important Resource – Our People!***  

  

We show our commitment to Total Rewards by providing a competitive, comprehensive benefits package. In addition to medical, dental and vision plans, company holidays and vacation days, tuition reimbursement, learning and training opportunities, bonus potential, and a 401(k) plan with company contributions, Altium Packaging locations offer rewards and recognition programs and opportunities to make a difference in the community.

 **EEO Statement**

  

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

  

Take your career to the next level at Altium Packaging!

title: Business Development Manager
Business Development Manager - Contract
description:
**BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER**

**Company: Thomas, Large & Singer Inc.**

**Location: Markham, Ontario**

**Industries: Consumer Packaged Goods, Logistics, Distribution, Private Label,**  

**Industrial Ingredients**

**Job Type: Full Time**

**Years of Experience: 5-7 years**

**Education Level: University or College**

**Job description:**

Thomas, Large & Singer Inc. is a leading provider of comprehensive value chain solutions to leading
  

consumer packaged goods brands in the Canadian market as well as sales services to branded, private
  

label and industrial ingredient manufacturer’s.
  

  

Our dynamic team is growing at TLS. Currently we require the services of a strong ***Business Development***  

***Manager*** to join our team for a 14-month contract. Reporting directly to the Vice President of Sales
  

Management, the Business Development Manager is responsible for working in partnership with our
  

clients to develop and execute sales and marketing strategies in the Canadian market. This position works
  

closely with our clients; TLS supply chain and finance teams as well as external sales broker partners with
  

the territory encompassing the Canadian market.
  

  

**Responsibilities include:**  

  

Within the Canadian marketplace the Business Development Manager will be responsible for developing
  

and executing sales strategies built in conjunction with client partners with the goal of profitably growing
  

the business in both dollars and market share. Execution will be done in partnership with external national
  

sales brokers, reporting to the candidate. Calling on select Customers directly as well may be required.
  

Management of displays (including development) and marketing programs is also expected, along with
  

managing retail merchandising initiatives to maximize visibility and drive sales. Development of the Food
  

Service Channel may also be required. All the above duties will be carried out while managing to set
  

budgets. Autonomy will be given to manage and leverage the tools provided to meet clearly identified
  

goals.  

  

  

  



  

**Thomas, Large & Singer Inc.**

15 Allstate Parkway, Suite 400 **t**. 905.754.3500


Markham, Ontario, Canada L3R 5B4 www.tlscanada.com


* Develop and execute client sales strategies in the Canadian market
* Work closely and direct broker sales partners (Manage and develop

reporting/trackers/communication)
  

* Profitably grow share, distribution, and net sales
* Work closely with clients as main point of contact within the Canadian market
* Manage annual sales budget forecasting and production/inventory communication process
* Display development and merchandising execution planning and oversight
* Deduction management and follow-up with brokers & retailers
* Trade spend budgeting, management and continuous improvement
* Develop retail and sales broker incentives
**Qualifications:**
  

* 5-7 years of experience in consumer packaged goods sales management (progressive roles)
* Experience with Client and Broker Management
* Proven record of success in growing sales while managing trade spend
* Working knowledge of category management techniques (build story by analyzing, assessing, and
acting on insights)
  

* Excellent presentation and communication skills
* Good organizational and time management skills
* University degree
* Driver’s License
* Moderate travel required (including US) for client meetings as well as sales appointments
* MS Office including Excel, PowerPoint, Word & Outlook
* Host client on market visits and lead ‘Quarterly Business Reviews’ with client
  

**Desired Skills:**

* Working knowledge of Nielsen MarketTrack, IRI
* POS data software: IRI, Ldia, Retail Link Aztec
* Sales broker relationship management
* Customer marketing experience

What’s In It For You…
  

* **Great team** dynamic and tight knit company culture. One of the most important factors in
choosing your next role is the people you work with and our people are AWESOME!
  

* **Flexible work environment**. Ability to work from home 2 days per week.
* **Competitive compensation package** (salary & bonus). We get it – money isn’t everything, but it’s
still a very important factor.
  

* **Benefits** – Health & Dental, Life Insurance, Disability Insurance, Parameds – Massage!
* **Pension Matching** (after 1 year – employees put in 5% and TLS matches with 5%)
* **Tuition and professional fees** reimbursement.
* **Summer Hours Program** – who doesn’t want to leave early on Fridays to spend more time with
friends and family while the sun is shining.
  

  

Interested candidates may apply with their resume and salary expectations to HR@tlscanada.com  



  

**Thomas, Large & Singer Inc.**

15 Allstate Parkway, Suite 400 **t**. 905.754.3500


Markham, Ontario, Canada L3R 5B4 www.tlscanada.com


We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
  

  

*Thomas, Large & Singer welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.*  

*Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.*  

**About Thomas, Large & Singer Inc.:**  

  

Thomas, Large and Singer Inc. provides Canada wide consolidated distribution services to many leading
  

brands. Combined logistics allows these brands to take advantage of TLS’ warehousing and freight
  

synergies while the brand owner maintains control of their pricing, sales and trade marketing plans. TLS’
  

proprietary IT systems allow each brand owner real time control of their strategies in the Canadian
  

market. TLS also provides sales brokerage services to companies wishing to supply private label products
  

to Canada’s retail grocery chains as well as industrial ingredient sales to relevant industrial manufacturers.
  

TLS has been servicing the needs of the Canadian consumer for over 100 years.
  

  

To find out more, please go to our website www.tlscanada.com  



  

**Thomas, Large & Singer Inc.**

15 Allstate Parkway, Suite 400 **t**. 905.754.3500

title: Business Development Manager - Remote
description:
***SequentialHR + Recruiting is looking for a seasoned sales professional for a 100% commission-based position. This will be a contract position and the ideal candidate will be able to sell monthly hiring subscriptions and recruiting services anywhere in Canada. This position is 100% remote and the commission structure is generous with no cap on how much you can make.***


**What will you be doing?**


**ProHiring|365** - This hiring system was built to save time for companies with ongoing hiring needs. This system works best for high turnover positions like servers, technicians, massage therapists, etc. You will be selling a monthly subscription to potential clients/companies. Once you have sold the system, the team at Sequential will set up the client and maintain the relationship with them to give you time to sell to more clients. You will have no ongoing client servicing once you bring in the new client.


**Recruiting** - we are looking for new companies with a great company culture that are hiring and would like our boutique-style expertise to get the right person for their open positions. Industries include finance and accounting, legal, management and IT. We offer personalized service, assessments, interviewing and a 120-day guarantee. The ideal client is mid-sized companies with 10-100 employees with ongoing hiring needs.


**Compensation:**



ProHiring|365


* The commission starts at 20% of the monthly subscription
* The average subscription is $300-400/month
* Sell 10 subscriptions per month - earn $600 - 800
* Base of 100 clients - earn $6,000 - 8,000/month


Recruiting


* The commission starts at 4% of the base salary of filled positions.
* Eg. a base Salary of $100,000 - the commission would be $4,000.
* Increase to 5% after $1M in salaried positions filled (~ roughly 10 positions)


**The ideal candidate:**


* Loves to sell and has a knack for getting to the right decision maker to close the deal efficiently
* Has 3-5 years of experience selling professional services preferably in recruiting or HR
* Has a diploma/degree in business, marketing or equivalent
* Is a trusting and kind person who believes in the service they are selling


**Interested?**



Please go trrough our application system by subitting your resume, answering some quetions and doing a quick phone interview. If selected, we will contact you to set up an interview.

title: Business Development Manager - Central Ontario
description:
**Company Description:**

iFinance Canada Inc. is a well-established national consumer financing company that’s offer various financing to Canadians since 1996. We are part of Iceberg Finance Group, a sister company based in Quebec that also does business across Canada.

We are a dynamic, rapidly growing organization currently recruiting for a performance-driven Business Development Manager to join our team. We are looking for a high-energy, '‘out-of-the-box” thinker, with a track record of success building a robust pipeline of qualified leads, and solid B2B Sales experience.

**The Opportunity:**

Reporting to the Director of Business Development & Strategic Partnerships, the BDM is responsible for driving revenue growth by qualifying and closing qualifying leads across GTA and Central Ontario, that are sourced through a combination of inbound marketing campaigns with outbound prospecting. This role requires a hunter mentality, outstanding presentation skills, and excels in networking and relationship building. This position involves sourcing, emailing, calling, and visiting potential contacts and existing accounts as well as attending tradeshows, and any events deemed appropriate.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Prospect for potential large accounts from targeted industries (ie. Education, Consumer Products, Home improvement, etc.) using various methods such as cold calling, emails, LinkedIn, face-to-face meetings, networking events and trade shows
* Identification of high impact, strategic opportunities, you will build a strong sales pipeline and manage all stages of the sales life cycle
* Execute strategic sales plans that will win new business, onboard effectively and drive incremental loan volume
* Respond promptly and professionally to both written and phone inquiries regarding products, client inquiries, partner resources, procedures, and systems
* Deliver effective, custom sales presentations and product demonstrations to prospects
* Identify customer needs and pain points to best position iFinance's financing solutions
* Ensure all communications are logged and tracked in our CRM
* Leverage data-based tools to provide business KPIs and ongoing reporting to strategic partners
* Deliver consistently against assigned volume goals, while prioritizing and delivering an excellent business experience to iFinance’s merchant and service provider partners
* Present personal performance results on a quarterly basis
* Complete other duties and responsibilities as defined by the management team

**Why you would love to work at iFinance:**

* A collaborative and team focus culture
* Competitive salary with performance-based commission
* Superior benefits including extended health care paid by the company
* RRSP program with company match
* Beautiful new office located in downtown Toronto
* Hybrid work schedule or remote

**The successful candidate will possess the following skills and experience:**

* Minimum of 4 years of experience with business development and sales
* Strong organization and time management skills
* Great attitude with the ability to develop trusting business relationships with internal and external stakeholders
* Ability to prioritize and resolve issues
* Strong computer skills including the MS Office suite of applications
* Public speaking, presenting, and relationship management experience
* Experience in Credit, Consumer Finance and Fintech is a definite asset
* Have a vehicle and a valid driver's license

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Automobile allowance
* Company events
* Dental care
* Disability insurance
* Extended health care
* Life insurance

* Work from home

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* Commission pay

Application question(s):

* What is your salary expectation (base and commission) ?

Experience:

* Vente B2B: 3 years (required)

Willingness to travel:

title: North America Market Development Manager
description:
**Company Description**

Axipolymer is the innovation partner of North American Plastics industry. As a young company we develop new products to address the sustainability challenges faced by plastics. Our mission is to become the innovation hub of Plastics industry in North America. We are here to bring disruptive solutions to our industry and help save our Planet!

**Job Description:** 

Seeking a highly skilled and strategic North America Market Development Manager to lead our company's foray into the North American plastics industry. This role is particularly focused on engaging with food packaging producers, our primary clients, and indirectly influencing food companies.

The ideal candidate will be an adept sales strategist, renowned for their ability to effectively close deals and drive substantial business growth. This role is pivotal for someone who can combine in-depth industry knowledge with exceptional sales acumen to successfully commercialize our innovative products in the market.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Client Engagement and Deal Closure:

Actively engage with potential and existing clients to build strong relationships.

Lead negotiations and close deals, ensuring profitable partnerships.

Demonstrate a proactive approach in identifying and pursuing new sales opportunities.

Represent the company at trade shows and industry events to network and establish contacts.

* Market Development:

Develop and implement effective sales strategies.

Conduct research to identify new market opportunities and potential dealers.

Conclude nationwide sales agreements in line with company objectives.

* Collaborate with the President to formulate and execute marketing and sales plans.
* Prepare, manage, and review the sales and marketing budget/forecasts.
* Analyze sales results and marketing effectiveness to develop strategic improvement plans.
* Evaluate opportunities through in-depth market research.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* Extensive network and in-depth knowledge in the Plastics industry, specifically in Flexible and Rigid packaging, with a focus on both the Food industry and non-food applications in North America.
* Proven mastery in sales, with a significant track record of closing deals and exceeding sales targets.
* Proficiency in English; bilingual capability in English and French is preferred.
* Expertise in strategic planning, business analysis, and market development.
* Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong problem-solving, decision-making, and negotiation abilities.
* Customer-focused attitude with excellent negotiation skills.
* Analytical mindset with a problem-solving approach.
* Adaptability and a strong commitment to driving progress and innovation.
* Energetic, resilient, and passionate about achieving sales targets and company goals.

**Other Requirements:**

* Willingness to travel extensively as per business needs.
* Familiarity with the plastics, packaging, and food sectors is advantageous.

* Paid time off

* French not required
