title: Business Development Manager, Canada
description:
**About the Company**



Diagnexia, a subsidiary of Deciphex: Accelerating Certainty and Pioneering Pathology Services.

  

Diagnexia, a leading provider of pathology services, operates as a subsidiary of the parent company, Deciphex. Established in Dublin in 2017, Deciphex has rapidly expanded to become a global team of over 150 professionals, offering innovative software solutions to address the pathology reporting gap in both research and clinical areas. With a mission to accelerate the drug development process and provide timely, accurate diagnoses for cancer patients, Deciphex has established a strong presence through its offices in Dublin Ireland, Exeter & Oxford UK and Chicago USA

  

As part of the Deciphex family, Diagnexia leverages its expertise to provide cutting-edge diagnostic solutions to healthcare organizations worldwide. Our cloud-based platform enables hospitals to easily and rapidly send cases for a consultation to our team of expert subspecialists. We are dedicated to improving patient outcomes and helping healthcare organisations stay at the forefront of the industry.

  

We are software developers, clinical specialists, AI engineers, operations professionals and so much more, all working as one team to support our customers and patients. Our team culture is built on trust. We give our team the space they need to deliver results and the environment to ensure they can enjoy doing it.

  

We are looking for highly motivated individuals who are excited to take on challenges and value making a difference in their day-to-day work. This is a unique opportunity to make a difference in the emerging Digital Pathology field.

 **About this Role**



As a Business Development Manager in Canada, your job is to qualify clinical and private histopathology labs and services and to establish their need to outsource some of their reporting. From there to leverage the Diagnexia Service, focusing on capacity, TAT, Digital Pathology and the expertise in the Diagnexia Pathologist Network. You will build partnerships, collaborate to meet revenue and growth targets in the Canadian Market. We're looking for someone dynamic and results-driven with a proven track record in Clinical Diagnostics with great communication skills. This role is perfect for someone who likes a fast-paced environment and can build relationships well.

  


**About this Role (Responsibilities):**


* Identify and qualify clinical and private histopathology labs for potential outsourcing of reporting tasks.
* Promote Diagnexia Services, emphasizing key features such as capacity, turnaround time (TAT), Digital Pathology, and the expertise of the Diagnexia Pathologist Network.
* Build partnerships and collaborations with histopathology labs to drive revenue and meet growth targets in the Canadian market.
* Leverage your proven track record in Clinical Diagnostics to effectively communicate the value of Diagnexia Services.
* Demonstrate proficiency in using sales CRM tools such as HubSpot or Salesforce to streamline and enhance sales processes.
* Present clear and easily understood proposals to hospitals, outlining the benefits and value proposition of Diagnexia Services, with a focus on addressing their specific needs and challenges.
* Introducing new product / service developments to prospective clients
* Acting as representative of the company at regional trade shows, conferences and events
* Maintain and share professional knowledge through education, networking, events, and presentations
* Complete all mandatory company training and job specific training required for the role, including ISMS, GLP, DocuSign, SDLC as applicable

  


**About You (Skills and Experience):**


* Bachelor or Higher in relevant scientific field
* Minimum 3 years Business Development / Sales Experience in Canadian healthcare services industry (pathology, laboratory etc.)
* Knowledge of & experience with Canadian healthcare regulations and requirements.
* Successful track record in B2B sales with strong negotiation & persuasion skills
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong customer oriented mindset with passion for helping clients to meet their goals
* Strong project management skills - ability to plan & manage commercial projects
* Independent problem solver
* Creative, organisational and analytical skills

  


**Travel Requirements**


* Candidate must hold a valid Passport and Full, clean Drivers’ License
* Candidate will be required to travel to represent the company at Customer locations, Trade Exhibitions & promotional events within Canada and US region (50%+ Travel Time)
* Ability to undertake travel to international training events and conferences as required
* Must be fluent in English

  


**Desirable Experience**


* Experience working within pathology, laboratory, oncology, academic medical centres and/or clinical services
* Experience in Clinical Diagnostics
* Experience in field-based client relationship management or sales a distinct advantage
* Familiarity with healthcare or pathology services specifically in Canada
* Familiarity with Canadian clinical guidelines and regulations

  


**Work Environment**


* This position is a Remote / Field-based position; the work environment shall be considered as the user’s home working location along with customer locations and trade events / exhibitions as required
* This position will require remote collaboration with associates on GMT, plus US Time Zones (PST through EST), and on occasion Central European Time
* On occasion, candidate may be requested to work overtime and weekends for special program events.

  


**What are the benefits of working with Deciphex?**


* Competitive salary with performance based annual increments.
* Healthcare benefits
* Competitive annual leave
* A true sense of meaning in your work by contributing to better patient outcomes.
* The opportunity to work alongside a world-class high performing team in a hyper-growth startup environment.
* A chance to work on exciting,challenging and unique projects.
* Regular performance feedback and significant career growth opportunities.
* A highly collaborative and supportive multi cultural team.

  



Deciphex is an equal opportunities employer and we are committed to the principle of equality. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, religious beliefs, political views, gender identity, affectional or sexual orientation, national origin, family or marital status (including pregnancy), disability, membership of the travelling community or any other classification protected by applicable law.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
TailWind is seeking a seasoned and successful Business Development Manager who has at least 3-5 years of experience in sales selling IT or Tech Services to Directors and C-Level executives at fortune 1000 companies. This individual should have the drive, determination, and self-motivation to bring on new logos, increasing the company revenue. This role requires persuasive selling and prospecting skills, along with strong customer relations and negotiation of terms and pricing.

  



The Business Development Manager (BDM) will be responsible for new customer acquisitions and revenue growth as well as taking care of an existing base of TailWind current accounts. The BDM will ensure customer satisfaction and maintain positive on-going relationships to maximize sales and revenue growth for the company. The BDM is responsible for sales and revenue generation measured against monthly, quarterly, and annual quotas, as established by management. This is a dual sales role for both a hunter and a farmer within an assigned set of accounts.

  



TailWind offers competitive pay, and benefits which include 401K matching, HealthiestYou! medical, dental, vision, paid basic life insurance, options for voluntary life insurance, short/long term disability and other supplemental benefits along with PTO, Paid holidays, etc.

  


**Essential Functions**

* Identify and qualify ideal customers for Tailwind Voice & Data.
* Develop and execute strategic account plans for identified targeted accounts and any assigned marketing qualified leads.


* Identify and win new business with new logo accounts and existing customers.


* Develop customer relationships with all stakeholders, key decision-makers, and executives.
* Attain or exceed all quota goals and objectives, including pre-sale activities and revenue targets.
* Manage end-to-end sales activities with accounts and contacts within the CRM.
* Understand and articulate Tailwind’s value proposition to new and ongoing prospects and customers.
* Provide periodic reporting of customers and prospects through CRM sales and progress reports.
* Work closely with Tailwind’s cross-functional team members to provide necessary information and support throughout the end-to-end sales process, ensuring success and profitable execution.
* Have a high degree of competency around your customer’s projects, solutions, and proposal.


* Travel associated with sales may include trade shows, developmental activities, and prospecting.
  


**Required Education and Experience**


* Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing or related preferred. Experience Required:
* 3-5 years of experience in sales selling IT or Tech Services to Directors and C-Level Executives at Fortune 1000 companies
* Experience with National Accounts or Corporate decision-makers.
* History developing new accounts and opening new sales territories.
* Work with urgency through all aspects of the sales cycle through closing
* Persuasive selling skills and prospecting skills (cold calling, e-mail, social media, etc).
* Proven track record of achieving quotas of monthly sales goals
* Exhibit professionalism, a strong work ethic, and a commitment to integrity.
* Effective communication skills, with the ability to establish rapport over the phone, build credibility quickly, and clearly articulate a value proposition.
* Strong customer service orientation with ability to develop and maintain relationships, internally and externally.
* Initiative, follow-through, strong time-management skills, and the ability to multi-task.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite of PC tools.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**About StackPath**  

StackPath is cloud computing platform built at the internet’s edge, providing infrastructure and services physically closer to the source or destination of data than hyperscale cloud service providers. StackPath edge compute—including Virtual Machines and Containers—and edge applications—including CDN and WAF—are strategically located in the world’s most densely populated areas, and united by a secure private network backbone and a single management system. Customers ranging from Fortune 50 enterprises to one-person startups trust StackPath to give their latency-sensitive workloads and applications the speed, security, and efficiency they require. For more information, visit stackpath.com and follow StackPath at www.fb.com/stackpathllc and www.twitter.com/stackpath.  

  

**About the Role**  

We’re looking for an innovative and experienced Business Development Manager to develop new and potential accounts for our Edge Compute product at StackPath. This person works with prospective customers to explore the strengths and weaknesses of their current systems and to develop and implement an effective sales strategy for either individual or bundled solutions. The BDM owns the strategic selling process and communicates value to resolve client’s issues. This person is responsible for the orchestration of the sales process, including the implementation and transition process for new business.  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities*** Develop and execute a variety of comprehensive sales plans, both long and short term, to sell new business.
* Own the information base on prospective customers.
* Researching organizations, individual, and industry spend to find new opportunities.
* Increasing the value of current customers while attracting new ones.
* Write proposals that are detailed, innovative, lively and customer oriented.
* Prospecting and developing new markets and improving sales.
* Achieve new sales goals by managing and directing the sales process.
* Attending conferences, meetings, and industry events.
* Collaboration with operations to develop quotes and proposals for clients.
* Proposing goals for the development team and business growth and ensuring they are met.
* Develop extensive knowledge of StackPath’s products and services.
* Think and plan strategically and work effectively with the operations teams to achieve the budgeted results.

**Desired Skills and Experience*** Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or related field.
* Experience in sales, marketing or related field.
* Strong communication skills and IT fluency.
* Ability to manage complex projects and multi-task.
* Excellent organizational skills.
* Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty.
* Proficient in Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.

**Education*** Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field preferred.

  

**This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive.**  

**StackPath is an Equal Opportunity Employer. EOE/AA M/F/D/V**  

  

If your experience and qualifications match our current needs, a member of our human resources team will contact you. We look forward to hearing from you.  

StackPath collects and processes personal data submitted by job applicants in accordance with our Privacy Policy

title: Animal  Production Business Development Manager
description:
**Timac Agro Canada - Animal Production Business Development Manager**

**The Role**

Reporting directly to the General Manager of Canada, and working with a variety of stakeholders, you will provide technical expertise in the implementation of animal nutrition including marketing, business development, and training on operational and commercial support across Saskatchewan, Ontario, and Manitoba, and Quebec. Some of the roles and responsibilities are as follows:

Develop the AP range (prospecting, market research) and ensure their coherence in compliance with regulatory standards:

* Propose and deploy the necessary tools for the development of these ranges (training, sales arguments...).
* Coordinate and animate development projects.
* Coordinate the different professions related to the AP activity: industry, logistics, HR, R&D, regulatory, purchasing, management control, communication.
* Contribute to the development of new products and be in charge of their launch.
* Supervise the organization of tests and ensure their proper execution as well as the exploitation of the results.
* Ensure the interface between the AP development managers, the commercial teams and Groupe Roullier’s Global Innovation Centre

**Your experience:**

* 4 to 8 years of relevant professional experience
* A degree in Agronomy, Veterinary studies or Business
* Experience within the agriculture industry with a focus on Animal Nutrition (must have).
* Detail oriented, hardworking, and well-organized
* Ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities
* Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills
* Bilingual fluency (written and spoken) French and English is a **strong asset.**
* Customer-focused and entrepreneurial mindset
* Capacity to work in full autonomy
* Proficiency with Office 365 products

**About Timac Agro**

TIMAC AGRO is an industrial company specialized in soil nutrition, plant nutrition and animal production. We are currently present in 42 global subsidiaries: employing over 7,000 people and visiting 20,000 farmers each day. At TIMAC AGRO CANADA, our mission is to help Canadian farmers improve their productivity in pursuit of a sustainable and more profitable agriculture. Feeding the world is an exciting project, and we place it at the very heart of our products, processes, and services, anticipating our customers’ expectations:

* We provide practical, efficient, and environmentally friendly solutions through our comprehensive crop knowledge.
* We optimize the performance of livestock and maximize stock production potential.

Our intensive product research and development takes place at our Global Innovation Centre in St. Malo, France where we collaborate with more than 120 universities around the world.

TIMAC AGRO employees are passionate and committed to delivering quality technical advice and service to local farmers. Our employees value the ability to be a true leader and adapt to an environment, with a focus on entrepreneurship and innovation. With us, human qualities prevail over degrees or academic excellence. We are committed to exceptional performance and implement any process necessary to achieve set objectives. We continually strive to surpass and surprise, and like a challenge! TIMAC AGRO employees are continuously and methodically learning our products, their environment, and developing their expertise so they can perform to the best of their ability within their field of expertise! We cannot wait for you to join the adventure!

For more information on TIMAC AGRO please visit our website at https://ca.timacagro.com/

*Timac Agro Canada is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Timac Agro Canada is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Timac Agro Canada are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications without regard to race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, religious beliefs, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, physical disability, mental disability, marital status, family status, source of income, and sexual orientation or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Timac Agro Canada will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Timac Agro Canada encourages applicants of all ages.*

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Casual dress
* Company car
* Company events
* Dental care
* Employee assistance program
* Extended health care
* Flexible schedule
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* RRSP match
* Tuition reimbursement
* Work from home

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Animal Production/Nutrition/Agriculture: 3 years (required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Business Development Manager - Remote
description:
**About us**
------------

Our mission is simple, to Improve life through travel. Exodus Travels is one of the world’s leading adventure travel companies delivering extraordinary travelling experiences across more than 90 countries worldwide.


Providing unparalleled expertise and local knowledge, our exceptional guides on the ground and teams in our worldwide offices have been crafting amazing travel experiences for years.


Our values are to Bring Happiness, Take Responsibility, Be Ambitious and Always Passionate, they underpin the work that we do and act as a reminder of why we do it. We are looking for people who can embrace our values and live them every day.


**Our commitment to Equity, Diversity & Inclusion**
---------------------------------------------------

Together we will cultivate a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment, where all our people can flourish and are encouraged to be their unique selves. We are committing to implement meaningful change within our culture by increasing awareness of and counteracting unconscious bias, eradicating systemic barriers, embracing diversity, and engaging all employees in the process.


**Our commitment to People, Places & Planet**
---------------------------------------------


Our People, Places & Planet plan works towards improving life through travel - for the places we visit on our adventures, the people we meet when there, and the planet which hosts us.


**Summary**
-----------


In this role, you will manage the day-to-day relationships with key regional Trade Agents to deliver commercial growth in line with business objectives. This will be achieved by developing strong relationships with these agents, and the identification of growth opportunities. You will collaborate closely with partners both inside and outside of the business to find and resolve operational issues and to consistently achieve key performance indicators. You will also need to be focused on increasing sales and should be driven by the achievement of results.


You will form and develop strong partnerships with travel agents and work with new partnership organizations to form new customer channels. With autonomy to manage key accounts and source and develop new business opportunities, this role will be varied, diverse and fast paced.


**This position is remote anywhere in Ontario, Canada.**


**What you will be doing:**
---------------------------


* Identifying and nurturing growth opportunities with existing agency accounts as well as targeting new acquisition by leveraging strategic marketing campaigns, relationship management, sales and override reporting and implementation and prospecting.
* Ensuring product awareness through informative, relevant, and timely partner training and promotion at meetings, travel industry events, virtual and in person trainings and conferences throughout the United States.
* Managing all agent queries by responding within 24 hours of receiving initial requests and resolving conflicts that arise from agent sales in a timely manner.
* Leveraging technology to help improve engagement through video conferencing, social media and use of CRM.

**What we are looking for:**
----------------------------


* Travel industry Account Management experience, with knowledge of travel agents and key contacts
* Proven analytical and selling skills and an understanding of marketing activities
* Strong computer literacy, with excellent presentations and communication skills – PowerPoint, verbal and written.
* Ability to build relationships – team members, team leaders, other departments, managers, and customers.
* Self–motivated, target driven and enthusiastic
* A positive culture champion, who is energetic and encouraging of continuous improvement.
* Willingness to travel to meet partners for face-to-face meetings and training. Expected travel is 50% of the time
* Ability and confidence to resolve intensified client or booking issues independently.
* A willingness to work flexible days or hours to accommodate trade shows and agency needs—this can be a


combination of long days and nights, weekend work, and travel (domestic and international) on various occasions


Together we will cultivate a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment, where everyone can flourish. We are committed to driving change through increasing awareness of, and counteracting, unconscious bias; building an inclusive culture, and embracing diversity in all its dimensions


Travelopia is committed to ensuring a work environment that is open, accessible, and inclusive, removing barriers for all individuals. If you require accommodations/additional support to participate in the recruitment and selection process, kindly inform us. Our hiring team will work with you to provide suitable accommodations/additional in a timely and confidential manner. Information received will be handled with the utmost discretion.


To request accommodations, please contact our team at Talent@Travelopia.com


#LI-Remote #LI-HH1

title: Commercial Shipping Business Development Manager
description:
**Commercial Shipping Business Development Manager**

A rapidly growing international market leader is seeking a top performer for their Commercial Shipping Business Development Manager role. This key position will report directly to the National After Sales Manager. This is an exciting opportunity to work for a stable, family oriented, business with a tremendous culture and team environment.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement business development strategies focused on Commercial Shipping (new and after sales) and plans to drive revenue growth and meet or exceed sales targets.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients to foster loyalty and identify upselling and cross-selling opportunities.
* Identify new business and grow customer base.
* Conduct regular customer needs assessments to identify pain points, anticipate future requirements, and propose tailored solutions.
* Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to create effective Commercial Shipping programs, campaigns, and initiatives.
* Create detailed Opportunities for Quoting and Quote Commercial Shipping projects.
* Provide exceptional customer service by addressing and resolving customer complaints, concerns, and inquiries promptly and professionally.
* Conduct market research and analysis to identify emerging trends, customer preferences, and competitive strategies.
* Collaborate with internal teams, such as product development, operations, and finance, to ensure seamless delivery of services.
* Prepare and present regular reports on Commercial Shipping (new and after-sales) performance, customer feedback, and business development activities to management.
* Stay updated with industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices in Commercial Shipping to drive innovation and improve customer experience.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Required Skills/Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or related experience.
* Strong understanding of maritime and shipping sales strategies, customer relationship management, and sales processes.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and negotiate effectively with clients.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze market trends, customer data, and sales metrics.
* Self-motivated and results-oriented, with a track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
* Proficiency in CRM software and other relevant sales and marketing tools.
* Flexibility to travel for client meetings, industry events, and conferences.

**Benefits & Compensation:**

* Salary commensurate with experience
* Full medical & dental benefits, paid vacation & holidays, 401K, plus performance bonus
* Growth opportunities are available

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Travel requirement:

* Travel

Application Question(s):

* This position requires a background in maritime/shipping sales. Please briefly explain your background. If you do not have any, please do not apply.
* Do you have a strong understanding of shipping sales strategies? If so, please briefly explain. If you do not, please do not apply.

Work Location: Remote

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**Business Development Manager: Team USA**

  




Building upon the growth and impact of the Top Employer’s Certification Programme worldwide we are looking to recruit a new team to support North American HR Leaders in the development and branding of their organisations.

  



Top Employers Institute is the global authority recognising excellence in people practices. We assist companies to accelerate these practices and further enrich their worlds of work. Through the Top Employers programme, participants are audited, certified and recognised as employers of choice. Established more than 30 years ago, Top Employers Institute now certifies over 2,100 organisations in 121 countries. These certified companies positively impact the lives of over 9m employees globally.

  



The Business Development Manager directly generates revenue by prospecting for, positioning and selling the HR Certification Programme to multinational clients headquartered across North America.

  



**Key responsibilities**


* Responsible for new business development via prospecting, social selling, qualifying and consultative selling
* Drive sales growth and pipeline through the setting up of qualified meetings
* Be a subject matter expert and active promotor of Top Employers HR Certification
* Ability to connect with senior HR stakeholders and position the full value of the Programme across their areas of responsibility and areas of focus
* Work closely with Marketing to support events and follow up digital leads
* Achieve growth targets for new business acquisition
* Building a strong professional network by initiating contact with HR decision makers

  


**Companywide Competencies**


* Customer Focus: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions
* Collaboration: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
* Global Perspective: Taking a broad view when approaching issues, using a global lens

  


**Qualification Criteria**


* Bachelor degree (or equivalent)
* 4-7 years working experience in B2B consultative selling to C-suite level individuals, preferably in the field of HR Tech or HR Services
* Value Selling Skills: (meeting prep, conduct an effective needs analysis, deliver sales presentations, answer questions and handle objections)
* Negotiation skills: Knows how to prepare, how to make offers, how to respond to offers, how to respond to typical tactics, how to close, how to ensure the agreement lasts.
* Communication skills: Operate at the most senior level with confidence, can make formal persuasive presentations, can communicate 1-1 with confidence and discuss the company products/services and added value potential effectively.
* entrepreneurial mindset, looking to grow your designated territory.
* You must have a growth mindset.
* Experience in working with different cultures and nationalities
* Fluent in English in both writing and verbally. Any other language is a nice to have.
* Available for some travel to conferences, client sites and company meetings

  



**Top Employers Institute offers**

  


* Competitive base salary and commission plan
* Flexible working conditions, including the flexibility to work from home
* Dynamic and open business culture
* Plenty of room for initiatives and own responsibility
* Open career path: due to the fast growth of the organisation, many roles did not exist a year ago, and new career paths open up continuously
* Leader in HR, relied on by global clients such as PepsiCo, Pfizer, Mondelez and Volkswagen
* Fast growing organisation (20% revenue growth in 2021 & 2022), enabled by owner HAL Investments, which is one of the largest, long-term, investment companies of the Netherlands
* International environment: colleagues from all over the world and offices in 12 countries including the Netherlands, Spain, France, Germany, China, South Africa, the UK, Singapore, Poland and Brazil.
* As our client base is across the US we are looking to hiring someone in the Chicago area.

*Top Employers Institute is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and celebrate each other’s differences. We know that a diverse workforce enhances our success. We are conscious that having the freedom to be yourself is the basis of sustainable growth. To us, it doesn’t matter where you were born, what you believe in, how old you are, what you look like, or who you love. We believe that different perspectives and backgrounds actually lift Top Employers Institute to new heights and increase our way of thinking* *for a better world of work. Join us, as there is a place for you here!*

title: Manager-Business Development
description:
**Position Overview:**

The role of the Business Development Manager, Western Canada at Shoes For Crews is to develop and pursue new business opportunities across a defined geographic market and strategic verticals. As a sales leader, the BDM is responsible for driving growth in their territory through prospecting, building relationships, negotiating and closing deals and maintaining extensive knowledge of current market conditions.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Client acquisition - Leverage our comprehensive safety solution and product line to generate new customers in Western Canada. Understands the components of profitability in our business as well as the importance of profitable growth
* Build extensive pipeline of prospects both medium to large enterprise
* Must be able to clearly and effectively communicate (verbally/written) our corporate capabilities
* Generate leads and qualify in-bound leads
* Collaborate with internal and external partners
* Develop and conduct customer engagement strategies
* Develop and organize proposals, RFP responses, business plans, capabilities overviews, testimonials, case studies and ROI analysis to generate sales.
* Develop and negotiate contracts
* Drive increased revenue and profit to achieve the Company’s ambitious growth plan
* Build, manage and optimize B2B relationships
* Execute sales tactics and strategies to effectively manage pipeline into winning outcomes
* Work with C-Suite and other buying influences across a diverse segment profile
* Attend and manage relevant industry tradeshows and association events
* Gather and communicate information on competitor strategies


**Accountabilities and Performance Measures:**


* Achieves assigned sales targets.
* Meets assigned expectations for profitability.
* Achieves strategic customer objectives defined by company leadership.
* Completes strategic account plans that meet company standards.
* Maintains high new customer satisfaction ratings that meet company standards.
* Completes required training and development objectives within assigned time frame.


**Organizational Alignment:**


* Reports to the Director of Sales, Canada
* Enlists the support of sales support, business development team, implementation resources, product managers, and other sales and management resources as needed.
* Closely coordinates company executive involvement with customer management.
* Works closely with Customer Service Representatives to ensure customer satisfaction and problem resolution.


**Core Competencies:**


* Deliver Results. Ensure that we achieve Shoes For Crews projections, goals and objectives and the discipline, organization and perseverance to deliver outstanding customer service.
* Act Commercially. Have the ability to gather and make sense of large amounts of information and apply it to make business and customer focused decisions. Analyze problems thoroughly and make good and timely decisions.
* Manage Self. Manage emotions to remain calm, focused and optimistic while dealing with a constant stream of demands. Display courage when required to make tough decisions.
* Team player. Collaborative. Build relationships with Sales Support, Operations, Business Development Specialists, Retail, and business support employees to achieve our mission.
* Display Leadership. Inspire others to achieve company objectives and hold them accountable for high standards of performance. Make our sales team effective and hold individuals to account.


**Minimum Requirements:**


* Bachelor’s Degree is required
* 5 years’ experience in selling complex B2B enterprise accounts
* Solid analytical skills and financial acumen with the ability to balance the constraints of the business model while remaining creative and resourceful in meeting company’s needs
* Experience in competitive analysis and price-to-win analysis
* The ability to thrive in a competitive, results-driven environment is essential
* Demonstrated ability to develop relevant strategic plans and successfully execute related tactical objectives.
* Professional written and verbal communication skills
* Strong organizational and planning skills
* Proficient with a leading CRM solution (preferably Salesforce.com), Microsoft Office software including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
* Travel required
* Proof of COVID19 Vaccination Required upon hire


.

title: Business Development Manager - Quebec
description:
**Position:** Business Development Manager

**Status:** Full Time

**Department:** Sales

**Reports to:** Director, Sales

**Location:** Quebec

**Position Description:**

In this role you will explore opportunities for developing and growing sales with key retail partners and increasing market share for all TravelBrands divisions including Intair, Exotik Journeys, Encore Cruises, Sunquest and more in your assigned territory.

**Key Results and Activities:**

* Develop a keen awareness of your client base, their clients and needs to promote and sell our product. Assist in marketing initiatives, promotions and other tactical ideas to enhance their sales. Strong focus on consolidation
* Through research and analysis, identify business development opportunities and initiatives for your territory
* Maintain a schedule of the agencies within your territory, including sales calls and agent trainings to ensure they are educated and focused on our product
* Implement sales goals and strategies as outlined by your Sales Division
* Analyze and review weekly sales reports for your territory and submit online weekly call summary and mileage reports
* Gather and communicate market intelligence from the field to your direct report on a weekly basis
* Attend, participate in and lead product presentations, training seminars, sales meetings, fam trips, conferences and consumer shows as assigned
* Maintain updated knowledge of all TravelBrands product, services, promotions, procedures, and technologies, as well as a general knowledge of the Travel Industry, and other Tour Operators’ product
* Meet territory performance targets
* All other related tasks as required

**Specialized Knowledge, Skills, Attributes Required**

* Superior communication and presentation skills
* Great sales and customer service skills
* Able to persuade and negotiate
* Results oriented with ability to multi-task
* Ability to develop long-term customer relationships
* Works well under pressure able to meet deadlines
* Organizational and time management skills
* Patience and professionalism
* Superior knowledge of MS Office including PowerPoint and Social Media tools

**Academic Qualifications and Experience** 

* Post-secondary Travel/Tourism school diploma is an asset
* Minimum of 5 years of travel industry experience and/or 3 years tour operator experience

**Working Conditions**

* Home based with much of your work while on the road (must have a valid driver’s license)
* Must be flexible to work evenings and weekends as required
* Requires travel – for sales calls, FAM trips, product launches, conferences, meetings and more

**Who We Are**

Red Label Vacations Inc., a division of the H.I.S. Group, is one of Canada’s largest travel companies. Incorporated in 2004, Red Label Vacations owns and operates multiple wholesale and retail travel brands. The retail division; including redtag.ca, itravel2000.com, Sunquest, The Travel Experts, Flights.ca and Cruises.ca; offers diverse products to travelers including destination packages, flights and hotels worldwide, excursions and more. The wholesale travel business, TravelBrands, provides a full range of travel products including air, hotel, car rental, cruise and specialty to travel agents and retail agencies throughout Canada. Red Label Vacations is a comprehensive one-stop shop for agents and travelers alike.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

* Dental care
* Employee assistance program
* Extended health care
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* RRSP match
* Vision care
* Work from home

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* travel industry: 5 years (preferred)
* business development manager: 5 years (preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**ROLE:** Business Development Manager (Sobeys)

**REPORTS TO:** Director of Sales - East

**LOCATION:** Toronto (GTA) - Remote

We are looking for a Business Development Manager to join our Sales Team! The Business Development Manager will play a crucial role in the growth and profitability of Earth’s Own. For the assigned customers, this individual will lead the development and execution of Earth’s Own annual sales plan, is accountable to achieve sales plan targets, and build strong customer relationships.

**Opportunities**

This is a very exciting time for the Sales Teamas we continue to grow and expand! You will have the opportunity to represent an incredible brand that is driving huge growth in the marketplace, with direct accountability for a National Retail Customer, one of our largest portfolios! This includes building strong customer relationships and influencing retailer strategies and tactics in an evolving and exciting category! Your top priority will be to deliver your annual sales plan. This includes ensuring distribution across our product base, strong promotional plans, and flawless execution on new products. An analytical approach and bias for action will be critical to achieving your objectives and leaving your imprint on the business!

**Here is who you are…**

***Drive & motivation***

· You are passionate about healthy living and the importance of healthy food choices

***Character & Abilities***

· You have 3+ years in a key account role in the food/beverage category

· You have experience working directly with Canada’s Largest Grocers

title: Business Development Manager - North America (EAST)
description:
InnovMarine’s growth is fueling new opportunities for us across North America and opening new roles on our sales team.

We are seeking a passionate individual to take on the challenge of building our business within the Ship Maintenance, Repair and Operation (MRO) market in Eastern North America.

In addition to your passion for sales and the success of our customer’s business, you are highly organized, self-directed, and thrive on teamwork and helping others succeed. Always giving your best and building lasting relationships is what drives you. You’re looking for a place where hard work and fun go together.

If this describes you, then you’re the person we want to hear from.

*This permanent remote position is open to candidates currently residing in Eastern North America with valid work authorization.*

**About the Role:** 

We are seeking a dynamic and entrepreneurial Business Development professional with a proven history of launching new products and/or services in ship operation and maintenance markets. As a key contributor to our growing business, you will be responsible for handling all aspects of the sales process, focusing on new accounts development. Reporting to the CEO, it is expected that you will fully contribute to the development and execution of the sales and marketing strategy for Canada and US.

**Responsibilities include:**

· Pursue and establish long-term, trusting relationships that convert prospects into lasting, loyal customers.

· Work with our Consulting and Technical Services team to develop and propose solutions that maximize the value of our customer’s investment in our products and services.

· Develop, implement, and execute on sales plans that leverage proven sales methodologies.

· Work closely and collaboratively with our internal stakeholders to build and execute successful sales campaigns that position InnovMarine for long-term success in our chosen markets.

· Document using the CRM sales activities and provide overview of opportunity funnel.

**QUALIFICATIONS AND COMPETENCIES**

· You’ve got a competitive attitude, with a minimum of 5 years sales experience in B2B sales of software products and related services. Preference will be given to candidates with experience in the marine or offshore industry.

· You are experienced in engaging with and navigating through all parts of an organization, from the business process owner up to the C-Suite.

· You have solid business acumen built from experience; every customer is different. You listen, distinguish, and then tailor a solution that fits the unique environment of your customer.

· You have a passion to help businesses improve. Our approach to industry is unique and provides measurable ROI.

· You see ambiguity as an opportunity to demonstrate value. You’re a pioneer, looking to make a big impact and thrive in a fast-moving, dynamic environment.

· You have experience selling in the United States.

· You are willing and able to travel 30-40% of the time.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $70,000.00-$80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Automobile allowance
* Company events
* Company pension
* Dental care
* Disability insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Extended health care
* Flexible schedule
* Life insurance
* RRSP match
* Wellness program
* Work from home

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus pay
* Commission pay

Work Location: Remote

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**POSITION ANNOUNCEMENT (December 2023):**  
**BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER****\\_\\_**  
**Position Overview**  
Lux is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Business Development Manager to play a  
critical role in identifying and pursuing federal contracting opportunities. The successful  
candidate will be responsible for conducting in-depth market research, analyzing Requests for  
Information (RFIs) and Requests for Proposals (RFPs), and leading the development of capture  
plans for priority opportunities. This role will involve close collaboration with the executive  
team to ensure a strategic and methodical approach to winning federal contracts.  
The position is full-time with benefits. The position is primarily remote/telework, although  
occasional travel to meetings, training, or other events may be required.  
**Essential Functions**

* Utilize various tools and systems, including SAM.gov, eBuy, agency forecasts, and other

relevant sources, to identify and track federal contracting opportunities.

* Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the federal contracting landscape and market

trends. Have a deep understanding of federal RFPs and contracting requirements.

* Analyze RFXs to assess fit with Lux's capabilities, identify the client's needs and

constraints, and determine the potential competitiveness and alignment of opportunities  
with Lux's strategic objectives.

* Present identified opportunities for consideration at Business Development (BD)

meetings with senior leadership.

* Conduct preliminary bid/no-bid meetings to prioritize opportunities that warrant

additional capture efforts.

* Lead and manage the process of conducting capture strategy meetings with cross-

functional teams.

* Design and implement comprehensive capture plans for priority opportunities, outlining

the strategy, tactics, and resources required for success.

* Provide senior management with summaries of RFPs and key details.
* Develop outlines and proposal templates based on RFP requirements.
* Create compliance matrices to ensure proposal responsiveness and alignment with client

needs.

* Identify and pitch compelling win themes and differentiators for each opportunity,

highlighting the company's strengths and value proposition.

* Conduct gap analyses of RFX requirements, identifying areas where additional

information or resources are needed to strengthen the proposal/bid.

* Develop a comprehensive and competitive staffing strategy plan that outlines the key

personnel, skill sets, and qualifications required to meet the RFX requirements.

* Provide input and insights into the competitive pricing strategy, ensuring it reflects the

strengths and value proposition of the staffing plan.

* Create a qualified teaming partner selection criteria based on the gap analysis of Lux's

capabilities and the requirements of the RFX.

* Structure the qualifications of the winning team based on customer knowledge and a

detailed analysis of the RFX requirements.

* Develop and implement a teaming partner strategy plan after receiving approval from

senior management.

* Collaborate with potential teaming partners to build mutually beneficial relationships and

ensure a cohesive approach to the opportunity.

* Provide essential support to senior management in the finalization of teaming

agreements, Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs), consultant agreements, and any other  
contractual arrangements necessary to pursue the opportunity.

* Provide support for proposal development efforts as requested. Anticipated proposal

development support may include: Coordinate proposal kick off meetings, Create  
proposal development timelines and support scheduling/coordination of color team  
reviews, Support the development of or response to partner data call requests.  
**Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree
* Minimum five (5) years of recent and successful experience as a full-time Business

Development professional in the federal contracting marketplace. Preference will be  
given to candidates with experience and current understanding of HHS agencies, ED,  
and/or NSF.

* Thorough understanding of federal government business cycles, bid, and RFP processes.
* A working knowledge of various procurement and contracting methodologies, contract

types and procurement processes.

* Excellent organizational, communication, writing and most importantly, interpretation

skills.

* Track record of developing and maintaining various pipelines.
* Competitive work ethic to pursue new lines of business, customers and partners.
* A strong commitment to maintaining the confidentiality and security of sensitive and

proprietary information, both within the company and in dealings with external parties.  
**Lux Consulting Group, Inc.**  
Lux Consulting Group, Inc. (Lux) is a dynamic, award-winning small business providing  
professional services to help government and non-government agencies run social and scientific  
programs at the local, national and international levels. Lux operates as a remote/telework/virtual  
workplace with headquarters in College Park, MD. Lux is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

**What We Offer**

* A fun, dynamic working environment with an energetic and diverse team
* An inclusive culture where everyone is welcome
* Competitive compensation commensurate with experience
* Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
* Short & Long Term Disability in addition to Life Insurance (company sponsored)
* 401k Retirement Savings Plan through ADP (after 3 months of employment)
* Paid Time Off (PTO)

**Status/Salary Range:** Full Time / $77,400.00 - $109,366.00  
**EEO**  
Lux is proud to be a minority-led, Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to building a  
diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and can bring their whole selves  
to work. We believe a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us  
better serve the needs of our customers and we celebrate diversity in all forms. As an Equal  
Opportunity Employer, we are committed to living out these values in all aspects of hiring,  
employee engagement and retention.  
**How to Apply**  
Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their resumes, along with a cover letter  
highlighting their relevant experience and explaining their interest in this role. Please include  
specific examples of successful business development efforts in the federal contracting arena.  
Resumes and cover letters should be submitted to HR@luxcg.com with a courtesy copy to  
Amanda.Greathouse@luxcg.com. Please include “Application for BD Manager: [Your Name]”  
in the email subject line.\\_ Resumes submitted without a cover letter will not be considered.\\_  
***www.luxcg.com/open-positions/***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $77,400.00 - $109,366.00 per year

title: Business Development Manager
description:
IQ Wired was founded in 2003. We have a strong culture, rock-solid reputation and financial performance. We help Clients buy and manage telecom and technology. Our values are Performance, Integrity, Partnership and Entrepreneurship and we are looking for people who are excited about building things and making an impact. We are looking for individuals to join our team who are passionate about working in a collaborative environment where everyone believes in achieving the highest standards.  



**MISSION AND POSITION SUMMARY:**


This acquisition sales position will contribute to the success of IQ Wired Inc’s direct team by maintaining 4 to 6 times revenue in the sales funnel to consistently sell $7000 per month in net-MRC revenue. Our Sales Reps drive new business and execute strategic sales plans by meeting and exceeding target revenue in the sales of multi-carrier telecommunications and technology services to mid-sized and enterprise customers. Since they are building a residual base of customers and income our BDM’s are incented to maintain long term relationships with their customers where they can add value as a business partner.


**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**


* Skill in selling which involves effective prospecting, funnel management, customer qualification, and closing techniques
* Facilitation/negotiation abilities
* Ability to effectively organize and prioritize tasks based on importance with a sense of urgency
* Technical knowledge of telecommunications industry/products/services
* Aptitude for learning new technologies and sales strategies to maintain product knowledge and credibility
* Ability to prospect for new customers through existing relationships or through acquisition efforts such as cold calling, cold walking, networking, or miscellaneous lead generation tactics to achieve 10 customer meetings per week
* Proficiency in consulting with I.T. decision makers for companies with 100+ employees. Ability to identify and analyze customer needs in order to create and effectively communicate customized quotes/presentations of multi-carrier products and services to customer
* Ability to act as an escalation point for service issues encountered by customer and engage appropriate Carrier or internal resources (Management) to resolve
* Proven ability to forecast with 80% or better accuracy on monthly basis after six (6) months
* **Represent Company Values**
	+ **Performance.** Get Stuff Done (GSD)!
	+ **Integrity.** Honesty, work ethic, pride in work
	+ **Partnership.** Mutual respect, anti-entitlement, teamwork
	+ **Entrepreneurship.** Desire and enthusiasm to learn and to work toward personal growth and growth of the organization which you have the ability to directly impact
* **Calm under pressure.**

**COMPETENCIES/REQUIREMENTS:**


* **Flexible**. Ability to be flexible and adaptive in decisions and actions to facilitate the most productive work environment with minimal structure
* **Responsiveness.** Must respond to all internal and external requests within SLA time-frames if applicable, otherwise by sundown. *We are a hyper-responsive group with very sensitive expectations*
* **Self-motivated and self-responsible.** Ability work independently with minimal supervision in a virtual environment
* **Teamwork.** Ability to interact with peers, Leadership, providers, customers and other departments in a respectful, partner-like fashion
* **Communication.** Ability to actively listen and work toward win/win resolutions
* **Time Management.** Effectively manage your time successfully, prioritize effectively, reprioritize regularly and communicate with stakeholders
* **Computer Skills.** Intermediate to advanced computer skills including an in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
* **Attendance.** In person and virtual attendance at Company events and trainings, to be determined by Leadership
* **Office.** This role requires occasional time in the office to develop and maintain relationships with colleagues Subject to change. This is a hybrid remote position that supports working in a stable, dedicated and secure home office (must meet security standards)
* **Core Hours.** Present and responsive during the core daytime hours of 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM Mountain Time
  


*Duties, requirements, functions and skills all subject to change at any time*

title: Business Development Manager
description:
For more than 40 years, Calian has been solving the world’s most complex problems by pairing the brightest minds with powerful technology. Calian solutions impact the world; from the satellites in space that connect us to the farms that feed us, from the medical professionals who care for us to the governments, schools and companies that make the world better every day.

**Position Overview**  
The Business Development Manager is a valued member of our Software Defined Solutions team and plays a pivotal role in business success. You will actively seek and pursue new business opportunities, develop and foster relationships with current and prospective clients, and drive profitable growth for the business.

**Responsibilities**

* Drive profitable growth by expanding business unit revenues and enhancing product offerings
* Establish and foster relationships with new and existing customers, ensuring their satisfaction and capturing their unique requirements
* Lead solicited and unsolicited proposals, verify cost estimates, and justifications for our senior leadership team
* Monitor project performance against technical costs and schedule objectives, implementing recovery plans for any identified shortfalls
* Maintain close collaboration with program controls, finance teams, project managers, and senior leadership to ensure effective project management
* Ensure projects have adequate resources to accomplish the work. Resolve resource deficiencies in consultation with senior leadership
* Engage with customers and attend design reviews to ensure satisfaction with project progress

**Qualifications**

* Post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field
* 10+ years experience in a project-centric environment, coupled with demonstrated experience in business development and project management
* Willing and able to travel internationally and adhere to international travel requirements as determined by the Government
* You will have the ability to meet the requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Program
* You will be able to obtain a Government Security Clearance at the Reliability level

**Why Work for Calian**

**Work Environment**

* No one-size fits all! We give teams freedom of choice in building an ideal work environment.
* Flexible hours, on-site, hybrid, or work from home options depending on the role requirements.

**Impact**  
Calian is a publicly traded company that keeps the world moving forward.We inspire confidence in our customers’ ability to communicate, innovate, learn, and lead safe and healthy lives.This confidence is achieved through synchronized efforts across our organization to provide our customers with solutions inAdvancedTechnologies, Health, Learning, and IT& Cyber Solutions. This role is part of our corporate team and will work closely with all internal clients who support these business units

**Growth and Innovation**  
Calian is a technology company with an aggressive growth agenda based on our ability to solve significant and complex problems for our customers. In this role, you will be a key member of the Calian.  
We put our people first. We encourage employees to advance their Calian career through professional development and corporate career. Calian is an innovative and growing organization—have your ideas heard by pitching to senior leadership through the Calian Idea Contest!

**Culture**  
We lead with trust. We reinforce personal responsibility and accountability. Calian fosters collaboration through open communication and promotes an environment of learning and professional growth.

**Diversity and Inclusion**  
Calian fosters an environment that allows employees to maximize their potential, by nurturing a culture where everyone is valued for their differences.

**Total Rewards**

* Robust company-paid benefits for you and your family starting on your first day. Includes health, dental, vision, employee assistance program (EAP), disability and life insurance for our employees and their dependants. Calian covers the cost of benefit premiums!
* Generous time off package that includes paid sick time, volunteer day, family leave days, and paid shutdown period between December 25 and January 1
* A balanced approach to work and life as we understand the importance of your personal lives
* Stock purchase plan with additional contribution from Calian
* RRSP Matching Program

**CEO Quote**  
And according to our CEO… **“A freaking awesome team!”**

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Remote

title: Business Development Manager (Zapyrus - Medtech)
description:
**Business Development Manager**


Lumerate is growing rapidly, and we're searching for a **Business Development Manager** to join our Zapyrus Team for the journey! Read this job description carefully. ***Please note that applications without a cover letter will not be considered.***


**Who is Lumerate?**


We help our customers achieve the full picture of their industries. We also strive to achieve our own personal full pictures from a career fulfillment and learning perspective. We're in the business of gathering intelligence about industries and delivering it to the right people within those industries through innovative software interfaces. Our vision is to be the world's most useful and trusted source of information for professionals seeking to understand what's happening in their industry.


Our mission: To deliver industry awareness to an ever-increasing number of people, in whatever way helps them to make the most informed decisions, take the most immediate action and be the most awesome at their unique jobs.


‍**All about Zapyrus:**


Zapyrus, Lumerate's second product, is an intelligence tool designed for sales professionals in the MedTech industry to understand what is happening in their niches. Today MedTech service providers such as CROs, quality, regulatory, design & engineering, and manufacturing houses all over the world trust Zapyrus for their sales research. Zapyrus is on an exciting growth journey in its early days and we are excited to find like minded individuals seeking the opportunity to experience firsthand how a brand grows from initial launch to market maturity.


**What the role looks like:**


Reporting to our Commercial Director, the primary responsibilities of the position will be:


1) attainment of monthly new pipeline growth goals in the form of Zapyrus-initiated outreach to new prospects.


2) attainment of monthly new logo MRR (Monthly Recurring Revenue) targets for closed business, from either inbound or an outbound account list owned/generated by you.


3) growth the Monster Prospect List (MPL) by uncovering new prospective accounts to add to Salesforce CRM


**Other day-to-day responsibilities include:**


* Moving sales opportunities through the sales pipeline through to a close
* Hunting for new access routes into prospect companies
* Prospecting into service provider companies that sell to MedTech OEMs
* Hosting DEMO calls
* Hosting trial onboarding calls
* Hosting trial debrief calls and contract negotiations
* Building prospect and client relationships with service providers to the medtech OEM
* Researching MedTech CROs, CMOs, design firms, regulatory agencies prospects
* Initiating cold outreach to viable prospects through whichever methods you deem to be most effective
* Being the eyes and ears for product feedback that will lead to increased revenue and improved user retention
* Identifying new early adopters and early majority prospects for Zapyrus
* Helping develop content and messaging that facilitates expansion of our overall sales organization


**Who will be successful in this role?**


* An excellent communicator who can effectively convey ideas and emotions via email, phone, video conferencing and in-person interactions
* Someone with a client-focused and problem solving mindset
* An empathetic team player with an entrepreneurial mindset
* Someone who is passionate about building relationships
* A life-long learner who prioritizes learning and development and strives for growth
* A strategic thinker who loves solving puzzles
* Someone who is deeply inquisitive
* An optimist with contagious enthusiasm
* Someone who is detail-oriented and likes puzzles. In your cover letter include the word located at these coordinates 43.63612711640289, -79.44091416807237.


**What we'd love to see in your previous work experience:**


* Closing experience in SaaS
* B2B selling experience
* Cold prospecting experience
* A Medtech background (worked in a medtech company in the past or have an educational background that exposes them to medtech. Engineering, chemistry, materials science, etc...)
* A proven track record of selling success


**Why Lumerate? Fancy perks etc.**


* Help shape the future of a bootstrapped and profitable Canadian tech company
* Grow with an experienced team with skills in machine learning, development, business and organizational culture
* Earn yourself some equity (employee options make up 20% of the value of the company at all times)
* Join us for our annual all-company retreat when we reach our goals (past destinations include Bermuda, Iceland, Costa Rica, Portugal and Dominican Republic)
* Three weeks paid vacation + statutory holidays
* Earn additional paid vacation days with continued learning ($1000 annual stipend for courses and classes)
* Attend optional weekly social events (both virtual and in person)
* Take part in our Employee Giving Program (you choose the causes and the company provides the funds)
* Basic and extended health and dental benefits
* Paid maternal and parental leave


**Salary:**


* Base salary $70 - $100K, OTE $90K - $130K, depending on experience
* Uncapped monthly bonuses and commissions (based on achievement of targets)


**Location:**


If the successful candidate is based in the Greater Toronto Area, he/she/they can choose to participate in our hybrid experience, by working from home 2 days/week, while enjoying the benefits of in-person interactions at our Toronto office 3 days/week.


If our successful candidate is based elsewhere in Canada, he/she/they will work remotely 100% of the time.


Apply today by submitting your cover letter and resume. We look forward to hearing from you!


*At Lumerate we celebrate diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are passionate about fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Lumerate is an equal-opportunity employer, and we are committed to working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.*

title: Business Development Manager - Preclinical Ocular Services
description:
**Business Development Manager - Ocular Specialty In Vivo Services**

**Location: East Coast USA (Local Travel Required)**


Pharmaron is a leading R&D service provider in the life sciences industry, with a global presence in China, the U.S., and the U.K. We specialize in research, development, and manufacturing services across small molecules, biologics, and cell and gene therapy products.


We are seeking a motivated Business Development Manager to drive growth in Ocular Specialty In Vivo Services. The role involves selling preclinical and bioanalytical services in ophthalmology to companies developing small molecules, ocular devices, biologics, and advanced therapies.

 **Who we are looking for:**

* Master's or higher degree in a relevant field (Biotechnology, Molecular Biology, Ophthalmology).
* Post qualification experience within a Life science industry or similar prior to moving into a business development role
* 2+ years of business development/sales experience in ocular preclinical services.
* Results-oriented with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ambitious individual passionate about the biotechnology industry.
* Familiarity with CRM software, preferably Salesforce.
* Strong understanding of the biotechnology industry and preclinical research.
* Exceptional communication and negotiation skills.
* Motivated to adapt to evolving industry trends.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Identify and pursue new business opportunities in the ocular preclinical space.
* Generate sales to achieve individual and team targets.
* Increase market penetration through new contact meetings, RFP activity, and proactive proposals.
* Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders.
* Provide direction for marketing activities to generate leads and build brand awareness.
* Collaborate with the scientific team for effective client communication.
* Utilize CRM software for managing client interactions and tracking sales opportunities.

**Benefits:**


Pharmaron offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision insurance, 401k with employer match, and more.


Pharmaron is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

title: Media Manager
description:
1. Overall experience should be 12 to 14 years
  

2. Strong work experience with Media customers

4. Prepare set RSA - Requirement study agenda
  

5. Set up RSQ - Requirement study questionnaire
  

6. Circulate RSQ among stakeholders and record the response
  

7. Conduct requirement elicitation
  

8. Capture Functional Requirements or Non-Functional Requirements
  

9. Analyze the requirement - By applying various technique
  

10. Solve the real business problem by analysing the requirement - Fill those gaps
  

11. Understand - Basic researchabout customer and the business background
  

12. Organize and manage the requirement gathered - Prioritize
  

13. Design the solution - Application overview
  

14. Document the designed solution - BRD, FRD, PDD,SRD, FSD, FRS, etc.,

16. Provide walkthrough the internal and external stakeholder

21. Record lessons learned and circulate within team members

title: Quality Analyst
description:
**Technology Quality****,** **Technology**
------------------------------------------


**Quality Analyst**
===================


Closing date for applications: 13/03/2024


Gurugram, India


Permanent


Full Time


#R-00229438


  
**Join our digital revolution in NatWest Digital X**
----------------------------------------------------


In everything we do, we work to one aim. To make digital experiences which are effortless and secure.


So we organise ourselves around three principles: engineer, protect, and operate. We engineer simple solutions, we protect our customers, and we operate smarter.


Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From hybrid working to flexible hours, we have plenty of options that help our people to thrive.



This role is based in India and as such all normal working days must be carried out in India.


**Job description**
-------------------



Join us as a Quality Analyst

* If you have a keen eye for detail, then this could be the role for you as you make sure that only well designed and built work packages get through quality testing
* You’ll be the quality conscience of the team, assisting them to write and maintain automated tests as a standard way of working
* Joining us in this fast paced role, you'll have excellent opportunities for progression and developing your analyst capabilities
* We're offering this role at associate level

**What you'll do**
------------------


As a Quality Analyst, you’ll be assisting the feature team to define testable work that is technically robust, high performing, stable and secure and ensures excellent customer experiences and outcomes. Promoting continuous improvement, you’ll identify opportunities to maximise the customer experience and reduce the test cycle time by improving techniques, tooling, eliminating waste and creating a collaborative, proactive approach to quality in the feature team.


As well as this, you’ll be:

* Supporting the Quality Manager and the team in executing against the test strategy and quality by determining and advising which tests should be automated at which layer
* Making sure that test plans are adequately covered by test scenarios
* Creating different test and automation suites, such as smoke tests, full regression and progression tests, and end-to-end system regression tests
* Analysing the results of automated tests
* Providing data to the business and the team that focuses on quality and quality improvement

**The skills you'll need**
--------------------------


We’re looking for someone with an extensive understanding of all stages of the product or service life cycle. This will include in-depth and hands on experience in areas such as product testing, static testing, systems testing, systems integration testing, user acceptance testing, compliance testing and operational readiness testing.


Along with this, you’ll have experience of applying a wide range of testing automation tooling, as well as testing methodologies, including a range of Agile testing methods such as test driven development and behaviour driven development.


We’ll also expect:

* Experience of Python, ETL testing, test plan and providing estimations for a set of modules
* Experience in functional and non-functional testing such as system, system integration, user, load, volume, stress, security, accessibility, compatibility, penetration and back-out
* At least five years of experience in software testing
* Knowledge of SQL, Snowflake and data warehouse
* Good collaboration and stakeholder management skills

title: Deputy Manager
description:
**Working at Freudenberg:** "We will wow your world!" This is our promise. As a global technology group, we not only make the world cleaner, healthier and more comfortable, but also offer our 51,000 employees a networked and diverse environment where everyone can thrive individually. Be surprised and experience your own wow moments.
  
  

Chem-Trend, a company of the Freudenberg Group, is a global leader in the development, manufacture and marketing of specialized release agents, purging compounds and related processing aids, with manufacturing and R & D operations in North and South America, Europe and Asia that are supported by its headquarters in Michigan, USA. Chem-Trend has a singular focus of providing innovative solutions for the die casting, polyurethane, rubber, composites, tire, thermoplastic and wood composite industries.
  
  

Some of your Benefits
  
  

Diversity & Inclusion
  
  

**Diversity & Inclusion:** We focus on providing an inclusive environment and recognize our diversity contributes to our success.
  
  

Sustainability & Social Commitment

Safe Environment

Personal Development

Health Insurance

India - Remote
  
  

Remote
  
  

Chem-Trend Chemicals Co. Pvt. Ltd.

Deputy Sales Manager - Rubber, West (F/M/D)
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

Managing sales target, growing the market share in each segment and developing new business through effective lead management in the West Region.
  
  

Responsible for achieving efficiency in receivables, forecast and delivery performance.
  
  

Managing distributor and working with them to grow the sales and collect payments.
  
  

Communicating with target customers and managing customer relationships.
  
  

Conducting trials, developing key account plan & strategies, maintaining, and updating customer databases.
  
  

Managing budgets, plan monthly travel based on business requirement. Monitoring competitor activity and timely reporting the same to the manager.
  
  

Coordinate with R&D for new product development and understand customer requirements to excel Chem-Trend product performance and services.
  
  

Collaboratively work with CSS and back-end team to deliver delightful customer satisfaction.
  
  

Conduct training for customers to ensure proper application and handling of products by operators.
  
  

Provide technical assistance to customers and troubleshoot product and process issues.
  
  

Attending the trade shows, technical seminars and webinars to upgrade knowledge, gain updates on industrial developments and improve networking in Rubber Industry.
  
  

Conduct trials to develop business in Rubber NVH, Friction, Seals, Gaskets, Transmission belt segments, EVA, Hose pipe and conveyor belt application.
  
  

Qualifications
  
  

Diploma/Graduation/Engineering in Rubber or Chemical with 4 to 5 years of sales experience in rubber specialty Chemicals or R&D/Manufacturing experience in Rubber parts manufacturing industry.
  
  

Ability to travel intensively in the region.
  
  

Good hold on local languages and proficient in English communication.
  
  

The Freudenberg Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion.
